In 2007, Amalia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Amalia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the her children.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Judi Del Carmen

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA  JUDI DEL CARMEN O. A. TIENE 34 AÑOS Y VIVE EN EL BARRIO SAN ANTONIO DE LA CIUDAD DE TARIJA, LA SRA. JUDI ES CASADA CON EL SEÑOR SANTIAGO BARRIOS CARI Y VIVEN EN CASA DE SU MADRE . LA SRA. JUDI TRABAJA EN LA ALCALDIA DE TARIJA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A TEJER PRENDAS DE VESTIR JUNTO CON SU MADRE , ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZAN DESDE HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO.                                                                              

LA SEÑORA JUDI FORMO UN HOGAR DONDE TIENE UNA HIJA DE 6 AÑOS Y EN UN FUTURO  SUEÑA TENER NIETOS, ELLA NOS CUENTA QUE LA CASITA DONDE VIVEN ESTA MUY VIEJA Y ESTAN EN CONSTRUCION DE UNA NUEVA DONDE LE FALTARON RECURSOS PARA LA CONCLUSION DE LA OBRA, ES POR ESO QUE AHORA SOLICITAN UN CREDITO QUE SERA DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE MATERIAL DE CONSTRUCION PARA DE ESTE MODO TERMINAR CON EL SUEÑO QUE TIENE DE TERMINAR DE CONTRUIR SU CASITA PARA DARLE COMODIDAD A SU FAMILIA EN ESPECIAL A SU MADRE.

                                                                                                                                                               LA SEÑORA JUDI NOS CUENTA QUE SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES PODER COMPRARSE UN LOTE DE TERRENO PARA QUE SEA FELIZ ELLA Y SU FAMILIA Y NO SUFRAN POR FALTA DE UNA CASA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judi del Carmen O. A. is 34 years old and lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of Tarija. She is married to Mr. Santiago Barrios Cari, and they live in her mother’s house. Mrs. Judi works in the Tarija mayor’s office, and she also works weaving clothing together with her mother, which they have been doing for a long time. Judi has set up a home where she has a 6-year-old daughter, and in the future, she dreams of having grandchildren. She tells us that the small house in which they live is very old, and they are in the process of constructing a new one, but the family was missing the resources necessary for the completion of the project. For this reason, they are now asking for a loan which will be used to purchase construction materials so that Judi can achieve her dream to finish the construction of her house to give her family, especially her mother, the comfort of a home. Judi tells us that her biggest dream is to be able to buy a plot of land so that she and her family can be happy and they do not suffer from not having a home.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and completion of home's construction

loans.name: Joel Ntakaine

texts.en:
Joel has been a wheat farmer for 10 years now. He is 32 years old and married to Elizah Kaamamia. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and on time.  He plans to use cash from this loan to buy pesticides and fertiliser for his wheat crops.

In the future, Joel hopes he will be able to buy his own tractor and combine harvester.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and pesticides for his wheat crop

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheap Chann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people make up this village bank loan and they live in Krapeu Troum village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sopheap C., who is 59 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sopheap C. is a land broker who is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. H. H., operates a trailer and is also able to earn some money to support his family.

Although they both try to work hard they are able to earn only a little money. So, to improve their family living, Mrs. Sopheap C. is applying for a loan to buy rice to sell to start a new business to increase her income this year.

Mrs. Sopheap C. is the mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger B. is from the town of Dumabel Aglipay, Quirino. He is 41 years old. Roger is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Roger owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector, operating a motorcycle transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roger joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. Roger is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of motorcycle. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Roger from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for the maintenance of motorcycle.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina P. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, okra and eggplant and is requesting a loan to stock sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes to sell.

Selina is 49 years old and is widowed. She has seven children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send two of her children to school.

loans.use: To stock sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy O. 39 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its eight members which located in Preak Toch village, Kandal province. While each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.
 
Thy and her husband are farmers who own a two hectare piece of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Her husband is also a fisherman.  Thy will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to pay farm laborers to plow her farm to cultivate rice.  She will also purchase fishing supplies to support her husband's fishing. 

This couple has eight children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a fisherman and four are students in the local school.  The youngest is age three.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline and to pay farm laborers to plow her farm to cultivate rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more onions, red oil, pepper, salt, soap, seasoning and tomatoes

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao C. was born in 1969 and lives in Trapeang Kralaong village in Takeo province. She is a broom seller who is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy Noem, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family; moreover, he is a construction worker. Since Mrs. Mao C.'s business is going well, she wants to expand. She is applying for a loan to buy more brooms to sell. She is the mother of two children; one is enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is four years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy more brooms to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva D. is currently in the business of selling fish and sugar and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Eva is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has five children and three of her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom are currently in school. Gift has a business selling milk, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Gift has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bread and sugar. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gift hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Gift hopes to own a retail shop. Gift is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase bread and sugar.

loans.name: Fenix ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Fénix (flat), y se integra de tres personas  que son  muy trabajadoras, la razón del nombre es porque les gusto una marca de un perfume y con eso se identifica su grupo.

     Elaine se dedica al comercio de venta de catálogos  desde hace quince años y solicito el credito para comprar mas articulos y así obtener mejores ingresos en su negocio ya que tambien necesita invertir para poder comprar y luego vender.

    Su motivo de realizar esta activada es para obtener ingresos ya que es una mujer sola que no de depende de nadie y necesita de tener dinero para sostenerse como tambien poyar a su familia con los ingresos en su hogar.

   Con las ganancias que va obteniendo de su negocio, compra más mercancía para estar surtida y su clientela este satisfecha con las cosas que requiere comprar, así ella tambien se siente contenta al obtener ingreso de cada producto que vende.

  Su deseo es que su negocio se incremente cada día más y así salga adelante y tenga de donde depender,  como también poder ahorrar para comparar material y construir su casa que es lo que tanto desea.

    Formo parte del grupo por una invitación que le hizo su cuñada la señora Fanny a que se uniera con ellas para solicitar un préstamo y así tener como invertir en sus negocio.

     Las  integrantes del grupo son las siguientes: 

   Olga Lidia Juárez E.: invertirá el préstamo en catalogo ya que vende ropas de la marca ilusión, como son: pantalones y blusas.


  Elaine H. Hernández: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos por catalogo  de la marca blondi donde vende: perfumes, rubores, desodorantes entre otro.


  Fanny Juárez E.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos por cátalo de la marca  jafra como son: cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, labiales entres otro.
texts.en:
This group is called Fénix (flat) and is made up of three very hard-working members.  The name for the group came from a perfume brand name that they like and this is how their group is identified.  

Elaine has been working in catalog sales  for fifteen years and she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise. She wants to  increase her business income as she needs to buy the merchandise first and then sell it.  She started this business to earn some money since she is a single woman with no one supporting her.  She needed to earn money to support herself and help her family with the household expenses.  With the income she is earning from her business she will buy more merchandise in order to be well stocked and keep her customers satisfied.  She will also be happy to make money on every product that she sells.  She wants her business to grow a little more every day so that she can rely upon it and get ahead.  What she desires most is to be able to buy construction materials to build a house.  She became a part of this group after her sister-in-law, Señora Fanny, invited her to join so that they could request a loan to invest in their businesses.  

The members of the group are as follows:  Olga Lidia Juárez E. sells Ilusión brand clothing and will use the loan to make catalog purchases of pants and blouses.  Elaine H. Hernández sells Blondi products and she will use the loan to make catalog purchases of perfumes, blushes, deodorants, etc.  Fanny Juárez E. will use the loan to purchase Jafra catalog products such as creams, perfumes, deodorants, lipstick, etc.

loans.use: To purchase catalog products such as creams, perfumes, deodorants and clothing.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eladio G. tiene 52 años, es casado con la Sra. María tiene 2 hijos mayores que ya no dependen de  ellos ya son profesionales e independientes.
 Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de aproximadamente 8 años,  el comenzó a trabajar en forma independiente gracias a sus ahora que venía juntando de otros trabajos que realizaba anteriormente. 
Es decir, que  el negocio fue montado con  de las ganancias que  obtenía de las ventas de mercaderías, el cual realizaba en forma ambulante. 
Hoy día don Eladio y la Sra. Maria atienden el negocio; que gracias a sus esfuerzos  esta a nivel de la competencia y con un crecimiento sistemático. 
 El Sr. Eladio  tiene casa propia, necesita aumentar sus compras y así consigue descuentos interesantes y en consecuencia logra mayor margen de ganancia en sus ventas. 
 El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es através de los créditos, porque le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo, razón por el cual opta por este pedido. 
 El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra
texts.en:
Sr. Eladio G. is 52 years old and married to Sra. María. They have two grown children who are no longer dependent on them since they are professionals and live independently.

His business has been in operation for approximately eight years. Eladio started working independently after gaining experience from his previous jobs. In other words, he was able to start this business using the income he earned selling merchandise as a traveling salesman.

Today Sr. Eladio and Sra. Maria manage the business. Thanks to their efforts, they have kept up with the competition and achieved a systematic level of growth. Sr. Eladio owns a home and needs to make larger purchases in order to get the attractive discounts that will help him increase his profit margin. He says the only way for him to grow is by obtaining loans since it is very difficult to build up operating capital. This is why he is submitting this request.

Eladio is a very responsible person who desires to succeed. He has a youthful and enterprising spirit. There is no doubt that he will accomplish all the goals that he has set forth for himself. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase pasta, herbs, rice, sugar, flour, and other items

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva S. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Oliva is separated from her spouse and has 7 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Oliva owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods in the local community. Oliva has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Oliva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oliva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Oliva is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foosd & instant noodles. 

This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Oliva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Señor Julio, de 28 años de edad, es comerciante y empleado de una casa comercial de venta de electrodomésticos, y está casado con la señora Lilian de 34 años de edad. 
 Cuenta con una despensa hace más de 4 años, donde el mismo trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su señora. 
 Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya para ampliar su negocio y de esta manera acrecentar sus ingresos para poder algún día cumplir su sueño que es tener su casa propia ya que actualmente viven en alquiler. 
  El Señor Julio  solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio con  la compra de lácteos, golosinas, carne, fideo, cerveza, gaseosa, embutidos, verduras, y otros.
texts.en:
Señor Julio, who is 28 years old, is a merchant and an employee of a store that sells household appliances. He is married to Señora Lilian, who is 34.

He has had a store for more than 4 years, where he himself works with the goal of improving the quality of his life and that of his wife.

He has decided to rely on Fundación Paraguaya to expand his business and in this way increase his imcome to be able to someday fulfill his dream, which is to have his own house, since now he lives in a rented property.

Señor Julio is applying for the loan to invest in his business by purchasing dairly products, candies, meat, pasta, beer, soft drinks, sausages, vegetables, and other items.

loans.use: Buy dairy products, meat, pasta, beer, soft drinks, sausages, vegetables, etc, to stock his store.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 43 years old, married and a father of five.  He runs Sam’s designers tailoring shop.  He has been in the business for sixteen years.  He has managed to employ two people in his business.  He also earns extra income from small-scale farming.   Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has managed to change his business by adding more stock using his previous loan.  He has requested another loan of 30,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Having attained a secondary education, Rhodora A., 45, wants to achieve more in life, not just for herself but for her family as well. Rhodora lives in Baseco Port Area, Manila with her husband, Antonio A., who is a photographer. They have six children, three of whom are already working, two are in elementary and one is still toddling at home.

Rhodora presently owns and manages a food stall while overseeing their tricycle operation. Rhodora caters mainly to people near their residence in Baseco. Most of her customers are people who used to wake up early in the morning for work or studies who do not have enough time to cook for themselves and still others are tricycle operators and drivers who just parked their units in front of her store while waiting for passengers. Rhodora and Antonio gather a net income of PHP 10,000 monthly, which they use to meet the needs of the entire family.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 22,000 loan. Rhodora plans to use this loan to further her food vending business and to finally install their own electrical power supply.  Basically, the loan will serve as additional capital that will enable Rhodora to make her business more profitable and lead to more savings.

At present, Rhodora experiences complaints from her customers about the quantity of her food serving because she just adjusted it due to increasing prices of the raw ingredients she uses at present.  She is determined not to be swayed by these struggles, explains to them these adjustments and aims to make her business grow.  Rhodora dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and be used as one family for the glory of the Lord whom they serve.  As a CCT community partner, Rhodora attends faithfully to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw inspiration and strength from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy rice, meats, vegetables and other raw ingredients and to pay for the installation of electrical power supply

loans.name: Fernando Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Fernando Enrique M. él es trabajador activo de la empresa “Hotel Barceló Monte limar” desempeñándose como Ebanista tiene cinco  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un  hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este  lo esta solicitando para sufragar unos gastos personales de su hogar, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando Enrique M. is an active employee of the Barceló Monte Limar Hotel, where he has worked as a cabinetmaker for five years. He is currently married and has one school-aged child.

He has taken out two previous loans through CEPRODEL, both of which he used to buy construction materials for expanding and improving his house, such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc. He is requesting this loan to cover some personal household expenses. The previous CEPRODEL loans helped him a great deal by improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement, cinder blocks, and iron

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Land Purchase

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia, vive en la zona de Tuscapujio, tiene un hijo de 4 meses su pareja es chofer trabaja con minibús en el sindicato de la zona, ella realiza el comercio de verduras desde muy temprano sale a vender en compañía de su niño  en la ciudad de Cochabamba en el mercado mas populoso de la ciudad La Cancha, solo los días de feria miércoles y sábado ella tiene su  puesto de venta que es muy conocida. El préstamo lo invertirá para adquirir variedad de verduras, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sra. Claudia lives in the Tuscapujio neighborhood in the city of Cochabamba.  She has a 4-month old baby.  Her husband is a driver and a member of the local taxi cooperative.  Sra. Claudia operates a business selling vegetables in the La Cancha market, the market with the most traffic in Cochabamba.  She only works on market days, Wednesdays and Saturdays, baby in hand and her stall there has become well known.  She will use the loan to buy a variety of vegetables for resale.  Sra. Claudia is a hard-working young woman and grateful to the institution for the help it provides.

loans.use: Buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mariana Laura

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su  belleza arquitectónica la misma que le permitió ser nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, su gastronomía es muy variada la misma que cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Mariana cuenta con 54 años, es divorciada y tiene 12 hijos de los cuales 6 de ellos son casados e independientes, tres trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Con su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Mariana tiene un puesto donde vende comida rápida, gaseosas y más productos, este trabajo lo realiza hace 17 años y labora de lunes a sábados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

Se encuentra en su octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como: pan, carne, salchichas, papas, gaseosas, etc.  Su sueño es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Mariana C. is a member of the El Arenal communal bank.  She lives in the Cebollar section of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its architectural beauty, which allowed it to be named a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1999.  Its gastronomy is quite varied, and captivates both locals and foreigners.  Its people maintain its culture and traditions.

Mariana is 54 years old and divorced with 12 children, of whom 6 are married and independent, three work and help out with household expenses, and three study at a school in the city.  With her work and effort she has succeeded in building her own house.

Mariana has a stand where she sells fast food, soft drinks, and more.  She has been doing this for 17 years.  She works Monday to Saturday from 7 in the morning until 7 at night.

This is her eighth loan with the communal bank, and she is going to invest it in the purchase of products such as: bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, soft drinks, etc.  Her dream is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: to purchase bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Channat

texts.en:
Mrs. Channat B. is a widow. She has two sons, one has full-time employment and another one is in school. She lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Channat B. runs a grocery store at home. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market and resells to her village. She asked for a Kiva loan once, and she now hopes to continue her business. So she is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase grocery items for her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her inventory

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a resident of Nkubu, in Central Kenya, where he is a farmer. He has been in dairy farming for 8 years.He sells his milk producs to Brookside Dairies. He is married and has one child, aged 4 years.

James has requested for a loan of 61,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to improve his business by buying an additional dairy cow and a chuff-cutter for making animal feed. James says these acquisitions will reduce his running costs and improve his income for his family's well-being. He is looking forward to the day when his production will hit 100 litres capacity per day.

James says, however, that poor market prices for their milk is the main business challenge, resulting in very low income.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and a chuffcutter.

loans.name: Juna

texts.es:
La señora Juna L. C. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Pacayita. Ella tiene en el cruce de Ticuantepe una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio hace 10 años con chiverias. 
L. con el crédito comprará granos básicos (arroz, aciete, azúcar, frijoles), gaseosa y pan. La meta principal de ella es que sus cinco hijos tengan un buen futuro que se preparen y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Señora Juna L. C. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is originally from Pacayita. She has a little grocery store at the Ticuantepe crossroads. She opened it 10 years ago selling snack items.
 
With the loan, she will buy basic staple items (rice, oil, sugar, beans), soft drinks, and bread. Her main goals are that her five children have a good future, that they prepare themselves,  and that her business grows.

loans.use: to buy basic food items (rice, oil, sugar, beans), soft drinks, and bread for her store

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns a sari-sari (variety) store selling snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and canned goods. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like junk foods, canned goods & biscuits. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like snack foods, canned goods & biscuits

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 46 years old, married, and has seven children between 32 and 21. He has other dependents and lives in his own home with his family of 10 people in Hoima, Uganda. 

He has had a video show business for 10 years. He first started his business in a rented premises but later built his own premises where he now operates his business. Jacob intends to use the loan to purchase a music system.

loans.use: To purchase a music system.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 45-year-old married woman living and working in Tyre with her husband and four children. Fatima lives in a very modest house and she's always thankful for what she gets. She works in order to help in her family's income and cover their expenses.  She started working in 2005 and her business is growing gradually.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time to increase her business capital and stock up on summer makeup and perfume collections.  She hopes her business improves more in the future so she can buy the necessary furniture for her house and open a small shop to move her business out of her house.

loans.use: buy summer makeup, perfumes and cosmetics accessories

loans.name: Shirak

texts.en:
Shirak was born in 1965 and lives in Aknaghbyur village, Ijevan area. Shirak lives with his wife and his son and daughter, who are students, and with his retiree mother.

For a long time, Shirak worked as workman and, since 1992, he and his family have engaged in animal breeding, bee keeping and gardening. With the profit from his agricultural business, Shirak can support his family's needs. He likes his agricultural occupation very much, so he works very hard and with much pleasure. He especially likes to take care of his bee colonies. He says bee keeping is a hard and exacting business, which demands a lot of knowledge, but at the same time it is very profitable and interesting.

Shirak needs a 700.000 AMD loan to add more bees and also to buy some calves and fodder.

loans.use: to add bees and also to buy some calves and fodder

loans.name: Benji

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Benji; el socio tiene 18 años de edad, el socio es soltero, el socio trabaja y estudia, el socio está trabajando en la distribuidora de bebidas Coca-Cola, el socio esta en el área de preventas; el socio alterna su trabajo con los estudios actualmente el socio está estudiando idiomas en el centro de idiomas Ipcna, el socio está estudiando ingles; El desea continuar sus estudios y pagar la universidad está pensando entre dos carreras que aún está madurando la idea según a las ofertas y demandas de nuestro país en los próximos años. El socio desea el crédito para invertiré en sus estudios, el desea pagar su  ciclo y comprar sus libros de lectura y actividades. El socio invertirá en sus estudios.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Nueva Generación III" ["New Generation III"] communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

This borrower, Benji, is 18 years old and single. He works and goes to school. He works in pre-sales at a distribution center for Coca-Cola beverages. He alternates his work with his studies. He is currently studying languages at the Ipcna language center. He is studying English and would like to continue his studies and to be able to pay for university. He is deciding between two majors, as he is still developing his ideas according to the opportunities and demands of his country over the coming years. Benji would like a loan to invest in his studies. He would like to pay tuition for this cycle and to pay for class books and activities. He will invest in his education.

Benji is grateful for the support being offered to him and he promises to be disciplined in his compliance with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to pay for his studies

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with nine children. Seven of her children attend school and one has graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Fatuma owns a posho mill machine to grind maize, which has been in operation for the past four years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She also sells vegetables, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during the dry hot season when there is no maize for grinding, hence a low income is generated. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to repair her posho mills and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice to establish a retail shop,. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To repair her posho mills and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice to establish a retail shop,.

loans.name: Samarn

texts.en: Samarn, 39 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker with $4 per day for her income. She has three children. All of the children are working in the factory with $10 income for all. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to use to travel to work. Her husband wants to buy a small car for doing taxi service in the future instead of working as a construction worker when he gets older.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 49 year old Faith (raising her hand) from Masvingo. She is married with five children, three attending school.  Faith runs a retail business selling clothes, blankets and food. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are financial constraints. 

Faith has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes, blankets and food for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the wellbeing of her children and to pay school fees. In the future Faith plans to own a company and employ workers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets and food for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather, shoe polish and nails for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Taron

texts.en: Taron keeps livestock and cultivates land. Taron would like to develop farming, but he doesn't have sufficient financial means. With the requested loan, Taron plans to purchase livestock. Farming development will help Taron to get more income and ensure a sustainable future for his family. Taron lives together with his wife and little son.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Del Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Mujeres Unidas del Divino Niño Jesús, se formó gracias a la iniciativa D. una D. las miembros, la cual había escuchado sobre el programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya. Después D. esto formó a sus amigas y vecinas D. lo que surge el grupo. Todas ellas se unieron con el propósito D. mejoras sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Andresa, ella tiene una mercería, donD. venD. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser prendas D. vestir, artículos para regalo y otros. Mediante su negocio, el cual le genera sus ingresos, ella pueD. mantener a su familia y a quienes D. ella dependen. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compran D. ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. artículos para regalos, prendas y otros artículos para abastecer su local y D. esa forma poder cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This committee, named “United Women of the Divine Child Jesus,” was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members, who had heard about the program for enterprising women promoted by the Paraguay Foundation. Afterwards, she got together with her friends and neighbors to create what became the group. All the women united around the proposal of improving their condition of life and that of their families.

One of the members is Andresa who has a notions shop where she sells all sorts of articles, including items of clothing, gift articles, and other things. By means of the store, which generates her income, she can maintain her family and all those who depend on her. Andresa comments that she has a well-developed clientele who always buy from her.

Andresa requests the loan to buy gift articles, items of clothing, and other items to supply her shop, and in this manner, to be able to satisfy her customers. She is very grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity it provides.

loans.use: buy gift merchandise, including women's garments, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.en:
Aizada, age 19, is a resident of a small town in Kyrgyzstan called Kemin. She works as a bookkeeper in a bank. A year ago, she saved 15000 soms and with that money she purchased a calf for breeding. She chose a cattle-breeding business because she thinks it is the best and most effective way to invest money. When cattle grow up and their weight increases, the price for cattle increases, too. With the money received from the loan, Aizada wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding. In the future, she wishes to save money to purchase a car of a red color.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more farm animals for breeding.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en: Ran, 54 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a soldier earning $3 per day. They have three children; one is studying and two more are working as construction workers, each earning $3.50 per day. Every month, Ran has to spend $68 on food, $10 on electricity, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a plot of land for doing farming. She wants to help her sons to buy other construction materials to support their career so that they can make better income.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for doing farming.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos de 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Carlos desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios personales.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para compra de otros animales y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Carlos es un hombre trabajador y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old, single, and lives at home with his parents.  Their home, located in the rural area of the Tambogrande District in the department of Piura, doesn't have utilities.  This area is known for its farming, ranching, and craftwork.

For a few years now, Carlos has been raising and selling sheep for a living.  His corral, which is suitable and spacious, is located at the back of their home.  He feeds his animals balanced foods and natural grasses.  Once they have grown to their peak condition, he sells them at the different markets in the area and makes good enough profits to cover his daily personal expenses.

He has asked for a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy new animals and food for these animals.  With the income he will receive he will be able to repay his debt and improve his quality of life.  Carlos is a very hardworking and responsible man who only wants his business to grow so he can keep helping his parents financially.

loans.use: to buy new animals and food for these animals

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Imelda has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Imelda sells her products from home. Imelda has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, bags of rice, chicken, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, and cassava.  She also generates additional income through selling piped water and renting rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Imelda include transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked restaurant. Imelda lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and buying medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, bags of rice, chicken, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Angellica

texts.en:
Angellica is a 35-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She started by farming and saved money to start a clothing business. Her challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to meet the different tastes of her customers. 

Her personal goals are to educate her children and to build a permanent home.

Angellica needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a widow and has a rope-making business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Vicenta has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business. She has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.
In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Titonangba Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TITONANGBA est composé de deux personnes qui sont de la même famille. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rafatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rafatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Rafatou est âgée de 59 ans et est une veuve. Rafatou est mère de cinq enfants, dont trois restent à sa charge. Rafatou assure seule les diverses charges de ses enfants. Pour y parvenir, Rafatou mène comme activité depuis dix-sept ans environs la vente des emballages de "pure water" à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Rafatou s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rafatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TITONAGBA, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Titonangba group is made up of 2 people who are both members of the same family. The group would like to increase their business activity and, for this reason, are requesting their 2nd loan from ALIDé.

Rafatou, the representative of the group, has her hand raised in the picture. She is 59 years old, widowed and the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are still dependent on her.

Rafatou covers her children´s various expenses by herself. She did not go to school and, in order to be able to take care of children´s needs, has been selling "Pure Water" from her home for the past 17 years. She gets her supplies in Benin and the income from her business enables her to meet both her needs and those of her children without too much difficulty.

Rafatou and the other member of the Titonangba group are requesting their 2nd loan from ALIDé in order to be able to restock on supplies, so that they can satisfy customer demand, increase their sales and their income. The group fully repaid their first loan.

loans.use: to buy packages of "Pure Water" for resale.

loans.name: Adheu

texts.en:
Adheu is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Adheu is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase milk and sugar for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase milk and sugar for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is sixty years old and single. She has been selling  textiles  fabrics and second hand clothes for the past nineteen years.

Rose was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She has borrowed a loan of  30,000 KES loan which is her first  loan from KADET, and she will use it to purchase  more textiles fabrics for sale.

Her dream is to own a boutique this means a big shop that sells variety of clothes both for children and adult.

loans.use: to purchase textiles fabrics for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children. Kiva lenders, meet Mary, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 56 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Kwanza, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Mary has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past nineteen years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. 

Mary is contented with the farming way of life. Mary is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seedlings and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Because of these factors she will be able to sell her horticulture products both in the local and international market. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Mary feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Mary is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Mary so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To buy seedlings to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
At 34 years of age, Roda (pictured above) has gone through various circumstances and difficulties in her life. Just to mention one of them, she doesn't have a formal job. But her courage, perseverance, and desire to succeed make her get up every day to work on her poultry business.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 13 years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her three children, she has been selling dairy milk, eggs, poultry, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part of poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 80,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being an African woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions even more.

The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Roda always thinks and dreams big; that’s why she wants to give the best quality of life to her children. You can help Roda to accomplish all her dreams, and a loan will do that for her.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
Jemelyn is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Jemelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jemelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, and other groceries.

Jemelyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the futur, Jemelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a beekeper. She breeds bees for making honey and sells them to health institutions and schools within the community. Hannahs honey is one of the best produced in the community. She has a large market consisting of phamarceutical shops located near her locality. She needs the loan to improve the production of honey in her combs.

loans.use: to increase the production of honey

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Jury

texts.en:
Jury has been farming for the past 6 years. She has learned how to farm from her family. She has been able to support herself thanks to her farming abilities. She only grows rice since it is the most profitable crop in this region.

Jury would like to make use of this loan by purchasing farming implements to cultivate rice, and to buy herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities in order to appropriately manage her crops.

Jury is 23 years old. She has a one-month old baby boy, and lives with her husband in a house made out of solely wood and cement which has remained stable for the past 6 years. Her dreams are to one day buy more land to farm, and to buy more stable and resilient materials to build a more solid foundation for her home!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Jury es agricultora desde hace 6 anos donde aprovecho las enseñanzas que sus familiares le otorgaron, de esa manera a podido mantenerse gracias al esfuerzo diario en la agricultura. Solamente se dedica al sombrío de arroz, ya que es el cultivo de mayor rentabilidad en la zona

Jury quiere aprovechar el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas en el manejo del cultivo de arroz, tanto como semilla, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes u otros rubros para de esa manera poder manejar el cultivo apropiadamente.

Jury tiene 23 anos de edad donde tiene solamente un hijo en la cual solamente tiene un mes de nacido, junto a su conyugue, su vivienda es de estructura mixta como madera y cemento en donde hace 6 anos se han mantenido con firmeza. Sus anhelos es llegar a comprar mucha mas tierras para su reactivación y de esa manera mejorar su vivienda con materiales mas estables y resistentes.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies to cultivate rice

loans.name: Enogie

texts.en: Enogie O. is 57 years old, and is the single mother of three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She has been selling foods for seven years. She needs a loan to purchase more provisions for her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Business description

Ana started her business a year ago. The products she offers are: perfumes, cosmetics and chickens. She pays personal attention to her clients every day between 8 a.m. and 9 p.m.

Loan use

Ana needs a loan to purchase new fragrances, make ups and materials to fix up her store. From this, she'll be able to offer a fresh look and a variety of products to her clients.

Personal information

Ana is 46 years old. She has a young son who is in school. Her husband works at an auto repair shop. She started her business with a small amount of capital and works out of her home. She needs the loan to be able to set up her store better and offer her clients a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Ana inicio su negocio hace 1 año. Los Productos que ofrece son: Perfumes, cosméticos y pollos. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8-a.m. -9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Ana necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de nuevas fragancias, maquillajes y materiales para arreglar el local de su negocio. De esta manera ofrecer nueva imagen y variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Ana tiene 46 años. Tiene 1 hijos menor que esta estudiando .Su esposo trabaja como operario en un taller donde arreglan chapas y elevadores de vidrios de los autos. Ana inicio su negocio con un pequeño capital .El trabajo lo realiza en su domicilio. Por lo que necesita del crédito para poder acondicionar de mejor manera su local y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Invest in new fragrances and other merchandise

loans.name: Oluwatosin

texts.en: Mrs. Oluwatosin I. is 39 years old, married, with 4 children, and she lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a caterer and also sells kitchen dishes. She needs a loan of $800 to buy more kitchen dishes for sale. She is a LAPO member in one of the unions in Lagos State and has been in business since 1995. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen equipment for sale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James Mwangi M. is 25 years old and married with 2 children. James lives in a town called Ruai on the outskirts of Nairobi. James is a businessman. He runs a general shop which is situated at the Ruai Center. James started off as a waiter in a hotel from the year 2002-2003, but he decided to quit the job due to poor working conditions including a very low salary. In the year 2004, he started a green grocery stand with savings which he earned from his previous job. Through the profits that he earned from the grocery, he expanded his business and started selling cereals and stocking items like sugar, flour and salt.

James's business has been doing well, although he finds that he has been unable to increase his stock due to lack of finances since he has a business to run and also a family to support. As a result, his business has come to a standstill while he has been wondering where he can get money since the few banks that he tried to approach charged high interest rates that he felt he could not pay. While still wondering about this, he noted that his friend and neighbor, Mary Wamaitha, who is a beneficiary of a Kiva loan, had suddenly raised her business from nowhere, and it was growing fast. He therefore inquired how she had managed to do it so quickly, and she informed him about Kiva. He was greatly impressed. Mary went further and brought him to the ANK offices so that he could also receive support.

James is kindly requesting a loan of US$650 which he will use to stock his shop with cereals like maize, peas, beans, rice, sugar, and flour, among other items. He believes that, with this loan, he will be able to expand his business and increase the number of customers he has. This way, he will be better able to support his family. Since he is a young person, he also hopes that he will be able to expand his business up to a wholesale level over time.

The repayment period for this loan will be 9 months.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a general store, including cereals like maize, peas, beans, rice, sugar and flour etc.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is an enterprising business owner from Pavlograd in central Ukraine. She has been in business for about 20 years, gaining much valuable experience and developing a solid enterprise. She currently operates two businesses. One is a clothing sales business. She has several kiosks at a market in Pavlograd where she sells both men’s and women’s clothing. In addition to clothing sales, she also owns a hair salon. Ludmila is married and has one grown son who was just recently married.

Ludmila requested a short term loan to give her additional working capital and help purchase some women’s winter coats to sell in the market. Additional capital gives Ludmila the ability to increase her income. We are happy for another opportunity to help this dedicated, sharp business owner continue to operate a successful enterprise.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a resident of Makangarawe in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a store that sells new and used clothing and traditional attire called vitenge. She has been in this business for the past five years. She sells her items to the nearby residents of Tandika and also has a shop at a nearby trading center.

She has been successful in such a way that the profits she makes support her family and pay school fees. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Fund clothing business expansion.

loans.name: Tukae

texts.en:
Tukae is 31 years old and a married woman. Tukae owns a small pharmacy, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $23 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her pharmacy

loans.name: Luce

texts.es:
Luce is a self-sacrificing mother who raises livestock animals in order to meet the needs of her home and her young children. She travels frequently to the city of Huancayo, to the agricultural markets to sell and buy young animals. Thanks to her constant effort in the home, things are going very well. She wishes to increase her working capital for the purpose of elevating her beloved family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Luce es una abnegada madre de familia que se dedica a la crianza de animales para sostener satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar y a sus pequeños niños. Continuamente viaja a la ciudad de Huancayo a las ferias agropecuarias específicamente para ofertar y adquirir pequeños animalitos, gracias a su constante esfuerzo dentro de su hogar las cosas marchan muy bien. Tiene deseos de incrementar su capital de trabajo con el propósito de elevar también la calidad de vida de su amada familia que está en continuo progreso.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can raise a larger number of livestock animals

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is fifty six years old and is married with six children. She works extremely hard to support her husband to provide food for her family as well as pay the bills. She is a food vendor who sells Kenkey. Kenkey is one of the local dialects prepared from maize and is eaten with hot pepper and fish. Many people enjoy it as breakfast, lunch, and supper. However, production is slowing down due to low working capital. Comfort is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize, vegetables, fish, and firewood in order to help her expand her production to serve additional customers. She belongs to the community group called Acherensua Batch 1 in which members are guaranteed to one another as social collateral to be able to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, vegetables, fish and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in used clothing to sell in her community.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 52 years old, divorced, and has four children. She has been the bread winner for her family for twenty years, baking bread and selling it to consumers in the town. Margaret's business is affected by the high price rise of commodities like flour, sugar and margarine. She therefore needs a loan to be able to buy flour, sugar and margarine. She hopes to expand her bakery business and better respond to her community's needs. Margaret is a member of the group called Gospel Light whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of baking flour, sugar, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Liz Diana

texts.es:
Liz is a member of the Banco Comunal Manatial community bank.

Liz is a single mother. She is 22 years old and she has a son. Liz, together with a friend, has a ladies' clothign store. She is located in the city of Huanta, in a rented shop. She depends on the help of an employee to take care of the sales. She acquires her producs in the city of Lima where she travels once a month. Liz lives in the city of Ayacucho for her employment but every weekend she travels to Huanta to supervise the sales and finances of her store.

For this she requests a loan in the amount of 1050 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts and slacks.

Liz's dream is to expand her business by providing a greater selection with more products. She wishes to have a gallery, to complete an education program for professionals and to provide a good eductation for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Liz es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.

Liz es madre soltera, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Liz junto a una amiga tienen una tienda de venta ropa para mujeres, ubicada en la ciudad de Huanta, en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de un personal que se encarga de las ventas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viajan 1 vez al mes. Liz vive en la ciudad de Ayacucho por razones de trabajo y cada fin de semana viaja a la ciudad de Huanta a supervisar las ventas e ingresos.

Liz necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones.

Los sueños de Liz son ampliar su negocio surtiendo con mas productos, tener una galeria, estudiar una carrera profesional y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Liz requests a loan in the amount of 1050 soles.  These funds will be invested in the the purchase of polo shirts and slacks.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Don Juan tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 13 y16 años de edad, que están estudiando. Su esposa se dedica a lavar y planchar ajeno para ayudar en los gastos de su familia. Don Juan tiene una zapatería llamada Rumbin y lleva veintidós años de experiencia, la zapatería está ubicada en un mercado de la capital, a veces el negocio esta mal, poco trabajo, entonces se va atrabajar a su finca para no dejar de percibir ingresos para su familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo quiere invertir en materia prima, en compra de productos varios para la zapatería, para mejorar la oferta y atraer más clientes. A largo plazo es fortalecer el volumen de inventario de su negocio, invertir más en la finca para ver mejores resultados, así como ayudar a sus hijos a prepararse profesionalmente
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is 51 years old and lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. He is married and has two children ages 13 and 16, who are students. His wife cleans and irons for other people to help cover the family's expenses. Juan owns a shoe store called "Rumbin" and has 22 years of experience. The shoe store is located in a market in the capital. Sometimes business is bad and there is little work to be done, but other times it is great and Juan works hard to make money for his family. Juan is seeking the loan to purchase raw materials for making shoes to increase his offerings and attract more clients. In the long run, Juan would like to increase the store's inventory and invest more in the business to make more money so that he can help his children prepare themselves professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward B. is 46 years old. He is married and the father of two children who are currently in school. He has been operating a corn mill machine for three years. Customers come to the mill to grind their maize, which they use to prepare local dishes like banku, corn dough, and kenkey. 

His production is on a small scale because he doesn't have enough money to buy a machine for processing. Edward wants to use the loan to buy more electric milling machines to improve production. He believes the loan would help him earn enough income to finance his children's education. 

Edward belongs to the Hyebenehi Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. His picture was taken after his group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more maize and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Lan Group

texts.vi:
Bác Nguyễn thị L. năm nay 69 tuổi Ms 01030010, là một người tuổi đã cao nhưng sức khỏe rất tốt. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình cũng rất thuận lợi nhờ việc vào tính toán và điều hành công việc của bác. Hàng ngày gia đình bác kinh doanh tre, nứa, nên rất bận rộn. Vì vậy hàng ngày có con trai phụ bác bán hàng nhưng công việc kinh doanh rất tốt, nên bác phải thuê thêm 2 công nhân giúp bác trong việc bán hàng. Mức thu nhập của gia đình cũng khá thuận lợi thu nhập từ 180.000đ/ ngày. Bác cùng thành viên trong  nhóm rất thích hình thức vay trả này, vì được trả dần, đông thời tiết kiệm để có kế hoạch cho tương lai. Bác L. tham gia vay vốn qua 2 chu kỳ đều trả rất tốt, chu kỳ này bác đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để đầu tư vào việc kinh doanh. Các thành viên trong nhóm của bác như sau :
 Chị Nguyễn thị N. Ms 01030007 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua gạo làm bánh. 
 Chị Nguyễn thị C. Ms 01030008 vay mức 3.808.000VNđ để buôn bán. 
 Chị Lê thị N. Ms 01030024 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để bán giải khát. 
 Chị Nguyễn thị L. Ms 01030027 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để kinh doanh.
 Chị Nghiêm thị L. Ms 01030036 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để kinh doanh hàng điện tử.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi L. (ID Number 01030010) is 69 years old but still in good health. Her family's business runs smoothly thank to her management. Her family is busy selling bamboo everyday. The business is really good, so even though her son helps out, she still has to hire 2 more salemen. Her family's daily income is about 180,000VND. Other group members and her really like this method of repaying in installment, as they can slowly repay and still be able to save for the future. Mrs. L. borrowed twice from the Fund and repaid fully. This time, she would like to borrow 4,256,000VND to invest further in her business. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi N. (ID Number 01030007), borrows 4,704,000VND to purchase rice to make cakes.
  • Mrs. N. Thi C. (ID Number 01030008), borrows 3,808,000VND to do business.
  • Mrs. Le Thi Ngan (ID Number 01030024), borrows 4,256,000VND to sell drinks.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Lien (ID Number 01030027), borrows 4,256,000VND to do business.
  • Mrs. Nghiem Thi L. (ID Number 01030036), borrows 4,256,000VND to sell electronic products.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling bamboo

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin A. is a 33-year-old trader who sells men's suits in a place he rents in the southern city of Saatli. Shahin has eight years of experience in selling men's clothes. He is very polite with his clients, and during his years of experience, he has gained the respect of his clients and attracted a number of permanent clients who always purchase their clothes from Shahin.

Shahin is married and has 3 sons. His store provides the only financial income for his family. He would like to expand his business, so he has applied for a loan of 1200 USD. Shahin and his family appreciate your help.

loans.use: Purchase more men's suits

loans.name: Zaitoon M. Sharif Group

texts.en:
My name is Zaitoon and I am 53 years old. I live in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. I own a two-room brick house in this city. I am married with six children: four sons and two daughters. My oldest son is an electrician. My second son drives a donkey cart and my third son works as a delivery man. My youngest son works in his father’s business. My husband's name is M. S.; he is a woodcutter by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this business. I stay at home and sew clothes to order. I charge $2 per dress. Sometimes my daughters help me in my business.  I have successfully repaid my two loans which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan to buy an axe for my youngest son so that he will be able to cut more wood and earn more money. 

I am the leader of a group of four other women of my locality. Abida K. baji wants a loan to buy material (cooking oil and sugar) for her sweetmeat business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy biscuits and chips to sell to different shops. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy scrap iron for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an axe for wood-cutting

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 57 años D. edad, es viuda, vive con dos D. sus cuatro hijos quienes estudian. La casa donD. viven es propia. Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad, esfuerzo que hace por sus dos hijos, a los mismos que los apoya en con el pago D. sus estudios y otros gastos. La señora Fredy es una mujer que lucha duro por salir adelante, empezó con este negocio hace 3 años, con una atención desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, y gracias a esta buena atención y sobre todo a la administración D. su bodega, ahora está mejorando la infraestructura D. su vivienda. Además le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que aprenD. muchas cosas cuando conversa con sus clientes, y por encontrarse ubicada en una buena zona, muy transitada no tiene inconvenientes, razón por la cual le va muy bien. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita ampliará e implementará su negocio para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y variedad D. productos.
texts.en:
Fredy is a 57-year-old widow. She lives in her own home with her four children, who are in school. She makes a living selling groceries and other primary-need products, work that she does so she can support two of her children with their studies and other expenses. Fredy is a women who works hard to make headway. She started her business three years ago, serving her customers from 6 in the morning until 9 at night, and thanks this good service and especially her administration abilities she is now improving the infrastructure of her home. Furthermore, she really enjoys her job since she learns a lot of things while talking to customers. Because it's located in a good, well-passed area, she does not have any drawbacks, which is why it's going so well. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and with the money she is requesting she plans to enlarge and expand her store to improve her customer service and add a wider variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge her store and add more products

loans.name: Chheangheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chheangheng P., 41, just married in 2008, but his wife, Mrs. Yeun Cheng, 38, has five children with her first husband. Her first son has full time employment in Phnom Penh and other children are in school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Chheangheng has been a house builder for sixteen years, a skill he learned from his neighbor. His wife has been selling flowers and bananas for twenty years, but she has now stopped for a while because she is pregnant. Chheangheng is requesting a loan of $500 purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work.

loans.name: Poline Anyango

texts.en: Poline Anyango O. is a 29-year-old resident of Nyamasaria. She is a tailor. This is her first loan for her business which she hopes to enlarge. She will purchase cloth, threads and needles with her loan. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Poline says both are good kids. Her husband is a trailer-truck driver.

loans.use: Thread, needles

loans.name: Branda Yamileth

texts.es:
La Sra. Brenda C. tiene 38 años de edad es soltera y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, el esta cursando el sexto grado de educacion primaria, el lo es todo para ella, es por quien ella vive y trabaja. 
ella posee una pulperia desde hace 10 años, le ha ido muy bien, este negocio es muy prospero y necesita el credito para poder surtilo mas y asi tener una mejor variedad para sus clientes, su sueño es tener un super mercado y asi como ella va creo que en poco tiempo lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda C. is 38 years old. She is single, with a 12 year old son who is in sixth grade. Her son is very important to her and gives her the motivation and incentive to keep living and working hard. She has run a general store for 10 years and the business is very good. She is requesting a loan to grow her business with more variety of goods for her clients. Her dream is to eventually have a super market. Her dedication to the business will help her achieve her goals soon.

Translated from Spanish by Zoe Mullard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, sweets, chicken, beef, pork, sardines (tins), toothpase, toilet paper, workbooks, beans, sugar, rice and butter

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
Héctor J. G.  es un señor de 58 años de edad, quien vive en una casa propia junto a su esposa ya que sus cuatro hijos ya viven fuera de la misma. 

La comunidad en la cual vive don Héctor se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica.
