Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Desde hace tres años don Héctor se involucró en la tarea de producir leche y queso como una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Sumado a esto, hace dos años se  instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce, motivo por el cual  le vende sus productos a esta planta. 

El queso de la región donde vive don Héctor  es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida, especialmente en los desayunos  junto a tortillas, arroz, frijoles, huevos, el típico “gallo pinto”, entre otra variedad de comidas.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

Lo que desea don Héctor por el momento es obtener un micro crédito para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar su familia adelante tiene que esforzarse en producir más. 

Don Héctor  es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la micro financiera EDESA. Gracias a su vinculación con esta organización ha obtenido ya 5 micro créditos y los ha cancelado satisfactoriamente. Actualmente  don Héctor necesita un préstamo por ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar la vaca lechera y seguir adelante con su proyecto.
texts.en:
Hector is 58 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. Their four children are grown up and live on their own.

The community where Hector lives is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the province of Cartago. It's a small rural community of approximately 2000 people. The residents of the community work primarily in dairy (milk production) and cultivation of coffee. The local terrain is a bit rough, and the climate is that of tropical forest. There are many picturesqe paths running through the area that combine the tropical forest with two pretty lakes, along with coffee plantations and dairies. El Sauce is about one and a half hours by bus from Turrialba, the closest commercial zone. However, many times during the year the road is impassable due to the rains. This is no doubt one of the disadvantages of the community.

When there is no work, many people opt to leave to look for work in Turrialba, or on banana farms located in the Atlantic zone of Costa Rica. Lately, the prices for coffee and milk have gone up, so more people are trying to work in the area instead of migrating away.

For three years Hector has worked producing milk and cheese to generate income for his family. To help with the local economy, two years ago a cheese factory was set up in the community, and now Hector can sell his milk to the cheese factory. The cheese from this region is famous in all of Costa Rica. It's a fresh cheese that is traditionally known as "cheese of Turrialba". The "Ticos", as the people of Costa Rica are known, like this cheese a lot and you will often find it at meal times served with all sorts of food, especially at breakfast. They eat the cheese with tortillas, rice, eggs and beans amongst other dishes. For this reason, demand for the cheese if very high.

Hector would like a loan to buy an additional dairy cow and increase his production. He knows that another cow means a sacrifice and much more work, but he says that if he wants to continue to support his family, he will need to produce more. Hector is a client of the Association of Producers of El Sauce, a local organization affiliated with the micro finance entity EDESA. Thanks to his involvement with this organization, Hector has been given 5 micro loans, all of which he has paid back on time. The new loan will be used to purchase the additional dairy cow.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an additional dairy cow,  grow his business and continue to support his family

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Maria es soltera, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende mochilas variadas, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mochilas.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, surtir su negocio y comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Maria Celeste Village Bank. She is 44, single, and has 2 children. She rents space for a store where she spends every day selling different kinds of backpacks, which she gets in Lima. Maria is seeking a loan of 3,000 soles to buy backpacks. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals, of having a fully stocked store, and buying a piece of land where she can build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy backpacks.

loans.name: Florienne

texts.en:
Greetings from U. Florienne, a 44-year-old widow with two children and two orphans she takes care of by herself. The children's ages are 17, 12, 15 and 11. She lives the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the city capital of Rwanda.

U. owns a shop where she sells many kinds of consumable merchandises in her neighborhood. She is seeking her first loan worth 300000Rwf from Vision Finance Company to be paid within 8 months. This entrepreneur has been doing the same business for 12 years and has one full-time employee to help her in this business. Florienne starts working at 7:30 a.m. until 8 p.m. and she earned $365 in monthly profit before the loan. With the loan, Ms. U. wants to increase her merchandise, expand her business and have more savings with the increased profit.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is 25 years old and lives in the Bekaa. Rajaa has owned and run a mobile phone shop since 2006. She has requested a US$1500 loan - her first one- from Al Majmoua to purchase mobile phones and accessories.

Rajaa is a committed and hardworking businesswoman whose clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties and plans on expanding her business further in future.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Kiemiddin

texts.ru: Киемиддин Мусоев проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент более 10 лет занимается предоставлением услуги, он имеет собственный трактор на котором пашет земли односельчан. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свой трактор.
texts.en:
Kiemiddin M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 35 years old. He is married and has four children. The client provides services for more than ten years, he has own tractor with which he plows the land for the villagers. The client is asking for a loan to repair his tractor.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the tractor

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
N. Sarah is the leader of Seeta development group in Mukono. She is 43 years old and married with five children, with the youngest being 12 years old.

Sarah has a stall in Seeta trading centre where she has sold fresh produce and chickens for seven years. She is happy that, this being her second loan from Pearl Microfinance, she has been able to transform her business by having more stock - hence more profits.

Sarah is a determined and hardworking lady that has been able to cater for her family with the help of her husband. She needs a loan to help buy more food and chickens for resale.

loans.use: To buy more food and chickens for resale

loans.name: Ma. Rona

texts.en:
MA. RONA A. is 41 years old, married with 6 school-age children and a resident of Brgy. Purisima, Manapla, Negros Occidental.

Since Rona joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has gone into two business ventures that takes advantage of her innate talents and both have fortunately been able to provide for the needs of her family. In one business, she sells Ready-to-Wear Clothes and in her other business, she sells frozen food products.

Rona is borrowing PHP 10,000.00 for this 19th loan cycle so that she could increase her inventory and have more working capital in her businesses. She just paid off a PHP 15,000 loan from her previous loan cycle, but she needs a smaller loan now which she plans to pay off in a shorter period.

As a working mom, Ma. Rona Azuela balances her time between her business and family to ensure that her children are well cared for while working hard to provide for their immediate needs and saving up for their future security.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL INVENTORY & WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón B. nació en la Colonia Genaro Romero en el año 1955, vive en el barrio de Isla Bogado de Luque desde hace mas de diez años.
 Es dueño de una pequeña farmacia, trabaja con los créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2003 y gracias al crédito pudo aumentar su inventario de medicamentos lo que le genero un mejor ingreso familiar a través de la comercialización de dichos productos en el vecindario.
 Tiene como meta poder ampliar su negocio para así poder abarcar una mayor cantidad de clientes, ya que cada vez hay más personas que gustan de ir a su farmacia por la buena atención y buenos precios.
texts.en:
Ramón B. was born in the Colonia Genaro Romero in 1955. He has lived in the Isla Bogado de Luque neighborhood for over ten years. He owns a small pharmacy. He has worked with loans from the Fundación Paraguaya since 2003. Thanks to loans he was able to increase his inventory of medicines. This generated better family income by selling these products in the neighborhood. His goal is to be able to expand his business by getting more customers. More and more people like to go to his pharmacy because of the good attention and good prices.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medication and various products

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
K. Bashorat, a 44-year-old woman, is married with three children. Bashorat cultivates a small farm, which she has done for more than five years. She grows different types of vegetables and wheat. Everyday she gets up very early. At 5 am, she drives to the produce market in the capital to sell her products, while her husband and sons take care of the daily work on the farm.

Bashorat is very proud of the work they've done together as a family, and grateful that they've been able to acquire the comforts they have in their home. They have made good use of loans, since nowadays it's very difficult to get ahead without the extra help. Bashorat has applied for a loan from IMON International for the first time. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides that they need for their farm.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Claudi Argentina

texts.es: La señora Claudia Vásquez B., ella tiene 43 años de edad, es una mujer casada y tiene 1 hijo el cual aun es menor de edad. Hace más 4 años de dedicarse a una pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio, y en parte de su familia que la apoyaron para establecer la pulpería. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de granos básicos que es lo que esta priorizando la gente al realizar las compras de sus casas. Su deseo es de poseer un mini súper que pueda surtir de todos los granos básicos a las personas que viven cerca de ella y que le brinden mayores ingresos a ella.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia Vásquez B. is 43 years old, married, and has one minor child. For 4 years she has had a grocery store located in her house. She started this business because she needed income for the maintenance of her family. With much effort, she was successful in securing capital, and in part her family supported her in starting the store. The current financing will be used to purchase staple grains, which is what people are prioritizing as they carry out purchases from their homes. Her wish is to possess a mini supermarket that could supply all of the basic grains to the people who live near her and provide a better income for her.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario G. is 54 years old and has been married for 25 years to Guillermina Jiménez, who is 49 years old. They have three children. Two of them have grown up and left the house but still help their parents economically. The third child is a daughter who is 14 years old and lives with them. She is in 7th grade.

Mario started his business nine years ago. He prepares seasonings in a commercialized place in different businesses and has clients in the same place as his merchandise. With his loan he wants to buy quality seasonings to secure a better life and augment his profits.

loans.use: To buy seasoning and spices

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en:
Maria lives in the crowded capital of the Dominican Republic where traffic jams and heat are more reliable than electricity and water. She is the group coordinator of Nuevo Progreso and is currently looking to take out her third loan.

With this loan Maria will buy used clothing that comes wrapped in large, plastic packs and are imported from other countries. InsiD. there is a variety of different clothes and sizes which she will then resell to her customers for a profit. This loan will give her the initial capital to buy these packs, which would be very hard to come by otherwise.

With her increased earnings, Maria hopes to be able to buy more food to properly nourish her young children. In the long run she would like to earn enough to buy her own home in order to have a more stable location to raise her family. She would like to thank you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy packs of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda D. is from the village of Kiwalan Iligan City. She is 43 years old. Creselda is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Creselda sells specialty food products in the local community. Creselda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Creselda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Creselda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Creselda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 1, 2, & 4 Group

texts.en:
Adelsy, 30, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Adelsy and the other borrowers of Mujeres en Accion live north of San Pedro in a small town called Batey Euscarduna. Bateyes are poor rural communities built by sugar companies to house their field workers. Over time, conditions in these communities have deteriorated heavily, and houses are in poor shape. Bateyes typically lack potable water and any kind of reliable electricity, and have far from sufficient medical services. Despite these difficulties, Adelsy runs a successful small business a fried food stand in Euscarduna. She will be using this loan, her eighth with Esperanza, to purchase foods such as flour, oil, different kinds of meat, and coffee to sell to her neighbors and community.

Adelsy lives with her father, husband, and four children (ages 2 to 11) in a house maD. of cement block. Although it doesn’t sound like much, it is a significant improvement over the typical wooden homes of the Dominican Republic. She hopes that with profits from her business she can eventually purchase her own home. Adelsy also looks forward to continuing to grow her business which allows her to support her children and raise them with good health and educations. Thank you for lending to Adelsy and the Mujeres en Accion group!

loans.use: Oil, flour, meats, and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beans

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel sells sarongs and laces to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is 50 years old, and married with six children. Three of her children are in post-secondary institutions and two are in secondary school. The eldest child is married. Mabel's husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the family. Mabel is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Mabel is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Cali

texts.en:
Cali T. is from the village of Labi, in Digkilaan in the city of Iligan. She is 48 years old. Cali is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Cali owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling a variety of home utensils within the local community. Cali has been engaged in her business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cali joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cali is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan is the first she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated through this loan to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Labi, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Iringo Twebiseho Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Henry M. is a hard working 45-year-old man. He is married and has 9 children. He also cares for 2 dependents. Most of Henry’s children are grown and out of school, so he no longer pays school fees. 

Henry is a carpenter. He has had a carpentry workshop in Iringo Cell, Iterero for 3 years. His biggest challenge is lacking enough tools to do his job. He is able to make 120,000/= (Ugandan shillings) in profit each month. He would have earned more profit, were it not for assorted challegges, because his business in a monopoly in the area. 

His goal is to ensure that he improves the quality of his products and for the family to be self-sustainable. Henry needs a loan to purchase more materials and tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials and tools.

loans.name: Aissa

texts.fr:
Cette jeune femme a appris le métier de la couture, elle a ouvert sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « COUTURE AICHA BEL AVENIR » en 2007 elle a décidé d’associer à son commerce la vente de pagnes et de tissus bazins. Ce commerce lui réussit bien, elle veut agrandir son commerce, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de lots de pagnes et de tissus bazins.
Etant célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle subvient  à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
This is a woman who was trained as a seamstress, and she opened her own store that she called « COUTURE AICHA BEL AVENIR ». In 2007, she decided to also start selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and Bazin fabrics. This business is successful to her, and she wants to expand it. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy batches of pagnes and Bazin fabrics. Being unmarried, she uses the income drawn from this business to provide for herself.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batches of pagnes (colorful African cloth) and Bazin fabrics

loans.name: Marbin

texts.en: Marbin F. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy. He is 44 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marbin owns and operates a business providing photography services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Marbin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This loan will be his first from PMPC. Marbin plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Mrs. Airene P. is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur with her family and makes a living growing rice on her one-hectare field. She and her husband till the soil together, spending most of their time at the farm because they want to make it productive and save for their children’s future.

Airene has started planting her next crop but needs additional supplies. She has applied for a loan for PHP 11,000 from CEVI  to buy seeds, fertilizer and other items.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda M., 45, makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She is married to Rogelio M., a mechanic, and they are blessed with five children. She operates their jeepney while also managing their auto-repair shop.

Melinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 25,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for buying equipment and expanding her businesses.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying equipment and expanding her businesses

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel tiene 43 años, esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos pues ha sido de gran ayuda trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de ladrillos. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, su negocio tiene mucho tiempo de permanecer en la familia, es así que ha luchado por mantener esta actividad. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima que será utilizado para la fabricación de sus productos. El deseo de Víctor es mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel is 43 years old. This is not his first experience with financing; working with Fundacion has been a big help. His economic activity is making and selling bricks. He has been in this business for more than 31 years. Since he has three children to take care of, his business has been in his family for a long time. That is why he has fought to maintain this activity. Presently, he is asking for this financing for working capital in order to buy the raw materials that will be used to manufacture his products. Victor wants to improve his income to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and four children. She has owned a bakery for three years and has more than 15 years of experience in the field. She is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., which she plans to use to invest in a new dough making machine and an oven. She expects to improve her business with this loan and estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 5%. This will be her first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in a new dough making machine and an oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: David Chege

texts.en: David has been in the motorbike transport business for 10 years in Naivasha town. He is 27 years old, married to Jane Wairimu, and they have two children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. His first loan for 63,000 Kenyan shillings was paid well and in good time. He used the cash to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one he was using. He now wants to buy another new motorbike. He will employ somebody else to operate it for him, thus doubling his income. David plans to buy a mini bus in the future with the help of KADET, which he will use to transport people and goods from place to place.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Reynante

texts.en:
Reynante S. is from the village of Omayco, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 31 years old. Reynante is separated from wife and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Reynante owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Reynante has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Reynante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynante has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide services. Reynante is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Reynante from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn D. is from the village of Brgy. Dadap, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Marlyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn operates a handicraft business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marlyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This will be the first loan taken out by Marlyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Andella

texts.en:
Hard-working Andella M. runs a retail shop in the Kagongi Trading Centre, where she sells general merchandise. Her store has been in operation for over 10 years. She is a married mother of five children. Recently, she has been having problems restocking her merchandise because the stock is not self-sustaining for the customers.

Therefore, Andella is seeking a loan to help her buy more goods for her business. She hopes that the profit will help her earn a greater income and be in a better position to cater for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her business like sugar, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en: Day by day, women around the world become more independent. They either choose to be independent or are forced by circumstances. Anyway, we see a general trend that women provide for their families, become independent of their husbands and gradually move from lower positions to the positions of CEO, leaders of political parties, diplomats, deputies and even presidents. Aigul T., the leader of the group, is one of those women who were forced to start businesses in order to raise and feed their children after being divorced. She is 36 and has three children. Her elder son is 15 and her daughters are 13 and 3 years old. She doesn’t have a university degree from a top business school, but she found skills and the knowledge to earn money. She started her business by cooking pies, samsy and ashlyamfu (Kyrgyz traditional food) 12 years ago with an initial investment of 3,000 soms and each month she receives 10,000 soms as income. Now, her son and daughter go to school and the youngest daughter goes to kindergarten. With her children, she dreams to buy a big house. She already has accumulated a considerable amount of money. However, she cannot afford to buy the house of her and her children's dreams yet. Thus, Aigul decided to broaden the sphere of her business. She decided to buy school and office accessories in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyz Republic) and then resell them at a higher price in her village (the Issykkul region of the Kyrgyz Republic). She is asking for a loan because she doesn’t have enough funds to realize the above described business idea. Group members: Gulbarchyn O. is treasurer of the group. She is 62 and a widow. Her children are grown up and live independently of their mother. She has a cattle-breeding business. The business was started three years ago with the initial investment of 8,000 soms and has a monthly income of 5,300 soms. She helped one of her children with the beginning of construction of a new house. Now she wants to help her son repair his truck. Thus, she is applying for this loan. Bakytbek K. is 35 and recently married. He was working in a dental clinic but due to the low salary, he decided to open his own dental clinic. He started his business five years ago with the initial investment of 2,000 soms. Now he receives 15,000 soms monthly. He is applying for a loan in order to buy necessary medicines. Maksatbek M. is 25 and married. He has a son who is 3 years old. He is a taxi driver in the military registration and enlistment office. His wife is a shop assistant. Still, their wages are not enough to live together and raise their 3-year-old child. Together with his wife, he started a bakery business one year ago with the initial investments of 500 soms. Their business brings them 9,100 soms monthly. They already have bought a boiler and they are applying for a loan in order to buy a microwave and flour. Together with his wife, they are planning to open a cafeteria. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3 Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase school and office accessories

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es: Gervasio es albañil, es un hombre viudo que debe cuidar a 4 hijos de 5, 7, 9 y 11 años de edad, solicita préstamo para la refacción de su vivienda, específicamente para comprar materiales de construcción, cabe decir que los trabajos los realizará por su cuenta, es decir que él hará las reparaciones en el hogar. El cliente es residente de la Zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto. Gervasio ya tiene 5 créditos con IMPRO,  este es su primer crédito con KIVA.
texts.en:
Gervasio is a bricklayer. He is a widower and has four children aged 5, 7, 9, 11 to raise. He is seeking a loan to repair his house, specifically to buy construction material. Of course, he will do the repairs himself. Gervasio lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Ingenio in the town of El Alto. He has already had five loans with IMPRO, but this is his first with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: house repairs

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora B. is from the village of San Lorenzo. She is 47 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teodora owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Teodora has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells a raised pig.
In 2010, Teodora joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Teodora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean K. is 39 years old and is married; her husband is a farmer. She has five children who all go to school.

Jean is currently in the business of selling beer, soda and rice from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Jean hopes to be able to stock clothes to sell as well.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Mi Nuevo Desarrollo Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Mi Nuevo Desarrollo está integrado por seis socias, las cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en la comunidad. La coordinadora del grupo es la sra. María Ana T. Matute, ella tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho.  María Ana se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos de uso personal y cosméticos, ella trabaja 4 horas al día ya que padece del Colon y de Soplo en el corazón y eso le impide emplear más horas de trabajo diario. Su ventaja es que los productos que ofrece se venden muy rápido, ya que a las mujeres siempre les gusta verse muy bonitas y su dificultad es que vende al crédito y en ocasiones sus clientas le quedan mal con el pago. Su sueño es tener algunos empleados para aumentar su área de ventas y obtener más ingresos. Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar perfumes, cremas, shampoos, acondicionadores, listicks, sombras de ojos, rímel, desodorantes, etc, ya que en esta época del año sus proveedores tienen muchas promociones y quiere aprovecharlas. Tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y está  muy agradecida con el apoyo que ha recibido porque su negocio le ha permitido suplir sus necesidades más básicas.
texts.en:
The Mi Nuevo Desarollo community bank has 6 members that have different businesses in the community. The group's coordinator is Maria Ana T. Matute, who is 55 married with 6 children and lives with her family in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho. 

Maria Ana makes a living selling cosmetics and related products door to door. She only works 4 hours daily since she has colon problems and a heart murmur and those keeps her from working longer. Her advantage is that the products she sells move quickly since women always like to look nice. A disadvantage is that she sells on credit and sometimes her customers don't pay on time. 

Her dream is to have a few employees to expand her sales territory and increase her income. She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, creams, shampoos, conditioners, lipsticks, eye shadow, mascara, deodorants, etc, since this time of year her suppliers have great deals and she wants to take advantage of them. 

She has had several loans with FAMA and is very thankful for the support since her business has allowed her to meet her basic needs.

loans.use: Purchase deodorants, creams, shampoos, conditioners, cosmetics

loans.name: Corazoncitos I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Corazoncitos I porque todas las integrantes consideran que son de buen corazón. Se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.La señora María de Jesús  Méndez es la Presidenta del grupo. Tiene 38 años, estudió hasta quinto semestre de la carrera de  administración, es comerciante y tiene en total dos hijos; un varón y una mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería y zapatos que inició desde hace tres años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de los productos que vende ya que cuando compra por mayoreo le realizan un buen descuento. Sus clientes opinan que es una persona muy amable y siempre los trata con mucho respeto, ella trata de mantener a sus clientes complacidos. Inició su negocio en el municipio de Tula en donde tenía pocos clientes pero al cambiar su lugar de residencia a Pachuca se ha consolidado como una buena vendedora y el número de clientes ha ido en aumento. Al solicitar este préstamo se sintió ilusionada y feliz porque ahora podrá cumplir con lo que les prometió a sus clientes.Quiere este crédito para surtir algunos pedidos que ya le solicitaron. También espera en un futuro no muy lejano construir un local afuera de su casa para que de esta manera incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group is called “Corazoncitos I” [Hearts] because its members regard themselves as people with good hearts. It is made up of 9 members, and they are in the State of Hidalgo in Mexico. Mrs. Maria de Jesus M. is the group’s president. She is 38 years old and has two children, a son and a daughter. She completed five semesters of Business Administration and has been a merchant for three years selling lingerie and shoes.
She requests the loan to buy merchandise wholesale, because wholesale purchases grant her a good discount. Her costumers consider her a kind person who treats them with respect and she strives to keep them satisfied.  
Mrs. M. started her business in the town of Tula where she had few costumers but after her moving to Pachuca, she has proven to be a good salesperson and the number of costumers is steadily increasing. 
She feels happy and hopeful requesting this loan because it would allow her to fulfill several orders already placed by some of her costumers. She also hopes to build a place for her business outside of her house which would help her to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Adelaida; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como shampus,cremas,perfumes de varon y mujer entre otros luego lo distribuye a sus smigos, ella trabaja para la linea avon.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas productos para su negocio y asi tener mas variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Adelaida] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Adelaida is 25 years old.  She is in a cohabitating relationship, has one son, and sells Avon brand beauty products, such as shampoo, creams, men’s and women’s cologne, among other items.  She then distributes them to her friends.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy additional products so that she can offer a greater variety to her customers.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita T. is a widow who lives in Barangay Prosperidad, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food vending business. Carmelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $118, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP, with which she intends to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Carmelita T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Roberta Zenaida

texts.es:
Roberta de 18 años, es comerciante informal de productos de belleza, ropa y juguetes. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado vendiendo los productos de belleza Avon etc. 

Siguiendo con esta actividad ha podido solventar sus gastos promocionando en el sector donde vive su mercadería. Vende juguetes para niños y niñas, ropa, cosméticos Avon con ayuda de su mama. Ella quiere seguir con las ventas de su mercadería por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo juguetes por la época navideña ya que hay mucha demanda, ropa y cosméticos para sus clientes mujeres. 

En el futuro quiere incrementa su mercadería y tener un local para tener suficientes ingresos.
texts.en:
Roberta is 18 years old.  She is an informal saleswoman who sells beauty products, clothes and toys.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral and works selling Avon beauty products, etc.

Through her business, Roberta has been able to cover her expenses, promoting her merchandise in the area where she lives.  She sells boys' and girls' toys, clothes and Avon cosmetics with the help of her mom.  She would like to continue selling her merchandise and would like to use her loan to buy toys for the Christmas season since there is a high demand.  She will also buy clothes and cosmetics for her female customers.

In the future, Roberta would like to increase her merchandise and have sales premises so that she can make enough income.

loans.use: To buy toys and clothes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is thirty-seven years old and married to a teacher. They have three children and live in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house and to educate his children. He is in the motorcycle transport sector. He has been in the business for fourteen years, and the business is still profitable. His dream is to buy a taxi. At this time, Patrick needs the loan facility to buy land.

loans.use: Buying land

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria F. D. B. D. 51 años D. edad, es una persona soltera, quien vive junto a su hija y una nieta, con quienes resiD. en Ilopango, en el departamento D. San Salvador. DesD. hace 30 años atrás que Ana se dedica al oficio D. corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor D. sí. Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos, y agujas, D. forma que siempre pueda elaborar su trabajo con toda la calidad que la identifica. Salir adelante con las ganancias D. este negocio es fundamental para su sustento, ya que es la única fuente D. ingresos con que cuenta para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria F. D. B. is 51 years old.  She is single and lives together with her daughter and granddaughter in Ilopango, in San Salvador department.

Ana has been in the dressmaking business for 30 years.  Over the years she has acquired a lot of experience and also regular customers.  She is a very responsible person who works with a lot of care to do the best work she can.

Ana is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her business, buying a larger quantity of raw materials such as fabric, buttons, threads and needles.  She would like to make this investment so that she continue doing the high-quality work for which she is known.  The profits from Ana's business are essential to her as she uses them to support herself.  This is the only source of income that she has and it helps her to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and needles to improve her business

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
What makes a good business entrepreneur? Personal characteristics? Relationship with environment? Or competitive advantage? All of these characteristics are related to our next ambitious borrower, but the main driving force is a unique idea and a strong faith in accomplishing it.

Gulnara M., 32, is the treasurer of this group. At this moment she is a housewife with two kids, but she has big business possibilities in the future. Gulnara’s husband is a truck driver. Several times a week he has to make hard long trips to remotest areas of the country. Transporting a large number of goods requires much patience and endurance. 

Their children are six and three years old and can now be taken to a daycare. So Gulnara plans to start a business selling consumer goods and groceries in a market in her hometown of Kerben. The wholesale goods will be brought by her husband during his trips. This will help her cut the  transportation costs significantly.   Her husband’s salary has already allowed the family to purchase several heads of cattle and send them to Gulnara’s parents for tending. 

The returns from the new business will be spent on constructing a house and setting up their own private shop. Gulnara would be very thankful to all lenders, since having a chance to sell goods in a local market is very important for her family’s well-being. 

  --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Creativa 4 Group

texts.es:
Yudelka es una D. nuestras mujeres empresarias, dedicada a la venta D. productos misceláneos como cosméticos, para uso del hogar, belleza, entre otros, su metodologia es venta ambulante, llevándolo a las casas D. sus clientes. Es una joven soltera D. apenas  26 años, trabaja con la finalidad D. proveer sus necesidades, estudiar y poder formar su familia en un futuro. Pertenece al grupo Creativas 4, compuesto por 5 micro empresarias, D. la ciudad D. Santo Domingo norte

Yudelka esta recibiendo su quinto prestamos con Esperanza internacional, y gracias a que sus pagos han sido puntuales, ha podido reforzar su negocio y hacer buenas inversiones, Sus planes para este nuevo préstamo es para invertir en la compra D. productos cosméticos, sandalias y algunas piezas D. ropa D. playa, ya que viene una buena temporada para estas ventas. las ganancias serán para reinvertido en estos mismo productos. Gracias por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Yudelka is one of our enterprising women dedicated to selling miscellaneous products like: cosmetics, home use items, beauty supplies, among other.  She sells door to door taking her wares to her customers’ homes.  She is a young, single woman, just 26 years old.  She works with the goal of providing for her needs, to study and help form a family in the future.  She is a member of the Creativas 4 (Creative Ones 4) group which is composed of 5 micro entrepreneurs from north Santo Domingo.

Yudelka is getting her 5th loan from Esperanza Internacional thanks to her payments being timely.  He has managed to strengthen her business and make good investments.  Her plans for this new loan is to buy cosmetics, sandals and a few items of beach wear since a good season for sales is approaching.  She will reinvest profits into the same kind of products.  Thank you for your support.

loans.use: For miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia es casada,  tiene 29 años de edad, y tiene 3 hijos de (13,4,10 meses) ; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra todo tipo de materiales, desde, ladrillos, fierros, bloquetas, cemento y otros para la venta, ella desea aumentar su capital y con ello su mercadería, la socia tiene su negocio en el barrio de San Sebastián ella desea invertir el préstamo en capital de trabajo, la socia aumentara a un dinero que tiene guardado. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de este un pequeño capital de trabajo.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria, 29, is a member of the Juntas Y Unidas ("Together And United") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Maria is married and has 3 children (13, 4, 10 months). She operates a business buying and selling construction materials.  The business is located in the San Sebastian neighborhood.  Sra. Maria buys all kinds of construction materials--bricks, rebar, cement blocks, concrete--for sale.  She wants to increase her inventory and expand her business.  She will supplement the loan with money that she has saved so that she has a bit of working capital set aside for the business.

Sra. Maria is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Working capital for construction supplies business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”SACSAYHUAMAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía trabajos tallados en piedra, la socia trae las piedras desde los distritos de Machupicchu y Urcos ella lleva años en este negocio y su taller se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio es ahí donde vas sus clientes a comprar sus trabajos y también la socia lleva algunos trabajos a otros clientes ella trabaja a pedido y en forma independiente, a la vez la socia también realiza trajes para niños manuelitos y muñequería.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio de tallado en piedra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Antonia is a member of the communal bank "SACSAYHUAMAN" located in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.   She is 44 years old, married and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her stone carving business.  Señora Antonia brings the stone from the Machupicchu and Urcos districts.  She has worked in this business for years and her workshop is located in her house.  Her customers come here to purchase her pieces and she delivers some of her works to others.  She works on an independent, order basis.  She also makes clothing for Baby Jesus figurines [for nativity scenes] and doll making.   

She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for her stone carving business.  She is  happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her stone carving business.

loans.name: Munhtulga

texts.en:
Munhtulga is 22 years old and lives with his parents in Hovd province, Mongolia. He began operating a cell phone repair service in 2009 and he supports his parents with his profits. He is a hard-working and polite person. He wants to expand his business and increase his business revenue. 

Munhtulga says, "I am planning to buy a car and start a taxi service so that I can increase my income." He is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT as he needs extra money in addition to his savings to buy a car and operate a taxi service business.

loans.use: To buy a car and start a taxi service.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ar: فاطمه في عمر 34 سنة تعمل في بيع الالبسة الجاهزة لها في عملها سنتين تحب عملها وهو كل اهتمامها فاطمه في طور تكوين اسرة فهي مرتبطة وتسعى الى تأمين منزل جيد لها ولخطيبها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل لتزيد من مدخول المحل وشراء بعض المستلزمات المنزلية لمنزلها الجديد لها حب كبير في تأسيس مستقبل جيد بالاعتماد على نفسها وتأمين مستقبل جيد
texts.en: Fatima is 34 years old and works selling clothes. She has two years of experience in this field. She likes her work and gives all of her attention to it. Fatima is at the stage in her life when she wants to start a family. She is engaged, and she is now trying to secure a good house for her and her fiance. With a loan from Al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods for her store in order to increase the store's revenues. She would also like to buy certain needed items for her new house. Fatima very much desires to secure a good future for herself by working hard and relying on herself.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise for her clothing store.

loans.name: Valeria Adrian

texts.es:
La Señorita Valeria V. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y muchos lugares para visitar, cuenta con variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva los paladares de quienes la visitan, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Valeria tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su abuelita en una casa  que es de su propiedad.
Nuestra socia se dedica a estudiar la carrera de Derecho en la universidad.

Se encuentra en su tercer cerdito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga de su mamá quien es socia activa del banco. Su crédito lo va a invertir en sus estudios.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Miss Valeria V. is a member of the village bank Maria Reina de la Paz. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate and beautiful architecture and many places to visit. It also has a varied cuisine that captivates the palates of those who visit. The people there maintain their culture and traditions.

Valeria is 22 years old, single and lives with her grandmother in a house that she owns. She is studying law at the university.

This is her third loan with the village bank, which she was invited to join by a friend of her mother who is an active member. Her loan will be invested in her studies. 

Her goal is to finish her studies and become a great professional.

loans.use: to pay for her studies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Grace is widowed and has three school-aged children. Grace has a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 11,000 PHP and was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. 

This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. Grace is requesting 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & materials needed for the maintenance of the service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & materials needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa es una comerciante que ha crecido gracias al empeño de su trabajo, pues posee una pequeña pulpería, venta de cosmético y el alquiler de cuartos, con diecisiete años de experiencia en las ventas.
Contando con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, pues el mayor le envía remesa de los Estados Unidos de América, lo que ha logrado ir ampliándose en su negocio. A si como el apoyo financiero de Afodenic, siendo con cuatro ciclos en donde ha mejorado la infraestructura de su casa. 
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de un freezer  horizontal de mil libras y de tres tapaderas grande con el objetivo de poder vender más productos en su pulpería de carne, pollo y productos lácteos, gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa is a retailer that has grown thanks to the efforts of her work. She has a small general store, sells cosmetics and rents room. She has 17 years experience in sales.
She has the support of her husband and her children; the eldest sends her remittances from the United States of America, which has allowed her to expand her business. This is along with the financial support of Afodenic, through which she has improved the infrastructure of her home over the course of four loan cycles. Now, with this new loan, she will buy a 1,000 pound horizontal freezer and three large covers with the objective of being able to sell more products in her store, like meat, chicken, dairy products and sodas.

loans.use: to buy a 1,000 pound freezer to continue buying refrigerated products like: chicken, meat and soda among others.

loans.name: Eida

texts.en:
Eida is a 30-year-old housewife married to Ala.  Eida's husband has a workshop where he sells second-hand fridges besides doing fridge maintenance. 

Eida's husband wants to buy five second-hand fridges he found at a very good price. As he doesn't have the whole amount needed, Eida took out a loan from FATEN so that her husband can purchase the fridges.

The store where Ala is photographed (instead of conservative Eida) is located next to Shate' refuge camp.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: to purchase five used fridges to resell or use parts for fixing fridges in his workshop.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy, a 33-year-old married mother of four in the Philippines, has operated a retail shop that sells biscuits, beverages and canned goods for five years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods. In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Huo

texts.en:
Mrs. Huo, 23, is a married woman and the mother of a kid who lives under her care. Since 2000, she has worked in a crop-planting business on her own land, making an income of approximately $3 each day. Her husband is a mobile construction worker in Siem Reap Province. 

Mrs. Huo’s husband is concerned that he faces difficulties in traveling to his workplace. Her husband always travels to work by hiring a taxi or walking because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Mrs. Huo has requested a loan in the amount of $300 to add with her personal savings to be used to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Virgilio; el tiene 38 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en la ruta de Izcuchaca-Cusco, el socio también se dedica a la agricultura, el socio cultiva maíz y trigo y los productos agrícolas lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte y también mejorar las tierras de. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro y mantenimiento de su carro y también para comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Virgilio, 38, belongs to the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

He is married and has five children.  He alternates his daily chores with providing public transportation services.  He has a car that provided taxi services along the Izcuchaca-Cusco route.  He’s also a farmer.  He grows corn and wheat and sells his crops in the various markets taking place in Anta province.  He wants to expand the transportation business and improve his lands and is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his car, to service his car and also to buy seeds for his crops.

He is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy auto parts, to repair his car and also to buy seeds for his crops.

loans.name: Jun

texts.en: Jun, 45 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a security guard. Their income is $8 per day. She has five children: three are studying, and the other one is working in a guesthouse with $4 per day for her income. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $8 on electricity, $30 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband and her children to travel to work. In the future, she hope to send the rest of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Martha Norma

texts.es:
La señora  Martha Norma,   tiene treinta y cuatro  años  de edad, se dedica  a la venta de pan   desde  hace cuatro años y a la venta de quesos desde siete meses   con su  esposo , Gil dardo que  tiene  la edad de  cuarenta  y dos años .
Es  una señora muy trabajadora le gusta ayudar a su esposo en lo necesario  cuando su esposo va a ordeñar al campo cuando su esposo regresa ella  se dedica a cuajar la leche   y hacer los quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar  insumos para la elaboración de pan como es : harina, leche , levadura, manteca  y huevos.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos una mujer  Ricarda de nueve  años   y  Lorena  de doce años de edad  y un varon Gilberto de  cinco años de edad .
Esta muy contenta con  su negocio   por que cada día va ganando mas clientes  y su negocio va creciendo , le  gusta mucho tener su propio  negocio por que  le ayuda a su  esposo en los gastos  de la casa  y a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener  una panadería mas grande  de la que tiene   de la horita tiene  ya que quisiera  vender pasteles.
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Martha Norma, 44, has been selling bread for the last four years and cheese for the last seven months with her husband, Gildardo, 42.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to help her husband as much as possible.  When her husband heads out to the fields to milk the cows and then when he returns she takes over curdling the milk and making the cheese.

She asked for the loan to buy bread making supplies like: flour, milk, yeast, shortening and eggs.

She has three children: a girl, Ricarda, 9, and Lorena, 12, and one boy, Gilberto, 5.

She is very happy with her business because she’s gaining new customers every day and the business is growing.  She very much likes having her own business because she helps her husband with household expenses and with her children’ schooling costs.

One of her dreams is to have a larger bakery than the one she has now because she’d like to also sell cakes.

She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support they give people who want to have their own business to get ahead and help their families.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 37-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He is from Lebanon. In 1995, he opened his own car repair shop. His job consists of painting the cars and refreshing the old paint. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase additional painting tools and supplies to present good quality services to the clients. In the future, he hopes to further expand his business and continue his work properly to earn a good income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Morena tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos ya tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad, debido a que le genera ingresos considerables. Donde ella vive las calles son empedradas y valastreadas ( son tierra rocosas y disparejas), ella debe caminar a pie durante dos horas y en carro son cinco kilómetros, para ir a comprar los insumos que necesita, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. de la mañana por que hay poco transporte en la zona.

La señora Morena solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para la compra de insumos para el engorde de cerdos, estos serán: concentrado, harinilla y maíz amarillo, así como vitaminas para los cerdos recién nacidos. Además comprara dos cerdos reproductores en periodo de gestación.

Al tener el préstamo, ella podrá comprar los insumos a tiempo para el engorde de sus cerdos y crecerlos más rápido y fácil. Hoy en día ella tiene que viajar al pueblo cuatro veces por semana a comprar los insumos. De esta manera ella podrá comprar más cantidad de insumos, lo que le permitirá comprarlos a mejor precio y tendrá que viajar menos al pueblo y con el ingreso adicional planea comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de fríjol.

A ella le gustaría ahorrar de los ingresos que recibirá, para construir una mejor galera y comercializar más cerdos, ella quiere tener su granja bien establecida, puesto que en la zona no se observan cerdos de raza solo indios que no dejan mucha ganancia como el que ella cuida que es el cerdo de raza.
texts.en:
Sra. Morena is 26 years old and is a single mother with one son.

She has been raising pigs for three years because they generate a substantial income. The streets where she lives are cobbled and gravel (the ground is rocky and uneven) and she has to walk on foot for two hours, which by car is 5 kilometers, in order to buy the supplies she needs and has to get up at 4 a.m. in the morning because there is little transportation in the area.

Morena is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy supplies to fatten the pigs: this will be concentrated feed, coarsely ground wheat mixed with bran and yellow corn, as well as vitamins for the new born pigs. In addition she will buy two pregnant breeding pigs.

Upon receiving the loan she will be able to buy supplies in time to fatten her pigs and grow them more rapidly and easily. Nowadays she has to go to town four times a week to buy supplies. With the loan she will be able to buy a greater quantity of supplies which will allow her to buy at a better price and she will have to spend less time traveling. With the additional income she plans to buy agricultural supplies to plant beans.

She would like to save the income she will receive in order to build a better pig pen and market more pigs. She wants to have her farm well established since one does not see purebred pigs in the area but only native ones, which do not provide as much profit as purebred pigs.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to feed her pigs and to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and the father of five children.

Riyad has owned a shop since 2000, selling mobile phones, accessories and rechargeable cards. He has experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area and the surroundings.
