He decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.en:
Obdulia is 56 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children.

Obdulia has a fish vending business and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Obdulia has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” de la comunidad de Titacani, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo.  Tiene grado de instrucción educación primaria.
	
Maruja trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de comidas, artesanía en bordados y trenzados de mantas.

Con éste préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará nuevas mesas, sillas y dará mantenimiento a su local, también comprará arroz, azúcar, otros insumos para la preparación de los alimentos para su restaurante.  En el negocio le ayuda su hijo.

La señora desea tener su casa y que su hijo sea profesional.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in Titacani in the Juli District of Chucuito Province in the Puno Department.  She is 28 years old and she is a single mother with one child.  She has a primary education.

Maruja has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years now.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business selling food, embroidery, and woven blankets.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, she will buy tables and chairs, and she will perform maintenance on her restaurant.  She will also buy rice, sugar, and other ingredients for the dishes she offers at her restaurant.  Her son helps her with her business.

She would like her own home and for her son to have a profession.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality, responsibility, and saving.

loans.use: to buy new tables and chairs, and to perform maintenance on her restaurant

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Anabelle has a shop where she sells fish like sardines, mackerel and milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. Anabelle requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fish to sell. 

Anabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en:
Hakima is a 52-year-old widow who has been able to raise her three sons to become successful young men by buying and selling used clothes. Her business is based at home.
In addition to the clothing business, Hakima's sons have a painting hobby. They even have a special room in the house where they keep all their painting tools. They asked their mom to sell their paintings to contribute to the household income. 
Now Hakima has applied for a loan to buy new clothes to add to her stock of used clothes and her sons' paintings.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say, 34, a mother of three school-aged children, is in the business of selling fish from a rented booth in a local market in Baray district. Every day she sells fresh fish that are caught by her husband from the river. She typically earns in the neighborhood of $4.00 each day and tries hard to support her family. On the other hand, her husband is a crop farmer who grows many kinds of crop like rice, beans and vegetables both in the rainy season and the dry season. 

Mrs. Say will use this loan to purchase rice seed, bean seed and pesticides. In years to come Mrs. Say intends to buy additional farmland for farming expansion.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, bean seed and pesticides.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, que le gusta el trabajo, es separada hace 6 años, vive en compañía de su hija de 17 años de edad, su nuera y su nieta a la que quiere mucho, cómodamente instalados en su propia casa.  El negocio que tiene Maritza es la venta de mercadería tales como ropa, zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños, iniciándose con un capital propio que envío a un familiar en Lima, quien  a su vez le envío la mercadería. En la actualidad ella misma realiza sus viajes a Lima y escoge personalmente los mejores modelos, para luego venderlo entre sus familiares, vecinos y amistades, muchas veces al contado y otras veces a crédito a 15 días, realizando ella sola la venta y cobranza. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con sus propio tiempo libre para emplearlo en otras actividades, así como también puede ver como crece su capital de trabajo y con las ganancias puede pagar loas gastos de su hogar. Al contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando algunos de sus clientes no cumplen con los pagos de sus créditos, pero a pesar de eso tiene planes de abrir una tienda de ropa ya sea en su casa o en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad. Este será su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de mercadería para ésta campaña navideña como ropa de niños.
texts.en:
Maritza is 45, and a dynamic, enterprising woman who likes to work. She has been separated for six years, and lives with her 17 year-old daughter, her daughter-in-law, and her granddaughter, whom she loves very much. They are comfortably settled in their own house. 

Maritza sells merchandise, such as clothing and shoes for ladies, men, and children. She started out with her own capital, that she sent it to a family member in Lima, who in turn sent her the merchandise. Now, she herself makes trips to Lima to personally choose the best designs, to then sell to family members, neighbors, and friends. Often, she sells for cash, and sometimes on credit payable in two weeks. She sells and collects on her own. 

She likes her business, as it allows her to have her own free time to use in other activities.  As well, she can see her working capital grow, and with the earnings she can pay for her household expenses.

On the other hand, she says that doesn't like it when some of her customers don't make their credit payments. But in spite of that, she has plans to open a clothing store; whether in her home or in some commercial area of the city. 

This will be her first loan with MFP, so she is hoping for your contribution, she that she can continue toward her objectives.

She will use the entire amount of 800 nuevos soles applied for, to buy merchandise such as children's clothing, for this Christmas sales season.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Elavagnon Group

texts.fr: ELAVAGNON est un groupe de deux personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Olassibikan Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un dessinateur du nom de Donatien. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Olassibikan Madeleine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Olassibikan Madeleine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis vingt ans Olassibikan Madeleine vend des friperies de façon ambulante dans un marché du Bénin, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Olassibikan Madeleine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Olassibikan Madeleine et le second membre du groupe ELAVAGNON  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: Elavagnon is a grouping of two people who are friends. The representative of the group, Olassibikan Madeleine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 39 years old and married to a designer called Donatien. The couple has two children who are both at school and in their care. Olassibikan Madeleine lives with her husband and children, and the couple cover the various household expenses between them. Olassibikan Madeleine did not attend school and for the past twenty years she has been selling second-hand clothing while walking around a market in Benin; this business earns her a non-negligeable income. Olassibikan Madeleine gets her supplies from a Benin market. It is the second time that she and the other member of the Elavagnon group have requested financial aid from Alidé with a view to strengthening their working capital and boosting their business, as well as satisfying customer demand.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Grace is 22 years old and is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. She is currently on her third of this four-year course.

Myrna, a member of NWTF, needs PHP 8,000 to pay for the tuition fee of her daughter Grace for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When she graduates, Grace plans to be gainfully employed so she can help improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition Fee

loans.name: Melati Setapak Group

texts.en:
Betseba, 42 and Asysyam, 25 are the additional members and have joined in Melati Setapak group. They requested a loan of totaling IDR 6.000.000 for their businesses improvement. Betseba, 42 is the representative to Kiva. She is married to Bernadus, a 54 year old fishmonger and has an adopted toddler.   
Along with her husband, Betseba runs a business of selling fish. The business aims to support her husband in covering their daily needs and savings for her son’s education in the future.  Betseba wishes to provide fish in the larger quantity. She was interested with the group loan from TLM. Along with Asysyam  Asysyam also wants to use the loan for cakes business. They are expecting the loan provided by Kiva, through TLM will encourage them.

loans.use: to buy more fish to be sold

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Mr Owande is married with five children, 4 in secondary school. He owns a pick-up truck, with which he harvests sand from a nearby river and sells it to construction sites to support his family. He also works as a farmer to meet his family food requirements, makes building bricks for sale, and transports goods for market traders to supplement his income. He employs several young men who work with him in these projects. He needs the loan from PEMCI of US$725 to buy some essential spare parts to service his vehicle. The building industry is a key sector of the economy here, and sand and building bricks are its essential components. Mr Owande is making an important contribution to the larger economy and the local community by creating employment and income.

loans.use: Sand Seller, Brick Maker & Transporter

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil was born in 1960 in Salyan region, Yenikand village and is married with three children. He has ten years experience in farming. When he first started his business, he did not have enough money to improve his business. Then he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought a 0,15 hectare plot of land, which enabled him to increase his yield. Now he is ready for further expansion, and he requests a loan of $1000 to buy 0,3 hectare plot of land.

loans.use: To buy 0.3 hectare plot of land

loans.name: Bintou

texts.en:
K. Bintou is a 31-year-old single mother. She lives with her two children in Yopougon, a township in north of Abidjan. She has sold various fruits and vegetable products since she was 16. This revenue-generating activity has allowed her to pay school fees for her children.

K. Bintou got her first loan from AE&I in April, 2004 after her sister told her about the program. Since then, Bintou has gotten different loans that she reimbursed without any problem. She wants to purchase more goods and increase her revenues.

loans.use: Karamoko Bintou will use the loan to buy higher volume of goods to benefit from bulk purchase price

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita has a grocery store in her home. She's 34 years old and married. Her husband is a driver at the public transportation collective and they have two children. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group along with dona Lucia Hernandez Gonzalez (grocery store). They want to go to a wholesaler where they can buy merchandise in bulk so that they can lower their costs which, in turn, will allow them to stock their stores with more goods and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARGARITA, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, es casada tiene 34 años, su esposo trabaja como chofer de la locomoción colectiva tienen 2 hijos, ella pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2 junto con doña LUCIA HERNANDEZ GONZALEZ (tienda de abarrotes) .Ellas esperan ir a un lugar donde venden las mercaderías al mayoreo y de esta forma rebajar sus costos de compra y lograr abastecer sus locales con mayor cantidad de productos y lograr de esta forma mas ventas.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia is 27 years old, single, and supports her 5 children, aged 8, 6, 4, 2, and 3 months. She lives with her children in one of the Batey community houses in the province of El Seibo. In addition to her children, she shares the barracks with 8 other people. This is her first group loan from Esperanza; there are four other women in her group.

Altagracia hopes to use her portion of her group's loan to sell clothing items and shoes to her community. She is going to name her small business ¨Mercancía de Altagracia¨ (Altagracia´s Merchandise). Eventually she has dreams of buying her own house, and not having to live in the company barracks. She spoke of wanting to save her money so she will have the opportunity to do this.

NOTE: This $600 loan will fund Altagracia's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for resale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: "This business is the source of livelihood for my family. I sell provisions, drinks, foodstuffs, ice fish, and I grind tomatoes and pepper for people living in my community. I always get my goods from New Benin Market, Mission Road and Penso Market," says Mrs. Helen I.. She is 46 years old, married with five (5) children, and she lives in Benin City. She is a member of LAPO union and has been in this business since 1997. She learned the act of trading from her mother. She is seeking a loan of $625 to buy drinks, provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, foodstuffs and buy an additional machine to grind tomatoes

loans.name: Bouré Réffé Toukkel Group

texts.fr:
The group is a micro-enterprise from the ecovillage of Palmarin and is requesting a loan for business activities. Their aim is to fight poverty and combat the exodus and covert immigration of young people by helping them have access to goods locally through the setting up of a store selling fishing supplies and other general items. 

 Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.



Le groupement est un GIE de l'éco villave de palmarin qui sollicite un prêt pour des activités économique.
Afin de lutter contre la pauvreté, l'exode et l'immigration clandestine des jeunes en les aidant de par nos activités de pouvoir se dotter de matériel sur place en implantant un magasin de vente de divers matériel de pêche et autres.

loans.use: To buy and sell general goods

loans.name: Watafutaji A Group

texts.en:
Maimuna, age 33, is married with 4 children (ages 15, 14, 10, and 4).  She owns a furniture business which she began 1 year ago. She opens from 9am to 6pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of around $109.

In the past,  Maimuna  took out 2 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business.  She hopes for a new loan to increase the same business.  She will share this loan with her sub group members who have businesses dealing in selling various foods, grocery and a salon. 

In the picture, Maimuna is second from left, back row

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mwanvita

texts.en:
S. is a hard-working entrepreneur, residing in Tandika area, where she also does her business. She sells clothes, both new and used, and sells traditional attire on credit.

She is in need of Tshs 800,000 ($USD700.00) to help expand her business.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en:
Hosiyat is a very strong business woman. She is wholesaler of household goods, which she buys in lots and sells to several trade places at different markets.She is 57 years old and she is an energetic women with a great potential for work. Her two sons help her to import and export goods from market to their stockhouse, where clients come to purchase goods and place orders for future goods.

Hosiyat has been engaged in this kind of business for over 10 years and has many constant clients. In the photo, you can see Hosiyat on the left and her credit expert, Toirov K, on the right. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase the next batch of goods.

loans.use: To buy products for her household goods business

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Angel is a 34-year-old man with two children and a wife who works at home. He works as a security guard for a business in addition to making and selling caps with his wife's help.

"Due to the lack of employment in our country, I am looking for an alternative to working, dedicating himself to making caps." He hopes to devote himself to just his business in future so he can make it grow and achieve higher levels of sales.

The loan he is requesting is to build a back wall for his home to provide it with greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Don Angel es un hombre de 34 años de edad tiene 2 niños y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, el trabaja en una Empresa como guarda de seguridad , ademas de elaborar y comercializar gorras con ayuda de su esposa. Debido a la falta de empleo en nuestro pais busco otra alternativa de trabajo dedicandose a la elaboracion de gorras, espera en un futuro poder dedicarse solo a su negocio para hacerlo crecer y obtener mayores niveles de ventas. El prestamo lo esta solicitando para cosntruir un muro trasero en su casa y de esa manera darle mayor seguridad a su hogar.

loans.use: Construction of a back all to improve his home's security

loans.name: Lesbia De La Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Lesbia is a certified public accountant, married, 34 years old, with a 3 year old daughter who is currently in pre-school. She lives in her parents’ house. With her prior loans, she built her bedroom and used part for the sale of cosmetics and clothing in order to improve her income and help her face the difficult economic situation in her country. She has worked for eight and a half years in Enacal Juigalpa; for six years she worked as a secretary and a year and a half ago, she was promoted to portfolio recovery analyst.

With this loan, she would like to make improvements to her parents’ home, where she has a small bedroom that she would like to expand; she would also like to build a bathroom to provide better living conditions for her daughter. She was able to finish her studies with significant effort on her part and the support of her husband, who works as an MTI project administrator.

Mrs. G. is highly esteemed by her co-workers who believe that she was very deserving her promotion. In her community, she is well-liked since she is a young woman who is very willing to serve others.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lesbia es Lic. En Contaduria Publica, casada, de 34 años de edad, con 1 niña de 3 años estudiando 1er nivel de pre-escolar, habita en casa de sus padres, con los creditos anteriores construyó su cuarto y la otra parte la utilizó para venta de cosméticos y ropa y así obtener otros ingresos que le ayuden a hacerle frente a la dificil situacion que está atravesando el pais; tiene 8½ años de trabajar en Enacal Juigalpa, de los cuales 6« años los desempeñó como secretaria y hace año y medio fue promocionada al cargo de analista de cartera y recuperacion. Con este crédito pretende realizar mejoras en casa de sus padres donde tiene un dormitorio pequeño que piensa ampliar y construir un baño para darle mejores condiciones a su hija. Logró culminar su carrera con esfuerzo propio y el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como administrador de proyecto en el MTI. La Sra. G. goza del aprecio y estima de sus compañeros de trabajo, por lo que vieron con buenos ojos el ascenso del que fue merecedora, en su comunidad tambien es muy querida, ya que ella es una joven que esta dispuesta a servir al que lo necesita.

loans.use: Expand family bedroom and build a bathroom

loans.name: Rose M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Rose M.. She is married and has four children, aged between 22 and 5. In 2007, Rose established her poultry farming business. Rose requires a loan in order to buy food and drugs for poultry farming. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital, you can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To buy food and drugs for poultry farming.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim S., 47, sells vegetables in the local food market and makes US$6.60 each day. She lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with her husband, Samreth Seng Hun, and their four children. Two of their children still live in the household and help to support the family, while the other two are married and have started their own families.

Sim S.’s husband works as a farmer and typically makes US$5.60 each day out in the fields, but the family would like to see their income increased. Sim S. has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike to transport her vegetables to the market where she sells them. The family may also find other uses for the motorbike and it can be a great way for them to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to transport vegetables to market

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María has made snow pants in the shop she has in her house for eight years. A friend of hers taught her how to sew, so she decided to start her own business. However, María can only make pants because she doesn't have the necessary equipment to make other types of garments. She delivers her pants in the market to her fixed customers. She also offers a sewing service to other people and companies.

She has used the loans she has received to purchase the materials to make the pants she sells.

María would like to have a more complete shop and to have more machines so she can make a larger variety of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 8 años, María confecciona pantalones de tela polar en su taller instalado en su casa. Fue una amiga quien le enseñó a coser, por lo que decidió poner su propio negocio. Sin embargo, María solo puede confeccionar pantalones, ya que no cuenta con las maquinarias suficientes como para fabricar otro tipo de prendas. Ella reparte sus pantalones en el mercado a sus clientes fijos. También hace servicio de costura a otras personas o empresas.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado en comprar los materiales para confeccionar los pantalones que vende.

A María le gustaría tener un taller más completo, contar con más máquinas y poder confeccionar más variedad de prendas.

loans.use: To purchase the materials she needs to make the pants she sells

loans.name: Ana Maria Lisette

texts.es:
La señorita Ana, socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en Jr. Salaverry Nº 597, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera. Tiene 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decidió invertir en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para implementar el negocio  “bodega”.

Ana continúa atendiendo el negocio de abarrotes y golosinas para así poder solventar sus gastos. Ana estudia contabilidad y al mismo tiempo trabaja en el  Banco de Crédito.  

Con el préstamo de S/.2,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y golosinas, comprará 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, 2 paquetes de fideos, 2 cajas de gaseosas y 2 paquetes de frugos.

Ana es una joven y una mujer luchadora con ganas de salir adelante. Ella quiere aprovechar su soltería para cumplir algunos de sus sueños, esperando terminar su carrera para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana is a member of the Communal Bank of Talented Women located at Jr. Salaverry No. 597, Callería district, Ucayali department. She is 21 years old and single. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years, deciding to invest the first loan of $100 that she received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of wholesale groceries in order to start a grocery shop. She is still working in the grocery and candy business in order to cover her expenses.

Ana is studying accounting and at the same time she is working in the Banco de Crédito (Credit Bank). With the loan of $775, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of groceries and sweets. She will buy 1 sack of sugar, 1 case of milk, 2 cases of soft drinks, and 2 cases of fruit beverages. Ana is a young woman who is a born fighter yearning to get ahead. She wants to take advantage of her unmarried state in order to accomplish some of her dreams, hoping to complete her degree course in order to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and sweets

loans.name: Famil

texts.en:
Famil H. is 54 years old and has three daughters. In spite of his age, he continues to work hard to support his family. In 1995, Famil started his own livestock breeding and sales business, since working as an accountant did not allow him to earn enough to cover his family needs. The cattle purchase and sales business, on the other hand, has helped Famil gain valuable professional experience and has improved his family's financial stability. 

At present, Famil would like to take out a loan of US$1,200 to be able to purchase more cattle for sale. In turn, he hopes to generate additional income for his family and improve the quality of life for his children who have always supported him in his work.

loans.use: Purchase of four calves

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Il habite à Womé, un petit village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Afi est revendeuse des ustensiles de cuisine et des plastiques. Elle aimerait accroître son commerce en achetant plus de marchandises pour la revente.
texts.en:
Afi A., 42, is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Womé, a little village situated northwest of Lomé, the Togolese capital. Afi sells kitchen utensils and plastic articles. She would like to grow her business by buying more merchandise to re-sell.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying plastic items and kitchen utensils for re-sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A. is 40 years old and runs a retail clothing business. She also sells some mobile phones from her shop which is located along the main street in Jinja town. Her business has been in existence for a period of 5 years. She is requesting this loan to purchase additional supplies of dresses, ladies suits, gents shirts and trousers including some mobile phones in preparation for the anticipated increase in demand of these products during the upcoming festive season.

The income from this business enables her to care for her 4 children, pay her lady shop assistant, settle the shop rent and utility bills. Her great dream is to accumulate enough capital  to enable her to operate a clothes wholesale business instead of the present retail shop.

loans.use: Purchase more dresses, ladies suits, gents shirts and trousers including some mobile phones.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey V. is a villager in Trompaing Anh Chanh village in Kampong Cham province. She sells fish in the local village. Since this business is doing well, she wants to expand it by selling her fish door-to-door, so she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike. Mrs. Srey V. is a 41 year old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a laborer, and the youngest one is still at home.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 36 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos, vive con su pareja quien lo apoya mucho en su negocio y felizmente cuentan con una casa propia. Desde hace 14, diariamente se viene dedicando al transporte de pasajeros, para él lo más importante es trabajar duro, ya que de antemano quiere brindarle todo lo necesario a sus hijos que están estudiando y son su razón de ser, es propietario de un motocarro con el que trabaja. A Wilmer le gusta su trabajo porque conoce muchos lugares y trata con varias personas, además le es muy rentable. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su motocarro que tiene algunos desperfectos.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 36 years old, is the father of 2 children, lives with his partner who supports him in his business and they are the happy owners of a home. For the last 14 years he has worked on passenger transport. The most important thing for him is to work hard because he wants to provide everything necessary for his children in school, and they are his reason for being. He is the owner of a motorcycle which he operates. Wilmer likes his job because he knows many places and he deals with a variety of people, and the business is very profitable. This is his eighth loan with MFP, with the loan request he will repair his motorcycle which has some damages.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle Repair

loans.name: Mr. Chenda Phat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
13 people who all live in Trapang Buon village in Kampong Chhnang province formed the village bank loan. Mr. Chenda P. is the village bank president. He is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar. Aside from this business, he is a firewood seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wishes to expand it buy purchasing a horse in order to transport his firewood to sell door to door. His wife, Mrs. H. Srey Aun, is a palm sugar seller. Mr. Chenda P. is 30 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old.

Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a horse in order to transport his firewood to sell door to door.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
N. is 41 years old and is the leader of a group that consists of three members. She has one child who is studying in grade 9. N. has been selling jewelry since 1993; at first she started this business in her home and after that, she could afford to own a shop in the market. She is a very clever businesswoman; she imports her products from various places around the country and sells the jewelry in bulk to customers from the city.

N. now wants to sell wholesale: she would buy the jewelry in bulk from the field and then take it to Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, herself. Doing that, she can earn a good profit. So N. is applying for a loan to buy more jewelry for her shop.

The other members of the group are:

C., 41, who sells soft drinks and is taking out a loan to buy a sugar cane juice machine for her business; and

N., 49, who is a local construction worker and is taking out a loan to buy more construction materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry for her shop

loans.name: Juanita Nayiri

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de León, la señora Juanita Láinez posee un pequeño negocio de alquiler de videojuegos el cual es visitada por varios niños y jóvenes que hacen uso del servicio.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es solicitar un crédito para la compra de los videojuegos y así continuar con su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión por ser muy popular en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the central market of the city of Leon, Mrs. Juanita L. has a small video game rental business which is frequented by children and young people who use her services. The reason for her turning to Ceprodel and requesting the loan is to be able to purchase video games and thus continuing her business which needs the investment since it is very popular in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of video games

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es: Avelino cuenta con 40 años, hace un años vive son su pareja, con la que tiene un hijo. En su juventud, con el afán de tener terrenos cultivables taló árboles y sacó malezas para convertir esos terrenos en chacras cultivables, ahora que pasaron los años, estas tierras producen café, cacao y frutos cítricos, los cuales son muy rentables. Por el momento, a cada una de sus siembras no las abona con fertilizantes químicos, solo se dedica a remover constantemente los surcos de sus plantaciones y las va abonando con guano de sus aves de corral, de lo cual su esposa es la encargada de acumular en un lugar apropiado. Avelino nos comenta que este tipo de agricultura la practicaba su padre, sembrados de este modo, los frutos tienen mayor duración en el mercado, mientras que aquellas frutas que han sido cultivadas con productos químicos tienden a pudrirse rápidamente, y otra ventaja es que no requiere de mayor inversión, por ello se siente satisfecho y complacido con la tierra. Avelino es uno de los clientes que no falla en cada una de las reuniones programadas por su analista de crédito. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, en la cual hace compromisos de seguir con la misma responsabilidad en cada uno de sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a quitar las malezas de sus cultivos, por aproximarse los meses de cosecha, asimismo comprará machetes para sacar los arbustos.
texts.en:
Avelino is 40 years old, he has lived with his wife for a year and has a young son with her. In his youth, eager to have cultivable lands, he felled trees and cleared undergrowth in order to convert these terrains into cultivable fields - now that years have passed, these lands produce coffee, cacao and citrus fruits, all of which are very profitable. At the moment, not one of his crops is fed with chemical fertilizers, and he only needs to continually plough his furrows and fertilize them with manure from the birds he kept, which his wife is in charge of keeping in an appropriate place. Avelino tells us that this is the type of farming his father used to practice: sown in these ways, the fruits have a longer life-span in the market, while fruits which have been cultivated with chemical products tend to rot quickly. The other advantage is that it doesn't require large investments, which means he feels satisfied and please with his lands. Avelino is one of those customers who never misses a meeting with his credit analyst. This is his second loan with MFP, for which he has promised to continue with the same responsibility in meeting each one of his repayments. The money which he is asking for is to be able to clear the undergrowth from his lands, as the harvest months are approaching, so he will buy machetes in order to pull out weeds and shrubs.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cleaning and clearing out his fields

loans.name: Mandela A Group

texts.en:
Mariam J., 45, is married with six children, who are 22, 21, 20, 18, 16 and 12 years old. She fries and sells chicken and fish in Kiburugwa, a place just outside the city center. She started the business in 2000 and works from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $124.

This will be Mariam’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She used the previous loans to increase her chicken and fish business and has paid back her loans successfully. She wants to get her fourth loan to increase the capital of her business.

Mariam will share this loan with subgroup A of the Mandela group. The subgroup has six members, who sell clothes, bites, food and milling. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mariam is first from the right.

loans.use: To increase business capital and buy more chicken and fish to sell

loans.name: Adjara

texts.fr:
D. Adjara est née vers 1955 dans la Commune de Bassila dans le Département de la Donga au Nord du Bénin. Adjarra est veuve depuis trois ans. Adjarra est mère de cinq enfants tous majeurs. Adjarra s’est installée à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin depuis vingt ans. Adjarra vend les carottes, choux, salades, poivron, persille, concombre, etc. Adjarra a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Adjarra veut pouvoir répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Adjarra sollicite son troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Adjara was born around 1955 in the town of Bassila, in Donga County in northern Benin. She has been a widow for three years, and she is the mother of five children, all of age. Twenty years ago, Adjara got situated in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells carrots, cabbage, salads bell peppers, parsley, cucumbers, etc. She has already benefited from two loans from ALIDÉ for developing her business. She wants to be able to respond to the strong demand of her customers. This is why she's requesting her third loan from ALIDÉ. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carrots, cabbage, salads, bell peppers, parsley, cucumbers

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 41-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Kamel has been working as a car repairer and painter for seven years. He also has plans to start a new business, working as a school bus driver. Kamel requested a loan of $1500 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase a van for his new business. Kamel has been a microcredit client for nine years and has always paid on time.  

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financiA. situation. Kamel is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. Kamel decided on doing his business because he wanted to increase his family’s income. In the future, he plans on improving his garage and starting his new business.

loans.use: To purchase a van

loans.name: United Friends #2 Group

texts.en:
Mathew is a shoe salesman in Monrovia.  He is on his second loan with LEAP.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy shoes from the wholesale market. He says that with the loan that he is taking, he will be able to buy between 10 – 50 pairs of shoes.  The amount of shoes will depend on the quality that he chooses to purchase.   

 Mathew explains that he stays competitive in his shoe sales by keeping his area very clean and by taking very good care of all of his customers. Mathew will use 50% of his profits to reinvest in his business and 50% of his profits for his daily needs.

loans.use: A new supply of shoes for his store

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура Воситова  1979 года рождения. Замужем имеет 3 детей. Более 5 лет разводит скот. Она покупает коров и бычков и через 3-4 месяца выводит на рынок для продажи. От оставшейся прибыли  она прикупает еще пару молодняка для  следующей продажи. К осени планирует купить корм и скот. 
 С Микроинвест  сотрудничает  с  2006 года по настоящее время.
texts.en:
Manzura V. was born in 1979. She is married and has 3 children. She has been breeding livestock for over 5 years. She buys cows and bulls and after 3-4 months takes them to a market to sell. She uses remaining profits to buy a couple of calves for the next sale. Manzura plans to buy livestock and feed prior for autumn. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2006 and to present time.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor H. D. R. vive en el departamento costero D. La Libertad. Tras no contar con educación superior y ninguna capacitación laboral, Leonor ha aprendido poco a poco a manejar una venta D. ropa, que se ha convertido en una indispensable fuente D. ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijos menores D. edad, Emilia e Isaías. Al aproximarse ambos hijos a la adolescencia, Leonor trabaja diariamente con la ilusión D. poder costearles una educación formal , que les permita a ellos tener las oportunidades y preparación que ella no tuvo, es por esto que Leonor solicita un préstamo para adquirir nuevos productos  para vender y continuar luchando por darle a su descendencia, un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Leonor H. D. R. lives in the coastal department of La Libertad. Even though she has no high school education and no work training, Leonor has learned, little by little, to manage her business of selling clothes. She has maD. it an indispensable source of income to support her two minor children, Emilia and Isaías. As both children approach adolescence, Leonor works every day with the hope of being able to pay for their formal education, which would allow them to have opportunities and preparation that she did not have. That is why Leonor is asking for a loan to get new products to sell. She will continue to fight to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz R. is from the village of Lakas, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 58 years old. Luz is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a business venture in the service sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing "vidoeke" or sing along rental in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials needed to improved the services offered. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials needed to improved the services offered

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria E. wants to request a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders to further sustain her beauty service business in the village of Caliguian, Burgos, Isabela where her family also lives.

Victoria is now 42 years old and married to a driver named Albert E., 46 years of age. She is blessed with three children namely: Jenalyn, Mary Joy, and Albert. Her first child is working in a computer company while her second child is her partner in their beauty service business, providing services such as manicure, pedicure and hair dressing, especially during special occasions.

Through the amount that she is requesting, Victoria believes that she will be able to buy different colors of nail polish, chemicals for different hairdressing that could fit their customers’ choice and some other beauty services they could offer.

Victoria’s income in the business is of big help in sending her youngest child to school. Sometimes, Victoria also roams house to house to look for customers. She loves the business and so is dedicated in sustaining the business and making it grow.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Blanca Susana

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Susana L. N. es socia del banco Comunal San Miguel, ella vive en la comunidad Los Ángeles que se encuentra a unos 50 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca vía al valle.

Blanca tiene 23 años de edad, se divorcio de su primera pareja,  actualmente convive con otra pareja en unión libre tiene una niña de 7 años  y se encuentra embarazada de 8 meses y aun no sabe el sexo del bebe que lleva en el vientre, la relación con su esposo es estable ya que tienen mucha comprensión entre sí,  su esposo es oficial de albañilería y al momento viven en una casa prestada por un hermano.

Blanca es negociante ambulante de frutas, lleva trabajando en su negocio hace 2 años,  nos comenta que a veces le va bien y otras  no, su horario de trabajo es más o menos de 6H30 hasta las 15H30 todos los días de la semana, dedicándose también a la cría de pollos, chanchos, cuyes, así que cuando tiene alguna necesidad los vende teniendo una solución  para sus problemas de dinero.

Lleva tres años  en su banco comunal,  se siente muy contenta porque todas las socias son muy buenas amigas así como por el apoyo y los beneficios que recibe de la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR porque gracias a los créditos  ha podido  superarse un poco más cada día.

Con el préstamo que reciba de la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para incrementar su negocio con  una gran variedad de frutas  para sus clientes  fijos y captar más clientela.

Su sueño es superarse cada día más y llegar a tener un puesto propio de frutas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Susana L. N. is a partner in San Miguel community bank. She lives in the community of Los Angeles which is located about 50 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. Blanca is 23 years old and divorced but now lives with her new partner in a free union. She has a seven-year old daughter and is currently eight months pregnant, though she still doesn't know the sex of the baby she is carrying. Her relationship with her husband is very stable and they understand each other well. Her husband is works as a mason and they currently live in a house loaned to them by her brother. Blanca has a business selling fruit door to door. She has worked in this business for two years; she says somtimes business is good and other times it isn't. She more or less works from 6:30 in the morning until 3:30 in the afternoon every day. She also raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. So if she is in need she can sell them to deal with her money problems. She has been part of the community bank for three years. She is very happy with the group because the partners are very good friends and offer great support along with the benefits she receives from ESPOIR Foundation. Thanks to their loans she has been able to improve her situation a little more every day. With the loan she receives from the foundation she will grow her business by offering a wider variety of fruits for her regular clients and work to gain new clients. Her dream is to improve every day and hopes to have her own fruit stand some day.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of  fruit

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 50 years old and is a single mother of five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working woman and works hard to support her children. She trades in Ghana, make slippers, shoes, and sandals for both male and females. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She purchases them in different sizes, colors, and designs so that her customers can have some variety.  Her loan asks for your assistance to buy stock in bulk. She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk for clothing store

loans.name: Sourou Parfaite

texts.fr: A. Sourou Parfaite vit à Houéyogbé à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Sourou Parfaite vend des céréales (riz, haricot, sorgho, mil, etc.) au grand marché de Porto-Novo. Sourou Parfaite achète ses produits à Ikpinlè, marché des produits vivriers au Bénin. Sourou Parfaite a plusieurs expériences dans ce métier. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a obtenu une fois un crédit dans l'institution, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Sourou Parfaite sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux faire face aux multiples demandes de sa clientèle, et de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
A. Sourou Parfaite lives in Houéyogbé in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin.  She sells grains (rice, beans, sorghum, millet, etc.) at the grand marketplace of Porto-Novo.  She purchases her goods in Ikpinlè, a market for staple foods in Benin.  She has a lot of experience in this trade.  Sourou Parfaite is a former ALIDé client having obtained a loan in this micro-finance institution that she repaid.  She's requesting a second loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business in order to cope better with the multiple orders from her customers and to provide for her small family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains (beans, rice, sorghum, millet, corn)

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Fishing is the most important part of 25-year-old Seab S.’s daily work. She and her husband have been living on a fishing boat on the river for more than nine years. This couple wake up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their money after their buyers sell all of the fish that they bought. 

Seab S. and her husband also support their two children who are enrolled in school. Seab S. is not comfortable, because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: K. Angèle est née en 1968 à Houègo à Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Angèle est mariée à ZINSOU Sagbo Antoine, un maçon et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Angèle vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Angèle supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. C'est depuis 10 ans que Angèle réside à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Angèle n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Angèle mène depuis trois ans environs comme activité, la vente des fruits (orange, etc.) et de l’arachide. Angèle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Angèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d’agrandir son commerce et de la diversifier par la vente du pain sucré, Angèle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Angèle was born in 1968 in Houègo, in Agblangandan, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. Angèle is married to ZINSOU Sagbo Antoine, a mason, and is the mother of three children, who all attend school. Angèle lives with her children and her husband. She supports the family together with her husband. For ten years, she's been living in Agbalilamè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. She never attended school. For about three years, she's been selling fruits (oranges, etc) and peanuts. Angèle gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loans without problems. In order to expand her business and to diversify by selling sweet bread, she's seeking her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of fruits, peanuts, and sweet bread

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Danelia tiene un negocio que es un quiosco ubicado en el colegio Orfila Pérez Ponce desde hace dos años, ella vende diferentes productos como golosinas, gaseosas, quesillos etc. La señora es madre de siete hijos los cuales junto a su esposo logro sacar adelante, de los siete hijos solo el menor está a  su cargo. Por lo que es una señora muy alegre y además disfruta mucho de su trabajo. ya que  está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir lo en su negocio ya que necesita  comprar  productos para el negocio, por lo que siempre sueña con mejorar la condiciones adecuadas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Danelia has run a kiosk located in the Orfilia Pérez Ponce high school for the past two years. She sells different products such as candies, sodas, soft cheeses, etc. This woman is the mother of seven children who, together with her husband, have managed to get by. Of their seven children, only the youngest still lives at home. Danelia is a very cheerful woman, and she enjoys her work very much. Now she is looking for new funding to invest in her business since she needs to buy its supplies. She always dreams of improving the conditions that are suitable for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el sector Indoamérica, de la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 10 años de dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral en su casa. Usualmente cría patos, pollos y ovejas los cuales comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo). Este negocio constituye su única fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante.

Ella considera la crianza de sus animales como una tarea que demanda mucha responsabilidad por lo que trata de brindarles una adecuada alimentación en base a maíz, polvillo y pastos naturales. Debido a la cercanía de la temporada navideña, Mariana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para engordarlos y ofrecerlos en venta, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por pirmera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en excelentes profesionales en el futuro. Ella es una madre responsable y trabajadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condicion de madre soltera.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 30 year old single mother. She has three dependent children and lives in the home of her parents, located in the Indoamérica section of the city of Lambayeque which is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 10 years, Mariana has been raising and selling small animals and poultry from her house. She usually raises ducks, chickens, and sheep and sells them at the Moshoqueque Market (the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo). This business is her only source of income, so she is always striving to stay ahead.

Mariana considers raising animals to be a job that demands much responsibility. She provides adequate nutrition through a combination of corn, fodder, and natural grasses. Due to the upcoming holiday season, Mariana wants to purchase more animals to fatten and offer for sale. She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest desire is to see her children become excellent professionals in the future. She is responsible, hardworking, and has managed to get ahead despite being a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to sell

loans.name: Julius Kariuki

texts.en:
Julius is married to Faith, and they have two children, Alex and Victor. He sells second-hand clothes to residents within his business locality and also to rural areas where he gets more orders. He has been in this business for six years now.

Julius was introduced to KADET by existing clients and he is servicing his second loan, with no previous credit history. He intends to use the loan he has applied for to increase his stock of second-hand clothes. With the extra profits, Julius will purchase a piece of land.

He hopes to construct his own residence and other rental houses as he believes he is focused and determined.

loans.use: to increase his stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 49-year-old rice farmer. She started tilling her farm to raise money for the entire family's needs. She has only one child. She is doing the best she can to be a good mother and a good wife. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities. With this loan, she won’t need to apply for a loan with loan sharks who charge a higher interest rate.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
The selling of kerosene is an interesting and exciting business activity for Ifeoma. She has a tank that she uses to store her kerosene and sells at retail prices to her customers in Lagos, Nigeria. She loves this business because her customers pay in cash when they come to purchase her kerosene.

Ifeoma hopes for a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with a child who is excelling in school. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
Dolly tiene 27 años, es una emprendedora mujer que vive con su esposo José Luis y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 3 años, en casa propia.

Desde hace 3 años, junto a su esposo se dedican al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro, él maneja y ella se encarga de la administración de las ganancias, refacciones y mantenimientos del vehículo. Dolly no puede dedicarse a una labor que le ocupe todo el día porque sus hijos aun necesitan de sus cuidados, es por ello que con su esposo decidieron incursionar en este negocio. Para el futuro, desean comprar otro motocarro para empezar una pequeña empresa de transportes local. 

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y desde el comienzo de sus créditos ha demostrado ser muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita quiere refaccionar su moto y dejarla óptima el trabajo por las diferentes calles de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Dolly is 27 years old. She is an entrepreneur. She lives with her husband José Luis and their 2 children who are 14 and 3 years old. They live in their own home. They have worked for the past 3 years in passenger transportation with their motorcycle taxi. He drives and she is in charge of profit administration, repairs and maintenance of the vehicle. Dolly cannot work at a job that keeps her busy all day because her children still need her care. That’s why together they decided to tackle this business. In the future they would like to buy another motorcycle taxi to start a small, local transportation business. This is her fourth loan with MFP and since the beginning of her loans, she has shown she is very responsible making her payments. She wants to repair her motorcycle with the money she is applying for now and leave it in ideal condition for work on the different city streets.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi

loans.name: John Kiptoo

texts.en:
John Kiptoo is a man of thirty five years who is married with five children. He buys maize from farmers within his area of residence (Kapkuto village in Eldoret) and then resells it at a profit. He has been in this business for two years now.

John knew about KADET through a group called Tembelio which was already registered with KADET and he joined them. He has applied for a loan which he is going to use to buy maize for resale.

John says that, with the extra income he gets from the business, he is planning to educate his children and provide them with basic needs like clothing, food and housing.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Kamukamu Kasambya Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old woman living in Karuguuza, Uganda. She sells local brew and alcohol which has sustained her and her family.

Jane is the treasurer of her group called Kamukamu Kasambya which is based in Karuguuza, Uganda. The group has been in existence for five years and now has twenty-one active members who access credit from HOFOKAM. The group members deal in activities like poultry, restaurant, retail business, clothing, butchery, selling dry foods and cereals, and bar business.

In addition to selling local brew, Jane also farms to sustain her family requirements. She intends to use the loan to buy more local brew to sell.

Note: Jane is sitted at the centre forward in the group photo.

loans.use: To buy more local brew and alcohol to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Despite being married so young, 19-year-old Joy B. really wanted to be productive in her own way to support the needs of her three children. Her children range in age from three months old to four years old. Joy learned to make ice cream from her husband. To be able to make this a business and have their own source of income, Joy joined ASHI and requested a loan. At first their business went well. However, because of all their expenses for food, clothing, and other basic needs, Joy has not able to re-invest their income in the business. It was just small enough to cover all of the expenses of her family and business. With that, Joy was not able to sustain her business. Her husband sells “pandesal” (a Filipino favorite bread in the afternoon) every day to have an income to support their needs.

Now that summertime has come to the Philippines, Joy wants to restart her ice cream making business. Therefore, she is requesting a much larger loan through ASHI to purchase the needed ingredients. Her husband will be the one to sell the ice cream to people around their town and in the villages. With this business and with the support of the loans she can access, Joy and her family hope that someday her business will be stable and profitable, providing them a better kind of life.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making ice cream.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 56  años.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender chicha de jora. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza y gaseosas. El sueño de la socia es ampliar su local de la chichería.     

Lucila se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucila belongs to the "Valle Sagrado" (Holy Valley) communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, and she is 56 years old. She currently lives in the city of Calca. Her main business activity is selling chicha de jora (a traditional Andean drink made of fermented corn). She has been in this business for 10 years, and it has gone very well for her. She needs the loan to buy beer and soft drinks. Her dream is to expand her chichería (the shop in which she makes and sells the chicha de jora). Lucila is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium, and she promises to pay off her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Herlita

texts.en: Herlita B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old and has seven school-aged children. Herlita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years now. Herlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Herlita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Tarcicia

texts.es: Tarcicia tiene 62 años, comparte su vida con sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. muy joven se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, actividad que le ha enseñado sus padres, ahora es parte D. su vida y lo transmite a sus hijos, quienes la ayudan en el trabajo. En la actualidad se dedica a criar animales como vacas, para comercializar su leche y ovejas para venderlos durante los días sábados en la feria ganadera D. su zona. D. esa manera ha logrado obtener sus ganancias, y por tal motivo ha decidió aumentar la cantidad D. animales que tiene. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP,  será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras D. este aporte ya que le será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito, invertirá en la compra D. más ovejas para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Tarcicia is 62 years old, and shares her life with her 5 children in her own home. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young; her parents taught her these skills. Now it is part of her life, and she is teaching it to her own children, who help her with her work. Currently she is raising animals such as cows, to sell their milk, and sheep, to sell on Saturdays in the livestock market in her area. In this way she has managed to generate an income, and for this reason she has decided to increase the quantity of animals that she has. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with MFP. She will be responsible with her payments, and is grateful to the people who will be providing this support, since it will help her to make progress with her business. With the loan, she will invest in the purchase of more sheep to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Dodarbek

texts.ru: Чононов Додарбек проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Братья на заработках в России. Сам Додарбек имеет средне - специальное образование, медбрат. По профессии работал 2 года. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. Имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи и фрукты. В этой области более 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Dodarbek C. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. His brothers work in Russia. Dodarbek has a secondary-specialized education as a nurse. He worked in that field for 2 years. Currently, he is involved in agriculture. He has a large plot of land, where he grows vegetables and fruits. Dodarbek has been in this field for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu T. N. is 41 years old. She lives in Xom Ngoai village. She not only grows rice, but also sells building materials. She has two children who are going to school. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and repaid punctually. The last cycle she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To invest in her shop.

loans.name: Group 1

texts.en: Lorna A. owns and operates a business rating a pump boat. Her main source of income comes from selling fresh fish like pirit, malansi, guto and others in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has three grown-up children. Lorna is from the village of Hasaan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She has been in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to provide for the financial needs of her family. Lorna is the leader of a three member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Akatongore Savings & Credit, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
With the traits of hard work and high self-esteem, 32-year-old Prossy A. has tried beyond limits to maintain her general merchandise retail shop. She has been operating it for over 8 years from the Akatongore trading center in Ibanda in addition to her farming enterprises and owning rentals. Being one of the most attractive businesses here in Uganda, many business entrepreneurs have tried to invest in it as it normally cuts across all domestic appliances and general merchandise; Prossy is among the lucky ones benefiting from it. 

With this loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more stock as her drawback has been having little capital input. She also hopes to be in position to transform the business into a wholesale one in the future and improve her income. This will make Prossy meet her goals of educating her children and increasing the family income. 

She belongs to a group with other members who insure and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing more stock for the business

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang M., 42, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. M. is a farmer and is able to earn an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. M. is requesting a loan of USD 250 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to buy a new motorbike for her husband so he can operate his business efficiently.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. M.'s husband appears in the photograph because M. was not available.

loans.use: repair the house

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: Cipriano es viudo y esta cargo de dos hijas pequeñas, solicita su primer crédito, tanto en IMPRO como en KIVA para la compra de ganado vacuno, él se dedica a la cría y vende leche a la planta PIL ANDINA. La familia radica en el departamento de La Paz.
texts.en:
Cipriano is a widow and he has his two little girls in his care. He requests a first loan from Impro (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase milking cows. He raises milking cows and sells the milk he gathers a company named Pil Andina. The family lives in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian U. is currently in the business of selling groundnut, lemons and green vegetables  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to sell.  Vivian is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children and 3 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest her profits into her business by stocking various goods to sell

loans.use: Stock more bags of groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still young for school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is high transportation costs. 

Fatuma has been selling Khangas (garments) for the last three years. She sells door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs. She travels from Kenya to Tanzania to purchase Khangas of good quality, hence the high transportation costs incurred. She hopes to open a shop to sell Khangas in the future. 

Her major reason for working with Yehu is because of its accessibility to sustainable financial services. With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase a bundle of Khanga's and clothes for women and children for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of Khanga's and clothes for women and children for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa  Susana

texts.en:
Adjoa G. Susana sells snails at Abura.   Adjoa G. Susana has received junior high school education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer.  

Adjoa G. Susana has been selling snails for some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more snails to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for the expansion of her business.

The picture displays Adjoa selling her snails at the market.

loans.use: buy more snails to sell

loans.name: Coquetas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Coquetas, por el buen humor que tienen las integrantes. Está ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes.La señora María Luisa B. es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 33 años estudio hasta el bachillerato, es comerciante y tiene en total 5 hijos. Ella se dedica a vender productos de temporada y tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que inicio hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para comprar fruta y flor, para la temporada navideña.Sus clientes se sienten contentos porque en diferentes temporadas del año pueden comprarle y no tener que salir a otra comunidad. Al solicitar este préstamo ella se siente con un apoyo diferente al de su familia ya que con este préstamo podrá tener una mejor casa para sus hijos.Espera seguir teniendo estos préstamos para darles mejores estudios a sus hijos, y así puedan tener un mejor trabajo. Su sueño es tener locales de ropa y tiendas de abarrotes en comunidades rurales para que las personas de su comunidad no tengan que salir lejos a conseguir lo que necesitan.
texts.en: This group is called 'Coquetas' (Flirts) because its members have a good sense of humor.  The group is located in the state of Mexico and has 11 members.  Mrs María Luisa B. is the group's treasurer.  She is 33 years old and studied through senior high school.  She is a saleswoman and has 5 children.  She sells seasonal products and has a grocery store which she set up 10 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruits and flowers for the Christmas season.  Her customers are happy because throughout the different seasons of the year they can buy from her and don't have to travel to another community.  As she requests her loan, she is pleased to have support from a source other than her family since with this loan she will be able to have a better house for her children.  She hopes to continue receiving these loans so that she can support her children in their studies and thereby help them to get better jobs.
