Her dream is to have clothes stores and grocery stores in rural communities so that people from these communities don't have to travel far to buy what they need.

loans.use: To buy fruit and flowers for the Christmas season

loans.name: Marcelo Calixto

texts.es:
Marcelo de 45 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa (aparece en la foto) e hijos  en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace tres años comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos. El inicio con una inversión de víveres de $ 60.00 poco a poco la gente le comenzó a comprar los víveres y pudo ubicar su tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad su esposa trabaja en la tienda desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm mientras que el sale a recorrer las calles con una tricimoto y así ganar más dinero hasta que en la noche el se encarga de la tienda para que su esposa atienda a sus hijos. Vende arroz, azúcar, aceite etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, aceite, arroz para surtir mas la tienda. En el futuro quiere tener más grande su tienda y poder construir su tienda de cemento ya que es de ladrillo y caña.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 45 years old and has a small store in the front area of his home.  He lives with his wife (shown in the photograph) and children in a hamlet called “Playas.”  It is one of Ecuador’s tourist areas and features a large variety of seafood.

He began the store three years ago so that he would be able to support his wife and two children.  He started with an investment of $60 and little by little people began buying from him, so he was able to locate the store in front of his home.

His wife works in the store, from 7:00 Am to 9:00 PM, while he patrols the streets on a three-wheeled motorcycle, earning more money, and in the evening he works in the store so that his wife can care for the children.   He sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

He will use the money from this loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, and rice for the store.  In the future he wants to better supply his store and expand it, and later build it out of concrete.  It is currently made of brick and thatch.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Chhun Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people who live in Prey Chheu Teal village, Takeo Province are taking out a village bank loan.  They have selected Mrs. C. T. as the village bank president.  They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living conditions.

Mrs. C. T. weaves silk cloth for sale to support her family while her husband, Mr. Im Ouch, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support his family.  To increase their daily income, Mrs. C. T. is asking for a loan to buy more silk for weaving to expand this business.  This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving.

loans.name: Edwin Loenzo

texts.es:
Edwin de 46 años, es taxista informal de las calles de Guayaquil desde que pudo obtener un crédito y lo invirtió en un carro y así el decidió convertirlo en su actividad económica.  

Viviendo con su esposa y tres hijas en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha estado trabajando como taxista informal para tener sus propios ingresos y también le ayuda a su esposa en la comprar y venta de las legumbres. Trabajando desde muy temprano todos los días, haciendo carreras desde $ 1.50 hasta $ 14.00 ha podido mantenerse. 

Quiere utiliza el préstamo para ayudarla en los estudios a su hija ya que está en la universidad y necesita de dinero para poder solventar todos los gastos académicos. En el futuro quiere comprar otro carro y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en: Edwin, 46 years old, is an informal taxi driver in the streets of Guayaquil. When he was given a loan, he invested it in a car and then decided to use this car to make money. Living with his wife and three daughters on the periphery of Perimetral, he has been working as an informal taxi driver to make his own income. Additionally he helps his wife with buying and selling vegetables. He has been able to support himself by starting work early each day and giving rides that cost between $1.50 and $14.00. He would like to use this loan in order to help his daughter continue her education. She is already in college but she needs money in order to be able to cover all of the academic costs. In the future, he would like to buy another car and construct a better house.

loans.use: School.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel es madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad que mantener. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva de manera ambulante, por lo que recorre calles, mercados y barrios con el propósito de conseguir algo de ingresos para su hogar. Inicio este medio de vida por cuenta propia, con pocos productos y con el paso del tiempo logro obtener experiencia y sus propios clientes. Rosibel enfrento ciertos desafíos como problemas de salud, aun teniendo este obstáculo sabia que tenía que trabajar todos los días y salir adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas y trajes debido a los constantes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosibel is a single mother who has two dependent children to support.  She sells new clothes as an itinerant street vendor.  She walks through streets, markets and neighborhoods with the goal of making income for her household.

Rosibel started this business on her own initiative.  At first she had few products to sell but, over time, she gained experience and her own customers.  Rosibel has faced certain challenges such as health problems but, despite these obstacles, she knew that she had to keep working every day and get ahead in life.

Rosibel will use her loan to buy skirts, dresses, pants, shirts and dresses to fill the constant orders that her customers make.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Douglas Ernesto

texts.es: Douglas Ernesto A. P. de 40 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable con su hogar y un excelente padre de familia, el vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de: 9 y 1 año de edad. Douglas, trabaja de lunes a domingo, en su propia pupusería, la cual se encuentra a la par de su casa, en donde su esposa se encarga de elaborar las pupusas y Douglas de atender a las personas y entregar los pedidos a sus clientes, así mismo comercializa bebidas frías y calientes. El negocio es bastante estable, y el cual permite que Douglas junto a su familia puedan contar con una vida estable. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y harina de arroz, así mismo para comprar: queso, chicharrón y frijoles, de manera que pueda contar con toda la materia prima necesaria para aumentar la cantidad de producción de pupusas, de forma que sus ingresos también se vean incrementados.
texts.en:
Douglas Ernesto A. P. is 40 years old and is a hard-working, responsible father.  He lives with his wife and two children, ages 9 and 1.  Douglas works Monday through Sunday out of his home in his own "pupusería" (selling pupusas - thick corn tortillas).  His wife makes the pupusas and Douglas attends to customers and delivers orders.  He also sells hot and cold beverages.

The business is fairly stable and allows Douglas and his family to have a permanent income.  He plans to use the loan to buy more corn, rice meal, cheese, pork rinds and beans.  This will allow him to increase pupusa production and, therefore, income.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, cheese and pork rinds

loans.name: Essa

texts.en: Essa is currently in the business of selling locally brewed alcohol, like siko.  She is 44 years old, married with 3 children who all go to school.  Essa requesting a loan to stock more alcohol like siko and beer to sell.  She hopes to pay her children's school tuition with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol like siko and  beer to sell.

loans.name: Eloisa Francisca

texts.es:
Eloisa es una madre D. familia D. 40 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito D. Ascope, una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia D. Trujillo en la Región La Libertad, ubicada a más D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. calzado por catalogo para todo tipo D. edades. El tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad y la calidad del calzado le permite que sus clientes la recomienden y así generar más ventas D. esta manera cuenta con una clientela fija.

Eloisa desea adquirir más calzado con nuevos diseños ya que se acerca la temporada escolar y por enD. su cantidad D. clientes aumente más. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores D. la zona en donD. resiD.. Las personas que le conocen le consideran como una persona con ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eloisa is a mother, 40 years old, and lives with her husband and children in the Ascope district, a rural area that belongs in the Trujillo province in the Liberty region located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells shoes for all ages by catalog. The time she has spent working and the quality of her shoes has allowed to have a stable clientele since they recommend her.

Eloisa wants to acquire more shoes with new designs since the back to school period is coming and her clientele grows even more. She wants to request Edpyme Alternative a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan to help her with these goals.

She is well known and respected by the townspeople in her area. The people who know her consider her to be a person with a drive to succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marcia Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Marcia C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive por la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales, su rica gastronomía y sus bellos paisajes.

La Señora. Marcia tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 6 y sus dos últimos que son gemelos de 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en su propia unidad de taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

Doña Marcia es estilista, actividad que aprendió estudiando y ya son 14 años que ejerce esta profesión  y es toda una profesional, tiene un local propio y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tientes y otros productos que necesita para su gabinete, es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta porque tiene muy buenas amigas. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marcia C. is a member of the Mujeres de Combate (Women of Battle) communal bank. She lives in the Baños parish. This parish is known for its thermal waters, its delicious gastronomy, and its beautiful scenery.

Marcia is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  Her first child is six years old and goes to school.  The two youngest are three year old twins.  Her husband is a driver, and he works with his own taxi.  They do not have their own house, so they live in a relative’s house.

Marcia is a stylist, and she learned this profession by studying.  She has been practicing this profession for 14 years.  She is a complete professional, and she has her own place of business.  She works every day from eight in the morning until six in the evening.

She will use the money from the loan to buy dyes and other products that she needs for her cabinet.  This is her second loan in the communal bank.  She likes the bank because she has a lot of good friends.  

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy dyes and other beauty products

loans.name: Maria Fortunata

texts.es: Maria tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Pacora en Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Cría los animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Desea obtener un mejor peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio. También planea realizar unos arreglos a sus corrales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, espera ampliar su negocio para poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para seguir apoyando a su esposo en solventar los gastos familiares.  Maria es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones puntualmente.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a house that she owns in the rural part of the District of Pacora in Lambayeque.

For the past ten years, she has worked raising and selling animals. She raises the animals in the back part of her house and when they reach a good size, she sells them to the general public and to the businessmen that tend to visit the area where she lives. She wants to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and balanced feed. She wants her animals to reach a better weight and size in order to sell them at a higher price. She also wants to make some repairs to her animal pens. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa. With this investment, she hopes to expand her business so that she can have enough profits to continue helping her husband cover the family expenses. Maria is a previous borrower at Edpyme Alternativa and she made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed, as well as to make some repairs to her animal pens

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia en una comunidad urbana en el distrito D. La Matanza, ubicado en el norte D. Perú. DesD. hace dos años, Melania se dedica al comercio D. útiles escolares. Su negocio está instalado en su domicilio. Melania es muy conocida en la zona y tiene una clientela establecida. Como ya ha comenzado la temporada escolar en Perú, la demanda para suministros escolares ha aumentado. Melania quiere responder a esta demanda y por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra D. más mercadería. Melania cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales D. su comunidad. Es muy trabajadora y siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo D. su familia. Agradece a los prestamistas D. Kiva por su ayuda en aumentar su negocio.
texts.en: Melania is a 48-year-old married mother with two children under her care. She lives in her own home in an urban community of the La Matanza district, located in northern Peru. For two years, Melania has been in the school supply business. Her business is located in her home. Melania is well-known in the area and has a solid client-base. Since the school season has already begun in Peru, demand for her school supplies has increased. Melania would like to respond to this demand, which is why she thinks that it is opportune to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, so that she can purchase more merchandise. She is very hardworking and is always attentive to her family's development and well-being. She gives thanks to the Kiva lenders for their support in helping her business grow.

loans.use: Increase school supplies

loans.name: Geoffrey Gathungu

texts.en:
Geoffrey has been practising farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years.  He is 31 years old, married to Teresaiah, and they have three children.  

Geoffrey was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his fourth loan.  He had repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Geoffrey hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 20. Cristina’s husband works as a farmer.

Cristina is also a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. She earns enough income doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sawe Mutiara Indah Group

texts.en: Ayu Ketut joined the 10 member group Sawe Mutiara Indah to get a loan and training on pig farming. Ayu Ketut got a loan of 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) which will be used to buy a superior species of pig. Pig meat of this type is better quality and has higher selling prices. Since the cost of maintenance of these pigs is almost equal to the cost of maintenance of the local species of pig, she hopes she will earn more. All profit will be saved for the future of her children. For everyday needs, she uses the garden and her husband's income. Every day, Ayu Ketut spends 10,000 IDR for food and 150,000 IDR per month to pay for electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy a superior species of pig.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive con su y sus dos hijos en edad escolar. Ella vive en una zona rural  del distrito de catacaos exactamente en caserío llamado Monte Sullon. Cuenta con servicios de gua y luz.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la producción y venta de harina y chicha de jora. Además también se dedica a la venta de animales como aves de corral y ganado ovino (ovejas), este negocio lo desarrolla en el su domicilio, desde hace mas de 10 años, que le han permitido adquirir experiencia y clientes fijos.

Margarita desea obtener un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar compra alimento para sus animales  y para realizar mejoras en los corrales para sus animales, ello le permitirá tener seguridad para sus animales y generar ingresos para su hogar 

Margarita es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, que lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos, su deseo es poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive con su y sus dos hijos en edad escolar. Ella vive en una zona rural  del distrito de catacaos exactamente en caserío llamado Monte Sullon. Cuenta con servicios de gua y luz.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la producción y venta de harina y chicha de jora. Además también se dedica a la venta de animales como aves de corral y ganado ovino (ovejas), este negocio lo desarrolla en el su domicilio, desde hace mas de 10 años, que le han permitido adquirir experiencia y clientes fijos.

Margarita desea obtener un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar compra alimento para sus animales  y para realizar mejoras en los corrales para sus animales, ello le permitirá tener seguridad para sus animales y generar ingresos para su hogar 

Margarita es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, que lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos, su deseo es poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Comprar alimento para sus animales y realizar mejoras en sus corrales.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, age 23, runs a clothing business in Mombasa’s Kiembeni estate. Her business has been in operation for the last four years. She and her husband have one child.

She is an existing KADET client and this will be the second loan that she has accessed to help finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more clothes to offer for sale through her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to help support her family. 

Her dream is to own a big clothing store in future

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to offer for sale through her business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Liezel has a retail shop that sells vegetables like eggplant & string beans. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional vegetables for sale.

Liezel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Liezel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of her borrowing group. She is 34 and married to a locksmith. Together with her husband she is raising four children, all of whom attend school. In order to earn additional money to meet family needs, Aigul breeds and raises livestock. She started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. With the profits gained from raising livestock Aigul has been able to improve her family’s living conditions. For example, she purchased a fridge and kitchen furniture. With this loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Aigul hopes to earn enough to be able to purchase a house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: Oscar es un padre trabajador tiene a cargo 2 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad es la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene más de 12 años que tiene este negocio el siempre está pensando en mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. El tiene que levantarse todos los días temprano para empezar a ofrecer sus productos a pesar de que muchas veces hace frio, llueve y hace mucho calor tiene que salir con todos estos elementos en su contra. El financiamiento es para la compra de .
texts.en: Oscar is a hard working father; he has two minor children in his care.  His activity is fruit and vegetable sales.  He’s been in this business for over 12 years.  He is always thinking about ways to improve his family’s living conditions.  He has to rise early every day to start selling his products even though it’s often cold or it rains a lot, or is very hot; he has to go out with all those elements against him.  The financing is to buy fruit.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 39 years old, is a vegetable seller. Her husband is a blacksmith. Their income is $7 per day. She has three children. Two of the children are studying at school. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $15 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy materials to expand her husband's career. In the future, she plans to get a bigger shop for her husband so that doing his career will be easier than now. For her children, she expects to send them to study at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand her husband's blacksmith career

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and married to Charles. They are blessed with one child. For the last two years she has been operating an auto spare parts shop in Nairobi town. 

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. She has been loaned KES.60,000 which she intends to use to add stock of vehicle spare parts for sale.

In future, Mary aspires for her business to expand, grow and become financially stable.

loans.use: To add stock of vehicle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Ma Lucita

texts.es:
La señora Ma Lucita,  vive en un lugar muy cercano de un pueblo que es  muy visitado por personas de otras regiones, ella es casada con el señor  Constancio  y con quine procreo cuatro hijo s que aun están a su responsabilidad.

   Ellas es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  pollos de granja para luego venderlo aliñado en la misma localidad, en esta a actividad lleva  un años y cuatro meses en la que cometa que le va bien  ya que con ello se está apoyando para solventar algunos gastos que  se generan con la educación de sus hijos.

   Lo que lo inspiro ha esta actividad fue su familia para así apoyar a su esposo a sacarlos adelante,  y que mejor que un negocio  como este en ello  también elabora panes para tener más dinero.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda aumentar su ingreso y con el tiempo  temer un lugar en donde pueda vender su  pollo destazados.
texts.en:
Sra. Ma Lucita lives in a place that is near a town that is frequently visited by people from other regions. She is married to Sr. Constancio and has four children who are still her responsibility.

Ma Lucita is a homemaker who is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of farm-raised chickens that she will sell dressed in her town. She has been in business for one year and four months. Ma Lucita says that she has done well and is able to contribute to some of the expenses related to the education of her children.

Ma Lucita’s family inspired her to start this business so that she could help her husband get ahead. What’s even better is that she also makes bread as way of earning more money.

What Ma Lucita desires most is to increase the profits from her business so that in time she will be able to acquire a place where she can sell butchered chickens.

loans.use: to purchase farm-raised chickens that she will sell butchered.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en: Winifred is a 42 year old business woman.  She is single and blessed with one child. For the last three years, she has been selling clothes to earn a living. She has retained her business through financial training offered by Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, she wants to own a boutique. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vests and socks.

loans.use: To buy socks and vests

loans.name: Daysi Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora Daysi, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 14 y 12 años de edad las mismas que estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante. Ella es licenciada en Ciencias de la Educación y trabaja por contrato en una escuela en Santa Ana.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que además de impartir sus conocimientos en la escuela en la cual trabaja también se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días, y los fines de semana vende por su localidad y también les vende a sus compañeras y conocidas en su trabajo, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
>
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank Picoaza meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, an area known for its commercial activities, for the traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history found in its mountains. 

In this place lives Daysi who is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two daughters aged 14 and 12 who both go to school. Her spouse is a merchant. She is licensed in Educational Sciences and is a contractual worker in the Santa Ana school. 

She is a very hardworking woman who, besides sharing her knowledge in the school where she works, also works in the commercial sector. She sells clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works every day, and on the weekends she sells in her local area and she also sells to her friends and co-workers. She gives credit and collects every week or every 15 days. She’s been engaged in this business for two years, and it’s going very well. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and all types of clothing. She has been in the communal bank for two years. She is the treasurer of the bank, and she enjoys it because the payments are easy to make. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Tchédjou

texts.fr: Mariée et ayant 2 enfants, Tchédjou vit avec son mari et leurs enfants, tous scolarisés. Les dépenses familiales sont assurées par son mari. Tchédjou est coiffeuse de profession. Parallèlement, elle y a associé la vente des produits cosmétiques, des mèches, des pagnes et autres, à une clientèle composée essentiellement des habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle effectue ses approvisionnements dans les boutiques des grossistes de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Après quelques ventes, Tchédjou constate qu'elle n'est plus en mesure de satisfaire les demandes d'autres clients, raison pour laquelle elle s'est rapprochée de FINADEV afin d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement. Elle a obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV;le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce prêt lui permettra de faire face aux charges du foyer et d'améliorer la condition de vie sociale et économique de l'ensemble.
texts.en:
Tchédjou is married and has two school-attending children. She lives with her husband and her children. Her husband takes care of the family expenses. 

She's a professional hairdresser, and also sells cosmetics, hair extensions, pagnes (colorful African cloth), and other items, to a clientele comprising mostly people from the area where she lives.

Tchédjou gets her supplies from wholesalers in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. After realizing some sales, she noticed that she's not able to meet customer demand anymore. This is why she contacted Kiva's partner, FINADEV, in order to bolster her purchasing capacity.

She's seeking a loan from FINADEV, whose additional income will help her pay the expenses of her household and improve its social and economic standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 30 dozen of hair extensions

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 33-year-old married man and father of one child. He has worked in transportation for 11 years. Khaled owns a van which he uses to transport people from one place to another. During the summer, he takes tourists all over the Lebanese borders. Khaled has a very good reputation; he works hard to provide his family with a good life and to improve his business.
Khaled is requesting a second loan from A. Majmoua to do the necessary maintenance on his van. Through his previous loan he learned how to be committed to others.
Khaled hopes to improve his business in the future, through trading his van for a bigger bus capable of taking more people.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance on his van

loans.name: Sokunthy

texts.en: Sokunthy is 47 years old, married and has two children. She earns a living as a teacher and supplements her income by farming and raising fish. She has been a teacher for almost 20 years and is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She will use the loan to buy a motorbike to use to commute to and from school. This will reduce her travel time and allow her to devote more time to farming and raising fish.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to use for commuting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two sisters). Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. Madina has a retail business. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. She also generates additional income through welding.

Madina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil for her shop. The main business challenges for Madina include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a married man, 29 years old, with one child. His main business is electrical appliances and he has been doing it for four years. The main challenge in the business is customers not paying back on time. His business goal is to expand his business into new markets and his personal goal is to build a permanent home. Brian needs a loan to procure mobile phones to boost his business.

loans.use: To procure mobile phones.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is married and has a mango sales business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Gertrudes has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more mangoes to sell on her food stall. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from hog raising.
In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Rosaly Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Rosaly, es madre soltera, debido a que lamentablemente su esposo falleció hace unos meses. Ella actualmente sólo se dedica a su hija de 10 años, la cual se encuentra en edad escolar, ambas viven en la casa de la madre de Rosaly, con la finalidad de sacar adelante a su hija y continuar ayudándola para que en algunos años pueda convertirse en una gran profesional, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa y salchipollo desde hace casi ya 7 meses, experiencia que gano desde muy joven cuando ayudaba a sus tías a vender zapatos y otros productos. Cuando ella tuvo a su bebe sintió que su vida cambio y es por eso que demuestra que está dispuesta a hacer muchas cosas para que su pequeña niña y ella puedan continuar viviendo juntas de una manera plena y feliz, sin que les haga falta nada.

Rosaly tiene su negocio en la ciudad de Mala, donde ha encontrado una gran oportunidad de negocio, la cual consiste tener una tienda en el mercado de la ciudad “San Pedro de Mala”, este sueño solo lo logrará si continua mejorando sus ingresos y por ello gracias a los prestatarios Kiva y a su préstamo de S/.2,000 podrá comprar mucha más mercadería, una vitrina y muchos otros materiales para su negocio. Con el transcurso del tiempo y la dedicación necesaria, Rosaly podrá invertir muy bien el dinero que obtenga y podrá realizar su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Rosaly is a single mother who was recently widowed. Now she is taking care of her 10 year old daughter, who's in school, by herself. They both live in Rosaly's mother's house. Her goal is to help her daughter get ahead and to keep supporting her so that when she's older she can become a professional. 

Rosaly has been selling shoes, clothes and salchipollo (chicken with french fries) for almost 7 months, a trade that she learned from a very young age by helping her aunts to sell shoes and other products. When she had her baby she felt like her lived changed, and she's willing to have many jobs so that she and her daughter can continue living a happy and full life together, without lacking for anything. 

Rosaly's business is in the city of Mala, where she has found another good business opportunity - opening a store in the market of the city San Pedro de Mala. She will only achieve this dream if she keeps increasing her income Thanks to the Kiva lenders and her loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will be able to buy a lot more merchandise, a glass display case and other materials for her business. With time and hard work, Rosaly will invest her money well and will be able to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy a glass display case and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is a fish vendor from the town of Getafe, Bohol.  She is a married and the mother of two children.  Her husband works as a fisherman. This is the source of their income.

Melecia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for fishing. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hasamati's Group

texts.en:
Hasamati is a sensible,enterprising and an innocent lady standing to the extreme left hand side in the photograph. She is married and is a blessed mother of two boys.She is a humble resident of a interior village of Koraput district, Odisha,India.The household income of Hasamati is very low for which she does not have access to toilet at her home.And for this reason she is bound to depend upon public toilets and open fields in order to relieve herself.She does not find this practice feasible and safe as she finds herself open to contagious diseases and crimes.

Therefore,Hasamati along with her other group members is requesting for a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it.Access to toilet will enhance Hasamati's safety and hygiene.

Hasamati is in dire need of your help and is eagerly awaiting for the same.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en: Madam Salomey O. sells kitchen supplies including wooden pestles. Pestles work hand-in-hand with wooden mortars:these are used in pounding \\\"fufu\\\" in the Ghanaian society. She wants to include other items such as woven baskets, mortars, canes, fans(\\\"papa\\\" as called in the local dialect). She needs a loan of $700.00 from Kiva to help include these items in her trade. She has skills in loan management and simple record keeping from KSF TEACH product and can therefore manage this loan very well.

loans.use: re-stocking capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is married and has two young children, one is 8 and the other is 3. Her husband is employed by a company that sells pizzas. She started her business selling fast food, such as sandwiches and packed lunches, 2 years ago after the birth of her second child as her husband's salary could no longer cover the extra expenses. She had the opportunity to have the business transferred into her name as the original owner wanted to pass it on. She took it and, with her few savings, fitted it out and bought some of the basic utensils she needed to make food.

Mercedes is asking for a loan of $700 to invest in her business as there are still some raw materials and some utensils that she needs. She promises to repay the loan over a period of 6-12 months. She knows that she must continue to work very hard, but will do so for the sake of her young children. With your help she thinks she will achieve what she wants. Her and all her family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños uno de 8 años y el otro de 3 años, su esposo trabaja como empleado en un negocio de venta de pizzas. Ella empezó con su negocio de venta de comida rápida como tortas, lonches, etc., desde hace dos años, después del nacimiento de su segundo hijo, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no cubría los gastos familiares. Tuvo la oportunidad en ese tiempo de obtener su negocio como traspaso, ya que el dueño original decidió pasarlo a otra persona y ella lo tomó, con sus pocos ahorros lo acondicionó e invirtió en la compra de utensilios básicos que ella requería para hacer sus alimentos.

Mercedes esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 700 para invertir en su negocio, en materia prima y utensilios todo propio del negocio que son cosas que le hacen falta aún, prometiendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses. Ella está consiente que tiene que trabajar mucho aún y lo va a hacer para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y con tu ayuda comenta que lo va a lograr, ella y toda su familia te agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy supplies/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
Shoira has known the trading system since childhood as her father worked in a big store. When Shoira was not able to find a regular, stable job she started selling goods at the market. She is divorced and is raising 2 small children. This year she turned 30.

Shoira sells men’s shoes and every day travels to different markets in kishlaks (villages). MicroInvest loans have helped her to expand the quantity and selection of her products. Shoira plans to use this loan to purchase fall shoes.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоира с детства знает систему торговли так как ее отец работал в большом магазине. Так получилось что не найдя нормальной постоянной работы Шоира стала выходить на базар торговать. Шоира разведена с мужем и воспитывает 2 маленьких детей. В этом году ей исполнилось 30 лет. Шоира продает мужскую обувь, и каждый день с утра она ездит по базарам проходящим по кишлакам. Полученные займы Микроинвест помогли ей расширить количество и ассортимент ее товаров. Очередной займ Шоира собирается потратить на закупку осеннего ассортимента мужской обуви.

loans.use: For purchase of autumn assortment of footwear

loans.name: Awat

texts.en: Awat is 45 years old and lives with one of her children aged 21, while her other children are married and live separately. She sells snacks, beverages, household goods, etc. Her husband, Samin, does odd jobs and has an unfixed income. Therefore, this business is the source of their livelihood. She really would like to receive the $50 loan to complete her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To complete her shop

loans.name: Sirri Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 60 years old, married and the mother of four. Her husband John is retired and no longer able to provide for his family. That's why Rebecca has decided to apply for a loan to start a business. She will use her loan to grow crops like corn, beans and cassava on her plot of land and then sell her produce in the local market. She plans to use the income she makes from farming to pay her children's school fees, build a house and buy the medications she needs for herself.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for the cost of transport

loans.name: Hyasintha

texts.en:
Hyasintha L. sells pots and pans, spatulas and spoons, in fact almost everything except the kitchen sink. She established her housewares business in 2005 and now requires a loan of $900 to purchase additional stock. She is married to husband Bahata who works at a primary school. Hyasintha is a teacher at a high school. She and Bahata have a baby daughter, Faith, who is three months old.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her housewares shop

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Mrs. Dora is 52 years old and married with 4 children. She has a fashion business; she sells clothing and tailors them as well.

Dora needs a loan of $875 to buy a weaving embroidery machine. She started this business in 1976. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy a weaving machine

loans.name: Victoriya

texts.en:
Victoriya owns a small clothing sales business at the bustling Central market in Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for about seven years. Ludmila has proven to be wise with her finances and has built a successful enterprise. She currently makes about $500 per month and has $5500 invested in inventory.

Victoriya has requested a loan to add to her working capital. The clothing sales trade can involve a high amount of inventory turnover. This loan will give Victoriya necessary liquid capital so she can make investments in her business and continue to make good profits.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.en:
Hilda María is 40 years old and is the mother of five children between the ages of 14 and 25 years old, all of whom attend school. Hilda María sells fruits and vegetables, and she proudly claims that her products are sold as quickly as she can stock them. She also sells peanuts, boiled beans, sugar, and other such goods that people in her community need on a daily basis.

Hilda María plans to use this loan to expand her business by adding new kinds of fruits and vegetables. With the loan, she would also like to rent a small local where she can easily run her business. In short, the loan would allow the entrepreneur to increase her sales volume and revenue and, as a result, she will be able to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To acquire fruits, vegetables, and other food products, and to rent space for her small business.

loans.name: Shapari

texts.en: Shapari lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and lives with her own family. She has a retail shop and she has good experience in her business. She already took out a first small loan, completed her stock, and improved her business. Now she has requested her second cycle loan to expand her business further and enlarge her shop to  support her family and make her income better than in the past .

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Zendia 2020-1 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Mary N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan for business expansion.  Mary is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a Sudan People's Liberation Movement (SPLM) officer. She has 3 children ranging in age from 10 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Mary is joined in her small group by Adena K., Asunta R., Jane A., and Dalia A..  Adena K. has a business selling vegetables and wants to open up a shop.  Asunta R. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to expand her business.  Jane A. operates a business selling bread and wants to expand her business.  Dalia A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a lot of materials to keep operating a small beauty salon.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 32 years old and a mother with two children. The children are currently in school. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Lydia.

Lydia wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to sell clothing out of. Lydia is member of the called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Jenny Margoth

texts.es:
Jenny is 40 years old and is the mother of 3 marvelous children that are studying for professional careers in a well-recognized university. Jenny is a primary school teacher by profession and in her husband Jorge she has her greatest support. She earns a living by raising and selling poultry, as well as raising cockfighters which she either rents or sells. She has been doing this work for 10 years. She begins selling the poultry chickens every 25 days, while the cockfighters are major competitors in coliseums. Both the chickens and cockfighters generate good income. She likes this work very much because she socializes and gets to know more about raising the birds. The most difficult thing for her is that she does not have an adequate shed and pens for her birds, so that she keeps all of them in her house. Jenny wants to build a shed, buy chicks and feed, and also build an adequate pen for her cockfighters.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Jenny tiene 40 años, es madre de 3 hijos maravillosos que estudian carreras profesionales en una universidad muy reconocida. Jenny es de profesión profesora de educación primaria y tiene a su esposo Jorge como su mayor apoyo. Se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos de granja, también cría gallos de pelea, los mismos que alquila o vende. Realiza esta labor desde hace 10 años. A sus pollos de granja los empieza a vender cada 25 días, mientras que sus gallos de pelea son grandes competidores en los coliseos; ambos le generan bueno ingresos. Le gusta mucho esta actividad porque socializa y conoce más acerca de la crianza de pollos. Lo más difícil para ella, es no contar con un galpón adecuado y corrales para sus gallos ya que todo lo tiene dentro de su casa. Jenny quiere mandar a construir un galpón, comprar pollos bebes y alimento, además de construir un corral adecuado para sus gallos de pelea.

loans.use: Construction of suitable pens for raising her chickens and fighting cocks

loans.name: Greta Doris

texts.es:
La señora Greta, pertenece al Banco Comunal Indoamerica, ubicado en el Jr. Fiscarral # 246, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Greta tiene 69 años de edad,  es madre de 6 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la confección de mosquiteros y sábanas.

En la actualidad, Greta, continúa confeccionando sus mosquiteros y sábanas, así como también cuenta con el alquiler de habitaciones y por las noches vende comida regional y gaseosa.

 Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 20 metros de tela y productos de primera necesidad para que pueda preparar la comida que vende por las noches.

Greta está feliz de poder pertenecer a un banco comunal, ya que gracias a ello su negocio puede seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Greta belongs to the Indoamerica Community Bank, located in Jr. Fiscarral #246, Calleria district, Ucayali department. Greta is 69 years old and mother to six children. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S. 300, she decided to invest in the manufacture of mosquito nets and blankets.

Currently, Greta continues to make mosquito nets and blankets. She also rents out living spaces and, at night, sells regional cuisine and sodas.

With the loan of S. 1,000, which will be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of 20 meters of fabric and ingredients so that she can prepare the food that she sells at night.

Greta is happy to be able to belong to a community bank since, thanks to it, her business is able to continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of fabric and ingredients.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis T. K. is 33 years old and has managed a pharmacy shop for three years.  Although selling medicine and providing medical advice to many customers is a lucrative business in Ghana, it is also very expensive from a business perspective because all drugs must be purchased from importers.  By buying large quantities of medicine at wholesale prices, however, Francis hopes to increase profitability and provide his customers with better services by expanding his shop.  Therefore, he has joined the Oneymi YIm Trust Group, which allows members to secure financing by guaranteeing loans for one another, and is requesting a loan of $875.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of drugs at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther J. is a tailor who makes various designs for her customers. Esther is happy because the demands for her tailoring services will be high during the upcoming festive season. She is 37 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of 32,000 N to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mrs. Amina B. operates a retail grocery shop that sells a variety of fast moving consumer goods such as toiletries, cereals, and soft drinks, among others. Due to the increased demand for rice in the market and its projected rise in price, Amina is using this loan to purchase sacks of upland rice directly from farmers, at a fair price, that will enable her realize a considerable amount of profit on each sack.

Her business, over the last 12 years, has enabled her to support her husband in the caring of their two children, aged 2 & 6 years old. Her dream is to integrate agricultural activities with her retail business, whereby she would cultivate and then sell her own produce (cereals) in the grocery shop.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of upland rice directly from farmers.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien R., 43, lives in Kampong Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are farmers. They earn money by growing rice and vegetable crops. They have two children, one of whom is married and the other is single and has migrated to Thailand as a construction worker. Because growing crops is their main source of income, Hien R. is asking for a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing the farmland.

loans.use: Buy rice seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida Rosa C. Vílchez tiene 67 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, doña Candida tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 20 años de edad cursa el 5 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 15 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora guarda de seguridad, sus propósitos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio ya que con la medida del tiempo es que ha cambiado ciertas cosas como por ejemplo la cocina es industrial ya que esto contribuye al medio ambiente sus deseos son tener mas recursos económicos para surtir la materia ya que el mantener este tipo de negocio ya que ha sido el trabajo de toda su vida y no quiere perderlo ya que este medio de vida le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse a ella y su familia sus sueños son que sus tortillas sigan obteniendo la misma calidad y tener una variedad de clientes ya que ellos son los encargados de difundir la fama de la excelente calidad de sus tortillas y dentro de sus sueños esta el poder visitar algún país ya que solo los conoce por medio de fotos.

La actividad económica de Doña Candida es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 40 años, Doña Candida inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que su Mama le había enseñado este oficio por lo que decide establecer su propio negocio en su casa de habitación  ya que tenia que satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos y así da comienzo a su venta Doña Candida ofrecía sus tortillas de manera mas favorable para el cliente y así obtiene su fama con los vecinos y sus clientes pero además de vender las tortillas en su casa de habitación decide ofrecerlas por algunas calles y así obtendría mas ingresos para ella y su familia ya que el precio era un poco mas alto por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será para capital de trabajo ya que necesita aprovechar que el precio del maíz se encuentra bajo y así podrá mantener la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa C. V. is 67 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her 20 year old son is in his 5th year of secondary education and her youngest son is 15 years old and is in his 4th year of high school. Her husband is a security guard. Candida's goals are to better supply her business since certain changes have occurred over time, for example she now has an industrial kitchen which contributes to the atmosphere of her business. Her desires are to have more economic resources to supply the materials needed to maintain this type of business. She has been doing this work for her entire life and does not want to lose her business. This way of life provides the necessary income to provide for her and her family. Her dreams are that her tortillas continue to have the same quality and that she will have a variety of clients, since they are the reason her fame has spread for the excellent quality of her tortillas. Among her dreams she wishes to be able to visit another country, which she only knows from pictures. Mrs. Candida's economic activity is the production and sale of tortillas. Her business is located in her home. She has 40 years experience in her business, which she started on her own. She decided to establish her own business in her home after her mother taught her the trade in order to satisfy the need of her children. Candida offers her tortillas to her clients in the most favorable method, and as such has obtained fame with her neighbors and her clients. In addition to selling tortillas from her home, she decided to offer them on certain streets and improve her income for her and her family, since the price was a little higher. Now she needs financing for business capital that she needs to take advantage of the lower price of corn and maintain the raw materials needed to make tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng T., 55, is the mother of two married children. She has a business selling porridge in the Kampong Cham province. On average, she makes around US$8 in revenue per day and her husband earns US$2.50 a day by working as a local teacher. This couple is also supported by their two children who work as farmers.

Mrs. Seng would like to take out a loan of US$700 to purchase more utensils and chairs, in order to increase the amount of porridge she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils and chairs.

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan that is made up of four people, all residents of Battambang Province. Mrs. C. has been selected to be the leader by the members. C.'s age is 36 and she is married with seven children who are studying in the local school. Her husband is a domestic teacher in the education ministry.

C. currently makes a daily income by selling clothes in the village. Most of her clients are villagers. She normally sells her clothes to clients on credit with a specific repayment schedule. C.'s investment is running smoothly and has gained more income. To make more business success and to earn additional revenue, C. is applying for a loan in order to increase her stock of clothing.

The other three borrowers are: S. M., who sells groceries and provides a house-renting service, is looking for a loan to buy grocery inventory to sell; V. is a village dessert seller who is asking for a loan to buy the necessary ingredients for her business activities; and S. P., who earns a living providing small loans to the neighborhood and is asking for a loan as capital in her personal service.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina C. grows pigs in her backyard. She is 46 years old and has four children. Her husband, Richard C. is a farmer. Aside from pigs, the family owns a small rice farm which they use to feed and clothe their family.

She is also an active member of the health workers in their village. She is doing everything she thinks will benefit her and her family, to pay for their growing needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase sacks of hog starter feed and piglets. The loan will help her increase the size of her piggery. In that way, she could have more pigs to sell and more income to earn.

Florentina is one of the thousand Filipino economically active poor helped by CEVI, to start and have their own business. She receives credit, training and insurance coverage from CEVI to help her small business grow.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of hog feed and piglets.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi M. is forty-five years old and married with three children.  She has two years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells to the villagers and the general public three days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva field partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $120.  SPBD loans are Naomi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase carving tools, vanish, paints and brooms.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho.
Agripina es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Agripina junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que luego transporta y vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Agripina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semilla.
Agripina sueña con mejorar su negocio y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the San Miguel de Ayacucho Communal Bank. Agripina is married, is 44 years old and has 3 children. Together with her husband Agripina is dedicated to growing vegetables that she then transports and sells in the supply market in the city of Ayacucho. Agripina needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and seed. Agripina dreams of improving her business and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de harinas de diversos productos; como el maíz, trigo y cebada, los cuales cultiva ella misma y muele en sus propios molinos; también compra al por mayor algunas menestras, las muele y vende en harina. Para esta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es su mano derecha. Adicionalmente, siembran otro tipo de productos agrícolas, y al llegar la época de cosecha, dedican más tiempo a sus cultivos, que luego venden en los mercados de su localidad. Hasta el momento, estas actividades le han generado buenos ingresos y les va muy bien. Por ello, el deseo de Gladys y de su esposo es de incrementar su producción y mejorar las máquinas de molino que poseen. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal y en todo este tiempo ha impulsado el trabajo en equipo del grupo. Gladys está solicitando un préstamo que le servirá en la compra de otra máquina moledora de granos porque la que tiene ya no funciona bien.
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her children in their own home. For three years she has been selling various types of flour such as corn, wheat and barley, of which she cultivates herself and grinds in her own mills. She also purchases some legume, grinds them, and sells in flour form. For that task she counts on the support of her husband, who is her right hand. Additionally, they sow other types of agricultural products and when harvest season arrives, they dedicate more time to their crops, which they later sell in their local markets. Up to now, these activities have generated a good income and business is going well. For these reasons, Gladys and her husband wish to increase their production and improve their mill machines. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to belong to her communal bank, for during all this time, business has advanced for everyone in the group. Gladys is requesting a loan that will go toward the purchase of another mill machine that grinds grains because the one that she has does not work well.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a mill machine

loans.name: Max

texts.es:
Max es artesano y elabora mantas de vicuña para cholitas; trabaja con su esposa y ella comercializa el producto en las ferias populares de la ciudad El Alto. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la Zona Villa Bautista Saavedra de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra materia prima (lana de vicuña e hilo) y de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Max.
texts.en:
Max is an artisan who makes vicuna blankets for little ones. He works with his wife, and she sells the product in fairs that are popular in the city of El Alto. This business is his principal source of income that covers the cost of raising their little son. He lives in a rented house located the Villa Bautista Saavedra zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy raw material (vicuna wool and thread). That way he can satisfy the demand he has in his market. This is his first lone with Impro. The completed evaluation shows that Max qualifies for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vicuna wool and thread for his business of making vicuan blankets

loans.name: Rosario Angelina

texts.es: La Señora Rosario Angelina S. tiene 71 años. Es una mujer casada. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de frutas. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica  a este negocio. Ella inicio su negocio su negocio con muchas dificultades, por que su Mama no quería que trabajara, ya que a la edad que empezó a vender fue a la edad de 15 años, pero esto no detuvo a Rosario por lo que decide realizar financiamientos para que su negocio no decayera, y por medio de estos no perdió su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de mangos, melones, naranjas, tomate y cebollas. El deseo es seguir trabajando para seguir progresando como lo ha hecho hasta los momentos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario Angelina S. is 71 years old and married. She buys and sells fruits for a living, which she has done for the past 6 years. Rosario began her business with much difficulty, as her mother did not want Rosario to work. Rosario was only 15 years old when she started working, but this did not stop her from raising money to support her business. Rosario is requesting a loan in order to buy mangos, melons, oranges, tomatoes, and onions. Her desire is to keep working and keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina S. is from the village of Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Gina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a tricycle' Trisikad" transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to local community members. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair the transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor O., 38, is a modest mother who has two school-aged children. She is a domestic handicraft maker and uses the raw material, rattan, to weave into furniture for sale. In addition, her husband tries to generate money for their family’s daily expenses from fishing.

Besides their current work, the family has a farming business. Sor O. is taking out a loan to purchase a cow which she will use to plow the farmland and then will begin planting various crops. She proposes to raise the cow’s offspring in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a cow which she will use to plow her farmland

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita B. is from the village of Mambajao Camiguin. She is 49 years old. Expedita is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Expedita is starting up a business venture in the service sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing videoke rental in the local community. Expedita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Expedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Expedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Expedita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to enhance the services offered. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Expedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to enhance services offered

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 60 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 20 and 32. Two of her children go to school. Rose owns a three-room house where she lives with four people. There is no electricity or piped water in the home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week, selling to about 30 customers a day. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping in Kikuubo, one the busiest places in Kampala city. The major challenges she faces in her business are transport costs and seasonality.

Rose has been in this business for six years, and with the Kiva field partner, MCDT, also for six years. She is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like sugar, salt and soap. Rose is hoping to see her business grow bigger and wants to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for shop

loans.name: Lerica

texts.en: Lerica M. is from the village of Ospital. She is 48 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Lerica owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month In 2004, Lerica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lerica is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 22nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mirenda

texts.es:
Mirenda es una joven que inicio un negocio de Abarrotes desde hace un año el cual es llamado “Miscelánea Loal”. 
Su padre y su mamá le ayudan con el negocio, este lo puso pensando en ellos ya que son grandes de edad y no pueden conseguir trabajo en otra parte  es por ello que Mirenda preocupada en el bienestar de ellos y agradecida de que fue criada de buena familia quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida una distracción para que no se sientan inútiles por que ellos toda su vida trabajaron para darle una mejor educación a Mirenda. En el negocio ella vende botanas, refrescos, enlatados, jabón de baño, jabón para lavar ropa etc. 
Tiene gran variedad de artículos, pero en este momento ella quiere invertir mas al negocio para cada día vaya progresando y así tener más ganancias y apoyar en la economía de sus padres.
texts.en:
Mirenda is a young woman who started a grocery business a year ago. Her store is called “Miscelánea Loal”.

Her father and mother help with the business. Mirenda kept her parents in mind because they are older and not able to find work elsewhere. She is concerned for their welfare and thankful that she was raised in a good family that strived for a better quality of life. Her parents worked all their lives to provide Mirenda with a good education so that she would not feel useless.

In her business, Mirenda sells snacks, soft drinks, canned goods, bath soaps, laundry detergents, etc. She has a large variety of items, but she wants to invest more into her business so that she can continue to have success each day. She hopes to generate more revenue so that she can support her parents’ financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: John B.

texts.en: Here is John B. B.. John was born in Matamp village in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-six years old, married to a businesswoman and they have six children. John’s children are attending both primary and secondary schools respectively. He wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school related charges for his children

loans.name: Ghulam Rabani

texts.en:
Ghulam Rabani, son of A. M., lives in the 6th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 55, married with seven children - three sons and four daughters. He has a general store where he works with his elder son. He has worked as a shopkeeper since he was young, so he is fully experienced in his career.

He is a responsible father and pays for his sons' and daughters' expenses besides his house costs.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to purchase the things which are much in demand in his market. Also, he wants to have many clients.

He is happy that the loan process supports the ones who need money to progress their businesses.

loans.use: To progress his business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy trabajadora de 49 años, vive con su esposo (Emilio), de 45 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Miguel de 27, Yahir de 22 y Víctor de 11 años; todos ellos viven muy contentos en su casa propia.

Su negocio es la venta de productos de belleza, ella es profesora y enseña en una escuela por las mañanas, estando libre por las tardes, es por ello que decidió emplear este tiempo en algo productivo, pues tiene muchas amigas y vecinas que necesitan de estos productos. 
Para ello, María se inscribió con una conocida empresa de distribución de cosméticos por catálogo, y manos a la obra, comenzó a ofrecer los productos y ahora le va muy bien.
Además de seguir ejerciendo su vocación como maestra, se siente muy a gusto con su negocio propio, aunque le resulta cansado tener que caminar tanto, por lo demás es muy gratificante.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock, además mejorar su material educativo, para trabajar de mejor manera.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking woman who is 49 years old and lives with her husband Emilio, 45, and their 3 children: Miguel (27), Yahir (22) and Victor (11).
