They all live very happily together in their own home. Her business is selling beauty products. She is a teacher and teaches in a school in the mornings and is free in the afternoons. For this reason she decided to use this time doing something productive. She has many friends and neighbors who need these products. To do this, Maria signed up with a well-known company that distributes cosmetics by catalog and, getting down to business, she began to offer the products. Now this business is going very well. In addition, she continues in her position as a teacher. She feels very content having her own business, although as a result she is often tired from having to walk so much, but otherwise it is very rewarding. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with her payments. With the money that she requests she will buy more beauty products to have on hand, and in addition she will improve her educational materials so that she can perform her work in a better way.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: María Petra

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora María Petra M. le está haciendo falta los acabados del interior y exterior. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para  arreglar los cuartos que tiene para rentarlos a estudiantes que vienen de otro lugar, y desea que las personas que le rentan  los departamentos estén cómodas y no tengan ningún problema con la vivienda 
Doña María Petra tiene poco tiempo que se quedo viuda, y su ingreso que obtiene es de las casas y departamentos que renta. Y con los cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. María Petra M. lacks interior and exterior finishes. At the moment, she does not have the money needed to complete these improvements. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to remodel the rooms that she will rent to students who come from other places. She wants to provide her tenants with comfortable accommodations so that they do not experience problems with their housing.

Doña María Petra has been widowed for a very short time, so she earns income from the houses and apartments that she offers for rent. Part of that income will be used to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the interior & exterior finishes on her home

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a 32-year-old single woman without children. She is a petty trader, meaning she sells cloths, linen fabrics and kids clothes. Afia is constrained by access to funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to purchase better quality and larger quantities to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to buy different kinds of fabrics, linen and cloths in bulk. Her greatest desire is to expand her shop and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 38-year-old unmarried man. Since 2000, he has been working in the flooring sector.  Working on a freelance basis, he manages some house projects in his town and its surroundings. Today, Haytham is asking for a loan of $1,200 to replace his tools.

loans.use: To replace tools.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha Y. is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Brak, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support his family. No matter how hard this family works with their field and business, they do not earn enough money. Thus, Mrs. Chantha Y. decided to apply for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business. She is the mother of three children: two attend the local public school while the other is too young for school. 

Mrs. Chantha Y. is the leader for this group which consists of six members from Taok Ma village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. (Mrs. Sok Kong T. could not come for the photo, so her husband is presented instead.)

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Irma es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Irma tiene un puesto en el mercado de Carmen Alto en donde vende calzados y ropa variada, además Irma tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos y medias.
Los sueños de Irma son comprar un carro para ir a las ferias y ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the communal bank Florecer. Irma is 38, and married with 5 children. She has a stand in the Carmen Alto market where she sells shoes and assorted clothing. Besides this Irma has a grocery store in the house. She needs a loan of 1000 soles so the she can buy shoes and stockings. Irma’s dreams are to buy a car so that she can go to the fairs and save money for her children’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and stockings

loans.name: Elton

texts.en: Elton is a visionary and hard-working man. He was previously employed before he started his retail shop, which he has been running for five years. His shop is located in the Kibera slums in Nairobi. He says that his finances have really been transformed since he became a member of Faulu Kenya. He has also been able to pay the school fees for his three children in school. He plans to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and cereals, hence he has requested a loan of Kes. 65,000. He hopes to grow his retail business into selling wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, rice and cereals

loans.name: Rwentuha Women Development, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
B. Angelina is 64 years old and a widow with three children aged 18, 16 and 14 years, all still in school.

Angelina is into the business of selling goats from Kanyanku village, Rukungiri, and her biggest challenge is the thieves that take the goats, especially at night. However, she has been able to employ security and a strong fence.

Angelina is happy that there is a market for the goats she sells and she ensures that she has enough stock on her farm. She buys goats and keeps them for resale later at a better price. She hopes to expand her business further as well as see all her children graduate at university level.

Angelina is such a hardworking lady and she needs a loan to be able to buy more goats for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He completed the primary level of education.

The borrower has a bakery that he wants to develop. He has significant experience in this business and has a two employees. He will use this loan to purchase an electric kneading machine and flour for his shop. This will help him to increase his productivity and his income.

loans.use: Purchase a kneading machine

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis A. S. 38 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja como comerciante de productos varios y junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad. José posee una venta de gas propano, la cual comercializa en el mercado Municipal de Jiquilisco,  en donde abastece a la mayoría de personas del mercado, así mismo a las personas de Jiquilisco, ya que él brinda servicio a domicilio. José solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cilindros de gas propano, ya que cuenta con una gran demanda. José es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que desea mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
José Luis A. S. is 38 years old and resides in the town of Jiquilisco, located in the Department of Usulután. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant selling various products, and their two children (ages 9 and 2). José has a business in the Jiquilisco Municipal Market where he sells propane gas. His business serves most of the people who come to the market as well as the residents of Jiquilisco, since he also provides home service.

José is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy a large quantity of propane gas cylinders, which are in great demand. He is an extremely hardworking person who strives each day to move forward with his family. Therefore, he wants to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase propane gas cylinders

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 48 años, está casada con Lorenzo (50 años), con quien tiene tres hijos, de los cuales vive con dos de ellos en la casa de sus padres. Ella se caracteriza por ser una madre luchadora y abnegada. 

“Con la bendición de Dios todo me va muy bien” manifiesta Maritza, mientras resume que de profesión es docente de nivel inicial y labora en la institución de nombre “María Auxiliadora”, donde es muy querida por su paciencia y bondad.
Asimismo, por las tardes realiza trabajos pastorales en la iglesia de su localidad y paralelamente, en el espacio donde vive, desarrolla servicios de tipeo de documentos, escaneado y fotocopiado desde hace 8 años con la ayuda de sus hijas menores. Ella anhela tener su casa propia, para poder ampliar su negocio, también planea comprar una fotocopiadora profesional para agilizar su trabajo.

Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se compromete a hacer todo lo posible para que su banco comunal marche muy bien y puedan continuar con el trabajo unido que llevan hasta hoy. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales de escritorio (papel y tintas para la impresora).
texts.en:
Maritza is 48 years old and married to Lorenzo (age 50). They have three children, two of whom still live with them in the home of her parents. She is known for being a determined and devoted mother.

“With God’s blessing, everything is going very well,” says Maritza. She resumed her career as a pre-school teacher and works at an institution named “María Auxiliadora”, where she is loved for her patience and kindness. In the afternoons, she does pastoral work at her local church and manages a home business providing document services such as typing, scanning, and photocopying. Maritza started this business eight years ago with the help of her young daughters. She longs to have a house of her own so that she can expand her business. In addition, she plans to buy a professional photocopier to help expedite her work.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She promises to do everything possible to cooperate with her Communal Bank so that they can continue the good work that they have accomplished so far. The money she requested will be used to buy office supplies (paper and ink for her printer).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paper and ink for her printer

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Faïda est composé d’une veuve et de quatre femmes mariées dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et d’activités commerciales  dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres de ce groupe font l’achat et la vente des  produits alimentaires.
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 kg de banane plantain, avec les paysans producteurs de Koutiala au bord du goudron RN6 en face de la grande mosquée de Ségou. La revente se fait à domicile, au marché Château et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou généralement au comptant à une clientèle mixte. 
A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, Madame Oumou C. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera réinvestir dans l’activité et épargner. 
Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle ambitionne entretenir cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Faida Group are comprised of a widow and 4 women of monogamous marriages, with an average age of 32 years and with 3 children. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Segou (the 4th administrative region of Mali). They are connected through ties marriage, neighbors and common business activities at the Chateau market in Sagou . The members of the group buy and resell basic products. In order to increase their operating funds, the group members decided to join the loan program at Soso Yiriwaso for their first group loan. Mrs. Oumou C. plans to use her loan to buy 100 kg of banana plantain from the producing farmers, along route RN6 , near the great mosque of Koutiala in Segou. She will resell her produce from her home, at the Chateua market, and by hawking through the neighborhoods of Segou, usually for cash and to a wide range of clientele. Mrs Ournou C. plans to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA which will be used as capital to reinvest in her business. Like the rest of the group, she finds that working with the Soro Yiriwaso group allows her to increase her operating capital.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of bananas

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
Don José tiene la edad de 49 años, vive en la comunidad Nicaragua Libre, padre de siete hijos, junto a su esposa trabajan para poder cubrir los gastos, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.

El señor José trabaja en servicio de seguridad desde hace tres años, su trabajo que ha ejercido por muchos años es el de albañil por cuenta propia. Su salario es bajo, y las mejora de su casa no son tan frecuente por falta de efectivo. Pero lo que desea hacer de mucha necesidad personal es el baño ya que no tiene la comodidad y seguridad e higiene en su casa debido a los pocos recursos que tiene.
Para esto comprara: piedra, arena, cemento para poder levantar su baño de concreto y lograr un mejor aseo personal para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Jose, 49, lives in the Nicaragua Libre neighborhood. He is the father of seven children. He and his wife, who sells cosmetics, share responsibility for the family's expenses. Don Jose has worked as a security guard for three years. Before that, he was a laborer on construction sites for many years. He earns very little and hasn't been able to consistently maintain his house because he doesn't have the cash to do so. What he most wants is to build a bathroom, a project that would make his house more comfortable and hygenic, but he hasn't had the resources for it. With this loan, he will buy gravel, sand and cement so that he can build a bathroom for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
N. Betty is a 32-year-old mother of two. It’s now a decade since she began her banana-selling business in Yesu Amala, Kampala. She began it with persuasion from close friends and relatives who had come to the realization that her circumstances would improve once she did something that would bring her some income. This was in the wake of her husband’s demise.

With her experience and hard work, Betty has come a long way ever since, fending off the many operational challenges that come with running a business, especially in the outskirts of Kampala. Her business has been generating her profits totaling up to 500,000 shillings a month. With steady income accruing from her business every month, she has managed to give her children an education.

With this loan, Betty wants to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Firdous' Group

texts.en:
Firdous is a very hardworking lady. She is a seamstress and works very hard to financially support her family members: herself, her husband and her seven children. Her husband is a laundryman who also works hard to manage the finances of the family. They both utilize their money to pay the utilities and also to save money for a rainy day.

Seeing their dedication towards their work, their elder daughter has started paying attention to her mother’s work. Therefore, Firdous has applied for a loan from Asasah because she wants to buy a sewing machine for her daughter who is able to work on her own. In this way, Firdos can earn more income and able to fulfill more orders in less time.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine for her sewing business that her daughter will use

loans.name: Rodello

texts.en: Rodello D. is from the village of Hasaan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodello owns and operates a fishing boat, selling fresh fish like gisaw, polutpot and bolinaw in the local community. Rodello has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Rodello joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodello has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rodello is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rodello from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the needs of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish as additional capital

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
el grupo Genesis esta ubicado en el barrio La Redonda El Aguila Jamastran. son personas que tienen varios años de conocerse,  a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la sra. Santos Cristina L. R. se dedica al comercio, Santos cuenta con una pulpería, bici partes y molino.
Cuenta con mas de 8 años en el manejo de este tipo de actividad, y gracias al apoyo financiero que se le ha brindado, Santos ha aprovechado al máximo, ya que su negocio ha crecido significativamente siendo uno de los mas surtidos en la zona.

el sr. Santos Julian L. R. se dedica al comercio y la industria ya que se dedica a lo que es la venta de granos básicos y la elaboración y venta de muebles de madera, actividad que tiene mas de 7 años de venir realizando ininterrumpidamente, en esta aldea no se contaba con Energía Eléctrica y tenia que realizar su trabajos de artesanales de manera rustica costándole mucho mas tiempo darles un mejor acabado. Ahora con la instalación de energía eléctrica Santos Julián piensa en comprar maquinaria eléctrica para hacer mas facil el trabajo de carpinteria.

la sra. Nohemi del Carmen R. se dedica al comercio, Nohemi cuenta con una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de consumo popular desde hace mas de 4 años en su sector son pocos los negocios que existen lo que le permite tener clientela permanente, su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco gracias a la buena administración.

la sra. Karen Yesenia O. se dedica al comercio. vende ropa americana clasificada y nueva, calzado y cosméticos desde hace mas de 3 años siendo la gente de su aldeas y lugares aledaños sus clientes los que visita 4 días a la semana lo que le permite cuidar de su pequeña hija    
Nos esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mercadería y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, presento algunos gastos médicos ya que se le enfermo su niña razón por la cual se descapitalizo.
texts.en:
The group, Genesis, is located in the La Redonda El Aguila Jamastran neighborhood. The members have known each other for many years. The following is a description of the different occupations that they work in: Señorita Santos Cristina L. R. works in sales. Santos owns a general store, a bicycle parts shop, and a mill. She has been in this business for over 8 years and thanks to the financial support that has been offered to her, Santos has taken full advantage of it and has watched her business grow significantly, since it is one of the best stocked shops in the area. Señor Santos Julian L. R. also works in sales and industrials. He works in the sale of basic grains and the elaboration and sale of wood furniture, a sector that he has worked in for over 7 uninterrupted years. In the village, there wasn't electricity and he had to do all of his work manually, which was very time consuming. Now, with electrical installation, Santos Julián wants to purchase electric machinery in order to make his carpentry work easier. Señorita Nohemi del Carmen R. works in sales. Nohemi owns a small general store where she sells popular consumption products for over 4 years. There aren't many similar businesses in her area which allows her to have a permanent and steady flow of regular customers. Her business has been growing little by little thanks to good administration. Señorita Karen Yesenia O. works in sales as well. She has been selling new American clothes, shoes, and cosmetics for over 3 years. Her clients are from her village and surrounding ones. They frequent her business 4 days a week, allowing her to care for her young daughter, Nos. She is seeking a credit to be able to purchase merchandise and as such satisfy her clients' demands. Due to recent medical costs caused by her daughter becoming sick, her earnings decreased.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, sugar, bread, lard, oil, pasta, sauces, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma lives in a small city called Kasur. It is located in Punjab near Lahore Pakistan and famous for its leather industry. She lives in a three room brick house with her family. She moved here after her marriage with M. A. who has been in the milk selling business for the last 20 years. For this purpose he has kept three buffalos at his home. 

Najma is the mother of a daughter who is just 2 years old and has not started to attend school yet. She is a housewife but she also helps her husband in his business by taking care of his buffalos. She offers full support to her husband in his business. 

She has acquired a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy another buffalo to increase the production of milk and to increase his income.  Najma is very much sure that her husband will be able to increase his income by increasing the milk-productivity from the new buffalo. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her third loan cycle.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nueva Esperanza” esta en el 1er. Ciclo del Programa comité de Mujeres en la ciudad de Limpio. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, también se dedica al trabajo de servicios como la empleada domestica.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nélida quien se dedica a la venta de sabanas. 
Ella coloca sus mercaderías preferentemente a crédito ya que fácil con ese método.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad en sus horas libres ya es ama de casa, pero nos comenta que es muy importante para ella vender sus mercadería ya que con el mismo cuenta con un ingreso propio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sabanas.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza committee is in the first stage of the Comite de Mujeres program in the city of Limpio. All the members of the committee work in different fields such as, sales, food preparation and maid services. The members have formed a tight-knit group able to engage in joint activities that enhance their relationships. One of the members is Nelida, sells sheets. She usually sells her goods on credit which makes it easier. She does this in her free time since she is a homemaker. She tells us that it is very important for her to sell these goods since she earns her own income. She is requesting a loan to buy sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange was born in 1980 and is married with two children. She also takes care of one dependent.

Solange is businesswoman but her husband doesn't work. For that reason, she works hard so that she is able to provide all the basic needs of her family.

Solange owns a small business selling various products such as rice, sugar, and so on. She has an experience of four years in her business and she says that her business is profitable in her area. The hours of her business are from five in the morning to nine in the evening every day.

Solange is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more products for her store. With this loan, she expects to earn more profits to use for her family and in her business as well.

With the extra income, Solange will be able to save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Mpasha Bamwe Group B, Ibanda

texts.en: A member of Mpasha Bamwe group, Mataya T. is a hardworking and determined married father of one child.  Mataya has been operating a butchery business for over four years from Mpasha trading centre, Ibanda, having established it with loan money from a financial institution and savings from his previous farming business.  He is requesting this loan to purchase more goats for slaughtering as he looks to increase his profits in order to pay for his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more goats

loans.name: Mary Yaa Nkrumah

texts.en:
Mary Yaa Nkrumah A. extracts palm oil for sale at Abura.  Mary has received junior high education.  She is a widow and has six dependents. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

The picture shows Mary with the palm fruits she is going to use for the preparation of the oil.

loans.use: buy more palm fruit to process into oil

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is from the village of Canibungan Daku Clarin Misamis. She is 53 years old. Alma is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a motorcycle transport services. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Alma is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of herfamily. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia A. B. es una señora de 56 años, ella es la orgullosa dueña de la Tienda de abarrotes “A.”. 
Hace 18 años que abrió su pulpería (tienda general),  sin embargo su negocio no ha crecido lo suficiente por falta de inversión. Es por esa que ella necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra  de  abarrotes  y verdulería, además de otros suministros generales  que necesita para bridar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Credifácil RG S.A
texts.en:
Julia A. B. is a 56 year old lady.  She is the proud owner of “A.” grocery store.

She opened her small grocery store 18 years ago but her business hasn't grown enough due to lack of investment.  This is why she needs a loan for 500,000 colones, so that she can buy groceries and fruit and veg, as well as other general supplies which she needs to provide a better service to her customers.

Julia is a member of the community credit company 'Credifácil R.G.S.A'.

loans.use: To buy groceries, fruit and veg and other supplies

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma R. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 43 years old, married, and has one adult child. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling silver plated necklaces and bracelets in the local community. Her husband drives their multi-purpose cab. Emma is just starting her jewelry business.

In 2010, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase maintenance tools.  Emma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as silver plated anklets and earrings. This loan will be Emma's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional jewelry products

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en: Anhbayar T. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 7-year-old daughter in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver and operates a taxi to support his family, while her daughter attends a primary school. Anhbayar has been operating a barber shop since 2003 and has built a stable and successful operation. Over the years, she has increased her business with many loyal clients. For the future, she hopes to open her own hair salon equipped with the latest technology and tools. She is a modest and honest woman and says, "I am planning to save more money by building this business into a stable operation in order to pay my daughter's tuition fees in the future."  She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car for herself.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements et la restauration.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des produits cosmétiques, des habillements, des condiments alimentaires et du lait.                                                                          BINTOU D. s’approvisionne en habits à Dakar et à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes à Bamako et quotidiennement en ambulante entre les quartiers de la ville de Konobougou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
The women of group Benkadi are all married and average 41 years of age and five children living in traditional extended families in Konobougou City, in Barouéli prefecture, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship.  They do commerce in clothing, and they work in food service. The group members are now on their 12th solidarity loan, which will be used to buy cosmetic products, clothing, condiments, and milk.  

Ms. Bintou D. gets her supplies of clothing in Dakar and in Bamako. Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men, she goes door-to-door each day selling in the different districts of Konobougou City.  

Bintou envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for making the loan payments and for assisting with societal ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her clothing business.

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Susana Vanessa

texts.es:
Susana tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que es conocida en la región Lambayeque por su producción de limón. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella trabaja como profesora en un centro educativo de la zona y adicionalmente se dedica a elaborar postres para ofrecerlos en venta entre los estudiantes de su escuela y el público en general. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a la calidad con la que los prepara. Ella se vale de los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Susana desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos que le permitan ampliar su producción y percibir mayores ganancias por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Susana is 25 years old, she is married and she lives together with her husband and their children in the Olmos district, an agricultural and commercial region. This region is known in Lambayeque for its lemon production. The region belongs to the province of Lambayeque and it is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

She works as a teacher at a school in the area and she also makes desserts that she sells to students in the school and to the general public. Her business enjoys good patronage thanks to the quality of her products. She values the income that she earns through this business because she is able to help her husband provide for the family. 

Susana wishes to expand her business with the acquisition of more ingredients, permitting her to increase production and improve her sales. In order to meet her objective she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 700 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to increase production.

loans.name: Gulnarahan's Group

texts.en:
Gulnarahan T. is the leader of this group.  She is a resident of Nookat, a small village near Osh (south of Kyrgyzstan).  She is 34 and married. She has two daughters and a son.  The daughters are both in school and the son is not yet.  

Gulnarahan works at a school and her husband earns money by providing car repair services.  He earns 4,000 KGSS per month.  With money received from the loan the family wants to purchase auto parts.  In the future Gulnarahan wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Grupo Hatarinas Group

texts.es: Un grupo con el único objetivo de salir adelante y obtener éxitos económicos en sus negocios, así se caracteriza este grupo de emprendedores comerciantes llamado Grupo Hatarinas. Conformado por nueve integrantes en su mayoría mujeres, un grupo de luchadores y entusiastas por salir adelante, a si se caracteriza el Grupo Hatarinas, muestra de ello es la señora María del Carmen de 44 años de edad y madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos aun son menores de edad. Ella se dedica desde muy temprano a la venta de semillas de café que le manda a la capital desde la selva peruana para su venta, y por otra parte también se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa, estos negocios le permiten mantener un equilibrio económico en su hogar ya que actualmente su esposo no cuenta con trabajo estable. En el futuro le gustaría abrir una bodega en su casa y a si poder tener más tiempo para sus hijos y su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para costear los gastos de estudio de su hija mayor.
texts.en:
The "Hatarinas" merchant/entrepreneur group has one goal: to get ahead and be successful in each business endeavor.  The group is comprised of nine people, mainly women.  They are all hard-working and enthusiastic about carving out a future.  

One example of this is María del Carmen who is 44 years old and the mother of three children, two of which are still minors.  From an early age she has had to travel from the Peruvian forest to the capital city to sell coffee beans.  She also sells food out of her home.  Both of these activities have helped her maintain a balanced income for her household since her husband currently does not hold a permanent job.

Her dream is to open a store in her home sometime in the future so she can spend more time taking care of her children and home.  She plans to use the loan to help cover educational expenses for her eldest daughter.

loans.use: To cover educational expenses for her eldest daughter

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is a married woman who was born in 1969. She and her husband, Mr. Sokun, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of the harvested rice and keep the rest to feed their family. Her husband is a duck egg middleman at local market where he can also earn some income to support his family.

Mrs. Sok has some problems because her field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sok is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Cham, Ket S. has been in the farming business for years. She has been planting various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $1 per day. Her husband is a recycling seller. He buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries for a daily income. The used goods he deals in are mostly electrical wires, cans, bottles and plastic. 

Ket S.’s husband uses an old bicycle as a vehicle to pick up his used goods. He's concerned that it is so hard for him to travel far away. To solve this issue, Ket S. is looking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle in order to make her husband's transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle in order to make her husband's transportation easier

loans.name: Utuagiagi

texts.en:
Utuagiagi T. is starting a new business venture, which is raising cattle for sale. Utuagiagi is requesting a loan for 2,500 WST to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Utuagiagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Utuagiagi's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mariatu.  She is single and has 2 boys, aged 7 and 16. She has 1 additional dependent whom she adopted from her relatives living in the provinces. 

For the past 9 years, Mariatu has been selling drinks and provisions such as sugar, milk, ovaltine, margarine, sardines, etc.  Mariatu began this business because she was inspired by the successes of her friend in the same type business, and believed the business can make her self-reliant. She opens her business 7 days a week for 11 hours each day. 

Mariatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy:  50 crates of soft drinks for Le 27,000,1 carton Guinness for Le 85,000, and 30 crates of Star beer for Le 45,000.  

Mariatu plans to build a house and get a well-established bar and restaurant.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer for her business

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 41 years old and married with four kids. She is a farmer and tills land in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for six years. Each month, Mely earns 3,500 PHP from farming.

Mely’s loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to have a stable business and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for an agricultural business.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a kind-hearted lady. She always ready to support her family in their time of need. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s restaurant business. Using the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as chick-peas, cooking oil, rice and spices, etc. in bulk quantity to prepare food for his customers. In his restaurant her husband sells Punjabi dishes called "Nan chanay" (made with chick-peas and served with bread) and chicken biryani (made with rice and chicken and served with yogurt and salad). These are very famous dishes among his customers and people love to eat at his restaurant.   

Shamim also helps her husband in preparing the food besides her household work.  She hopes that her husband’s business will be improved further after the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living in result. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a  book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for restaurant business.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City. He is 54 years old and has four sons and two daughters. 

He and his wife are retired and have been earning money by selling beverages at their door for the past four years.

Sang would like to borrow money to expand his business and hopes that this will enable him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more beverages

loans.name: Atsupui

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, Atsupui est mariée et a 01 enfant. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à son enfant et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à Lomé. Elle a démarré en 2008 et est à son deuxième  cycle de prêt. Son mari est comptable.
texts.en: Atsupui is married, has one child and sells charcoal from her home. As she wants to secure a better future for her child, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise in Lome. She started her business in 2008 and is in her second round of loans. Her husband is an accountant.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a photography and wood lamination business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase a laser printer to be used for her photography and wood lamination business.

Helen has been in this business for 9 years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase a  laser printer to be used in her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and lives near the city of Latacunga in central Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and their two children, aged 9 years and 5 years. 

Rosa is a very open person although she is also a little shy. Rosa works as a farmer alongside her husband. She began working twenty years ago with four chickens and has expanded her business since then. 

This is Rosa’s first loan and she will use it to buy chickens. She believes that this loan will help her family improve in every sense to attain a higher quality of life. Rosa’s dreams for the future including owning her own store and health and a good future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 42, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ador, a laborer, and  mother to her three children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Gina earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the roadside in their community. She also cooks snack food that she sells in the afternoon. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 550 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gina hopes to expand soon and acquire a good place for her store. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a una de las miembros quien se motivo en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una visión de que a través del comité estarían alcanzando el progreso de cada una.
Encantadas aceptaron conformar el comité de mujeres emprendedoras nombrándolo Maria Auxiliadora, el cual está integrado por 12 miembros. Estas señoras son muy unidas y de esta forma trabajan en grupo, dentro de un ambiente de mutuo respeto y cooperación. Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
La señora Blanca se dedica a las ventas desde hace muchos años, por medio de esto ella ha logrado salir adelante y obtener mayores ingresos para paliar los gastos de la casa. Ella vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser ropas, zapatos, sábanas, frazadas y demás. Tiene muchos clientes, los cuales siempre compran de ella. Uno de sus sueños es tener un local en su casa donde pueda ofrecer los productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frazadas, sabanas, ropas para la posterior venta. Ella está muy agradecida a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to one of the members who was motivated by the idea of producing good for her fellow members which arose from a vision that through the committee they’d be attaining progress for each and every one of them.

They were thrilled to be part of the committee of enterprising women that they called “María Auxiliadora” and that has 12 members.  These ladies are quite united and work this way in the group within an environment of mutual respect and cooperation.  They all have the hope to continue striving to get ahead seeking progress for each of them and for their community.

Blanca has been in sales for many years.  Through this she’s managed to get ahead and obtain increased income to manage household expenses.  She sells all sorts of merchandise like clothes, shoes, sheets, blankets and others.  She has many customers who always buy from her.  One of her dreams is to have home-based locale from which to sell her items.

She asks for the loan to buy blankets, sheets and clothes to resell.  She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it’s provided her.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets, footwear, clothing and others.

loans.name: Mayra Rafaela

texts.es: Mayra Rafaela tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que posee este medio de vida. Ella es una persona emprendedora por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes. El motivo de crédito es para la compra de ropa en general, perfumes, calzado, cremas, body, tratamientos. Sueña con aumentar cada día su inventario para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Mayra Rafaela has a business selling general merchandise.  She has had this means of living for more than five years.  She is an entrepreneurial person, who is always keeping an eye on what her customers want.

The reason for the loan is to buy clothes in general, perfumes, footwear, creams, and body products.

She dreams of growing her inventory on a daily basis to get more earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothes in general, perfumes, footwear, creams, and body products.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
African artwork and crafts are Marcel’s specialty. Coming to the US from DRC as a refugee four years ago gave him the opportunity to start his own business. In March 2010, after Marcel worked with a non-profit that produced and commercialized African crafts, he decided to use his connections with African artisans to sell their artwork as a formal business. He purchases the crafts in bulk from Africa or local artists and sells them at shows on the weekend, since he works at another job during the week. Marcel made this dream from his passion as an artist, and his business helps support his wife and six children.  

Marcel is trying to formalize his business and is using this loan from Accion USA to set up a website, which will enable him to sell products on weekdays.

loans.use: To start a business website and purchase artwork in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy different kinds of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Ahlidin

texts.ru: Ахлидин житель района Кумсангир. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Ахлидин имеет среднее образование. Он у себя дома занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота и теленка.
texts.en: Ahlidin lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 56 years old, married and has seven children.  Ahlidin has a secondary education.  He is involved in breeding cattle at home.  He primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  Ahlidin has been in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of cattle and a calf.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle and a calf

loans.name: David Nguyai

texts.en:
David practices mixed farming. He used his previous loan to buy a dairy goat, which has given him a good income. He paid off his previous loan on time without default. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. David will use the loan to buy animal feed and seedlings for his farm.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and seedlings.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with 7 school going children. Her husband is a technician who contributes to the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Amina has operated a firewood selling business for the past 2 years; her clients are her neighbors and friends.  She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Amina wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 25 years. She is 47 years old, and she and her husband Samuel have four children attending school. 

Mercy was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In the future, Mercy hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, DVDs, TVs, shoes, satellite dishes.

loans.name: Rwenyonyozi Tukore Group

texts.en:
Christine, 35, set forth in the farming business under the financial auspices of her husband a decade ago. Christine's courage, tenacity, and pro-activeness have seen her make great strides. What acts as this mother of four's second source of income is her retail shop. Week in, week out, her sales add up to 50,000 UGX.
Christine says she intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase better manure for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase better manure for her farm.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is single with two children who are 6 and 12 years old. They are attending school and live at home. 

Florence has been selling used clothing for the past 15 years. She says sometimes customer response to her business is slow. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business.

In the future she wants to become a international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Athou

texts.en:
Athou is a 40-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business selling at a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two year.
Athou is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar, and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Keiry Lilibeth

texts.es:
La Joven Keiry de 24 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, tiene un hijo que depende de ella y su pareja. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado ubicado en un barrio en la comunidad de San Lorenzo.
Keiry maneja su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado ubicado en San Lorenzo, ahí ella atiende a sus clientes que a diario le visitan, esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar  adornos, ropa de señora y calzado ya que en esta época del día de las madres se vende bastante este tipo de producto. Con las ganancias pretende seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que es la fuente principal de ingresos de su familia.
Keiry su sueño es tener su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de adornos, ropa de señora y calzado para su negocio

loans.name: Jesulome Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESULOME est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée  André (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 50 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. André est marié a une revendeuse du nom de Marguerite. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. André vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, André achète des moutons qu'il revend depuis trente-quatre ans à son domicile. André s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité André ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESULOME sollicite pour la sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont étés bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des moutons.

loans.name: Celsetine

texts.en:
Celestine is a 28-year-old farmer. She is a mother who is hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. She is a smallholder farmer based in Mosombor, Nandihills area of Kenya, which is a town near the famous Rift valley escarpment. Celestine and her husband are blessed with a lovely family. 

Celestine has been a farmer for more than ten years. She keeps poultry for eggs and cows for milk and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Celestine is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Nandihills. 

Celestine is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Celestine seeks to continue growing a variety of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Nandihills is very high. 
In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Vincentia

texts.en: Madam Vincentia H. is a wholesaler of fresh tomatoes. She buys tomatoes from Techiman, Bolgatanga, or Burkina Faso. She needs money to increase her stock. She is therefore seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva and promises to pay back in due time. Her commitment to hardwork cannot be doubted.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nadjafgulu

texts.en:
Nadjafgulu has been in the business of cattle breeding for 14 years. He breeds calves. 
He was born in 1950 in the Salyan region.  He is married and has 3 children.
With this business, he is able to meet the financial demands of his family.
He requests a loan of $500 to buy fodder for his calves.

loans.use: to buy fodder

loans.name: Nzué

texts.en: Nzué E. A. is a 49-year-old widowed woman. She lives in Port Bouet in the south of Abidjan district. Nzué E. A. has 5 children, among them two daugthers who work with her in her business. Nzué E. A. has been in this activity for more than 25 years and has been able to provide financial support to her family since she lost her husband years ago. Nzué E. A. wants to develop her activity and acquire a modern electrical sewing machine. This will allow her to be competitive and increase her revenues. She got her first loan from AE&I in June, 2005. She is a good performer.

loans.use: Nzué Epouse Andi will use the loan to purchase a new sewing machine and stock of clothes

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Munira has been a MicroInvest client for more than 2 years. Over this time, big changes happened in her life. In the past, Munira had no house of her own. Since she started her business, by putting aside a fraction of the profits, Munira was able to buy a parcel of land and begin a house construction. Munira, 35 is married and has 3 children. Her husband has no permanent job and puts all his efforts to help her wife in her challenging business. Munira buys dried apricots and pit. She and her family then sort the purchases and re-sell them based on the sorted grades. With help of MicroInvest loans, Munira significantly increased the asset value of her business. Following Munira’s advice, many other women, who sell dried fruits, became MicroInvest borrowers. Now, Munira asks for a new loan to purchase dried fruits.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Более 2 лет Мунира является клиентом Микроинвест. За это время в ее жизни произошли большие изменения. Раньше у нее не было своего собственного дома. Занимаясь бизнесом и откладывая прибыль она смогла купить участок земли и начала постройку дома. Мунире 35 лет, она замужем и у нее 3 детей. У ее мужа нету постоянной работы и он всеми силами старается помочь своей жене в ее нелегком бизнесе. Мунира покупает сушеный абрикос и его косточки, она и ее семья сортируют купленное и затем продают по сортам. С помощью займов Микроинвест Мунира значительно увеличила активы своего бизнеса, следуя ее совету, многие женщины, торгующие сухофруктами, пришли в Микроинвест и получили займы. Сейчас она просит новый займ для закупки сухофруктов.

loans.use: to purchase dried apricot and pit

loans.name: Cucum

texts.en: Cucum is 33  years old and is married. She runs a business selling clothes on credit, and usually goes around the village to sell her products. Her husband, Upandi, is a bus driver in Jakarta. She is happy to be a member of MBK because she can expand her business. She wants to get a $50 loan to be used to buy more goods. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hilaria Juliana

texts.es:
Hilaria is 32. She tends a small stand at the Santa Barbara market where she sells cooked vegetables and legumes. Thanks to her good cheer and hard work she has earned a loyal base of satisfied customers. Through daily toil she has been able to cover the medical expenses of her elderly mother, Guillermina, who she so lovingly cares for in their humble home. Hilaria dreams of improving their dwelling. To do so, she would like to expand her product line and increase her sales, so she is asking for a loan. With your help she may soon see her dreams fulfilled.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

En un pequeño puesto del mercado Santa Bárbara, encontramos a Hilaria de 32 años de edad, ofreciendo muy entusiasta sus menestras cocidas, negocio que por su carisma, popularidad y amabilidad con la que se desempeña diariamente está obteniendo asiduos clientes y muchas satisfacciones.Gracias a esta labor ha cubierto los gastos de salud de su querida y anciana madre, Guillermina, a quién muy cariñosamente cuida y protege en las instalaciones de su humilde morada.Ella desea ampliar y aumentar la variedad de sus productos , con el fin de ahorrar lo suficiente para terminar de refaccionar su humilde casita y sobre todo ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su amorosa madre. Para cumplir sus anhelos Hilaria solicita un préstamo con el que gracias a tu colaboración podrá cumplir en muy corto tiempo su propósito.

loans.use: To expand a line of cooked vegetables.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: My name is Yasmeen A.. I was married four years ago and live with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am a member of my loan group for the past two years and have already acquired two loans for my husband’s business of selling blankets and rugs. He sells these items on his bicycle by roaming about in various parts of the city. With the profits, by investing loans earlier, I bought a TV and a washing machine for myself. Now we need a loan to expand our business. I will save the extra profits from this expansion for my husband’s sister marriage and will buy her a few beautiful expensive gifts.

loans.use: Expand blanket business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Mrs. Faith I. is an LAPO client. She sells fish and provisions (such as biscuits in cartons). She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 39 years old and married with 4 children.

Faith needs a loan of $700 to buy more fish and provisions to sell. She studied the business for 6 weeks and started her own in 2005.

loans.use: To buy more fish and provisions for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to the communal bank "Women towards Progress," located in Callería, Ucayali in Peru. She is 46 years old, and the mother of five children, two of whom are still dependent on her, and she is married. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in food sales.

Currently, she continues to sell food and juices, and she also sells merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and jewelry. She gets up very early to go to the market to buy what she needs for her business, and in the afternoon, she goes out to sell her merchandise (clothing).

With this loan for $700, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase a blender and a juicer, utensils for juice-making such as glasses, a display case, plastics, and the rest she will invest in buying clothing.

Maribel is very happy now that she can contribute to paying her household expenses and the education of her children, who are her greatest joy. Her husband, too, is happy for the advances they have made and they are very grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maribel pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en Prolongación Cahuide Nº 248, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años es madre de 5 hijos, dos aún dependen de ella y es casada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad continúa con la venta de comida, jugos y también vende mercadería como ropa, cosméticos y alhajas. Se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar lo que le hace falta para su negocio y por las tardes sale a vender su mercadería (ropa).

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 licuadora, 1 extractora, implementos para la juguería como vasos, 1 vitrina, plásticos y el resto D. capital lo invertirá en la compra de ropa.

Maribel está muy feliz, ahora puede contribuir en los gastos de su hogar y en la educación de sus hijos, que son su mayor alegría. Su esposo también se siente feliz por ella por los logros que está obteniendo y está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado.

loans.use: Purchase of assets (blender, extractor, glasses, case) and purchase of clothing

loans.name: Neema's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Neema A. is a 24-year-old married mother of one living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. To help support her five-year-old child, she sells cloth from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day. Her hard work earns her family about $60 a month.

Neema hopes to expand her business, which is why she has applied for a group loan of $1,125 U.S. dollars. Her loan partners, Asha A. and Ashura I., have their own businesses selling cloth and charcoal. Neema has taken out two successful loans in the past, so she is confident that they will be able to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more cloth items for her business.

loans.name: Nor Din

texts.en: Nor Din lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of  one son. He has a retail shop. He took out his first cycle loan and started up his business, and now he wants to take his second cycle individual loan to complete his stock so as to attract more customers and make a good income to help his family. He wants to make a better future for his son. He is happy that he has been able to start up a business with his first loan and that now he can continue to grow his business with a second loan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Suhir

texts.id:
Suhir's daily activity as a recycler of used items. Every morning he has to go and search for used items to be collected. The location he usually went are areas around where he lives, Patih Jelantik street, and also Denpasar area. He usually works from morning till evening. After a short break, he sorted the used items according to type. Afterwards he brought them to the collection place and weigh them for sales. This 23 year old young men hopes he could be given the capital, so that he could buy used items to be resold, and not only searching for already thrown away items as he is doing now.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Suhir adalah sebagai pemulung atau pengumpul barang-barang bekas. Setiap pagi dia sudah harus berangkat mencari barang bekas untuk dikumpulkan. Lokasi yang biasanya dia lalui adalah kawasan sekitar tempat tinggalnya, di Jl.Patih Jelantik dan juga di kawasan Denpasar. Biasanya dia bekerja dari pagi sampai siang. Setelah beristirahat sebentar, dia melanjutkan dengan menyaring dan memisahkan barang bekas menurut jenisnya. Setelah itu, dia membawa ke tempat pengumpulan dan menimbang lalu menjualnya. Pemuda 23 tahun ini berharap bisa diberi bantuan modal, sehingga nantinya dia bisa membeli barang bekas kemudian menjualnya lagi, tidak hanya mencari seperti yang dia lakukan sekarang.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Gulijon

texts.ru:
Gulijon H. lives in the Vakhsh region. She is married and has one son. She is 29 years old and has been growing watermelons for 2 years. The melons have now ripened and they need to be harvested and driven to the market. This requires the rental of a truck and the purchase of gasoline. Gulijon plans to take out a loan for this purpose, which she will pay back over a 12 month period. This will help her to complete the harvest quicker and to earn a profit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайруллоева Гулиджон жительница района Вахш. Замужем и имеет одного сына. В возрасте 29 лет она уже 2 года занимается выращиванием арбузов. Бахчевые поспели и их необходимо собирать и вывозить на базар. Но для этого нужно арендовать грузовую машину и закупить ГСМ. Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит , погасить который сможет в течении 6 месяцев. Это поможет быстрее реализовать урожай и получить прибыль.

loans.use: Purchase gasoline and rent a truck

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mr. Vannak D. is a villager in B'er Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Yatdek Uk, is a garment worker. They have three children, two of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Since Mr. Vannak D. and his wife’s workplace are far from their house, Mr. Vannak D. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike to travel to work. In the past, Mr. Vannak D. has obtained a loan from AMK to increase his profits and to build a new house. This loan has been fully repaid. His wife is shown on right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to work.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco is 35 years of age and lives with his wife and two children. He has made coffins since childhood and, during those years, his father taught him the trade he inherited and that, today, allows him to support his family. Marco has made his coffins for 15 years and always is dedicated to making new models and better paints. He gives all of his time to this business. In winter, he usually reduces his wood supply because he has to plan ahead and buy all of his materials in advance. The goal of his efforts is to have something better for his family.

Marco asks for a loan that he will invest responsibly in wood to avoid the difficulties of the season. His goal is to have a large full-service funeral parlor.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco tiene 35 años y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la fabricación de ataúdes y fue enseñado durante todos estos años por su padre que le heredó este oficio, que hoy en día le permite sostener a su familia. Marco viene fabricando sus ataúdes desde hace 15 años y siempre esta al pendiente en la elaboración de nuevos modelos y mejores pinturas, a este negocio le se dedica tiempo completo, en época de invierno suele bajar el abastecimiento de madera por la cual Marco tiene que anticiparse y comprar todos sus insumos por adelantado. El motivo de su esfuerzo es porque desea tener algo mejor para su familia.

Marco solicita un crédito que invertirá responsablemente en implementarse de madera y evitar las dificultades de la temporada, su meta es tener una gran funeraria que ofrezca todos los servicios.

loans.use: The Purchase of Raw Material for the Making of his Coffins

loans.name: Mercedes Gisela

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal  Las Lomas de Yarina, ubicado en el Jr. Madre de Dios, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Mercedes tiene 32 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en productos de belleza.

Mercedes, en la actualidad continúa con la venta de productos de belleza y mercadería de ropa y sábanas.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de mercadería de ropa sólo para damas como 1 docena de short , 1 ½  docena de polos y 1 ½  docena de sábana y  edredones y  también productos de belleza como sombras, talco, perfumes y cremas.
 
Mercedes se siente muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo del banco comunal de Manuela Ramos ya que gracias a ello puede seguir surgiendo en su negocio y así mismo puede darle educación a su señorita hija quien está estudiando.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes belongs to the Community Bank “Las Lomas de Yarina,” located at Jr. Madre de Dios in the District of Calleria, in the Department Ucayali. Mercedes is 32 years old and she is the mother of two children. With the first loan of S/. 300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in beauty products. At this time, Mercedes is continuing with the sales of beauty products and is also selling clothing and sheets. With this loan of S/. 1,500, which she would repay in 4 months, she would invest in the purchase of women’s clothing, for example one dozen pairs of shorts, one and a half dozen polo shirts, and one and a half dozen sheets and blankets, and also beauty products like eye shadows, talcum powder, perfumes, and cremes. Mercedes feels very happy to be able to have the help of the Community Bank of Manuela Ramos, and thanks to this she is able to continue improving her business and thus be able to give an education to her daughter, who is studying in school.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of beauty products and clothing

loans.name: Mrs. Doeur Sina's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of fourteen members who live in Trapeang AnC. Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Doeur S. is the village bank president. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory in order to meet her customers' demands. 

Her husband, Mr. Tuy Phearun, is a motorbike taxi-driver who makes a small income to support his family. Mrs. Doeur S. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school. The youngest one, age four, is too young to work or study. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on their loans until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Phoen

texts.en: Mr. Phoen C. is 39 years old, married, and has four children who all attend a local school. The family lives in the Trapaing Chrey village in Kandal Province. Mr. Phoen C. is a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Yan Nhey, is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on a small piece of land that she owns. Unfortunately, her business has suffered from problems related to the low fertility of the soil and the large amount of pests that inhabit the area and damage the crops. In order to deal with these problems, Mr. Phoen C. is now asking for a loan to be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make his wife's agriculture business more productive.
