loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to increase agricultural productivity

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Ines tiene 22 años, convive con su pareja y su hija de 3 años llamada Abigail. Cuando empezó a vivir con su pareja, con el deseo de aportar ingresos a su hogar incursionó en el negocio de la venta de zapatillas y otras prendas, el puesto que  tiene está junto al de su suegra, la cual la apoyó para iniciarse en este negocio. Lo que le gusta es apoyar en la economía familiar y sentirse útil, es por eso que le pone todas las ganas y esfuerzo para hacer que su negocio prospere. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos y hacer que su familia tenga mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ines is 22 years old, lives with her husband and her daughter of 3 years named Abigail. When she started living with her husband, she desired to provide income for their home so she started her business selling sandals and other apparel. She shares the stand with her mother-in-law, who supported her in starting the business. What she likes about her work is supporting the family economically and feeling useful. For this reason, she puts all of her will and effort into making her business prosperous. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will purchase a larger quantity of merchandise to increase her earnings and make sure that her family has better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase the merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: Mrs. Ul S. lives in Bro Youk village in Kampong Cham province. She is a recycling collector. She now wants to buy more products for recycling such as empty bottles, cans, plastic and so on. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Him Phoeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Ul S. is a mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy more recycling products

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Hace doce años aproximadamente que Fortunata dedica gran parte de su tiempo a prepara y vender frituras por las noches en la puerta de su casa. Su rutina empieza a partir de las cinco de la tarde. Por las mañanas ella se dedica a su casa y en parte a descansar.

Anteriormente ella vendía embutidos en un mercado, pero a su edad ella siente que ya no puede hacer tanto esfuerzo físico, y solo se dedica a vender por las noches. Ahora que sus  hijos son independientes solo se preocupa por mantener los gastos de la casa y de ella.

Aunque en su actual trabajo le vaya bien, ella quisiera abrir una tienda en su casa, pues de todos modos el cocinar sigue requiriendo mucho esfuerzo de su parte.
texts.en:
For nearly twelve years, Fortunata has prepared and sold fried foods at night in front of her home. Her routine begins after five o’clock in the afternoon. In the mornings, she is devoted to her home and partly to rest. Previously, she sold sausages in a market; however, at her age she feels that she can no longer exert as much physical effort and only sells at night. Now that her children are independent, she is only concerned about the cost of maintaining housing costs and her own personal costs. Although her current work is doing well, she would like to open a store in her home because cooking still requires much effort on her part.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the basics that she needs for her business

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan C. owns an internet cafe. He is 26 years old and married and has no child. He operates an internet shop in his village. Most of his customers are students who conduct internet research for their school assignments, wives chatting with their spouses working abroad, and children hooked on computer digital games.

He is also a client of CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner). He is requesting an additional loan of Php 5,000 to buy additional computer parts. He is planning to add computers. In this way, he could accommodate more customers in his shop.

CEVI partners with entrepreneurs to grow their businesses. They give all their clients not just credit assistance, but also trainings, savings and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To buy additional computers
